loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: St Hilda Women Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 31 years old, married, with four children, and is a member of St Hilda Women Group, living in Kasese, Uganda. Sarah is a poultry farmer and also sells produce, such as dried beans, peas, G-nuts, and maize to make income for her family. 

Sarah has a dream of expanding her poultry business and becoming the biggest supplier of eggs in the area. However, she is faced with the challenges of limited capital and market competition. 

Sarah wants money to buy poultry feed and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and  beans to sell.

loans.name: Jose Vecir

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 5 hijos, estudió hasta 5° grado de educación básica, debido al conflicto armado en el país tuvo que dejar de estudiar, su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y su hijos viven con él.

José es comerciante desde que tenía 12 años de edad, trabajo con sus padres que siempre tuvieron un negocio. Él se dedica a la venta de especias y condimentos. Toma un autobús que lo lleva a la capital, donde comprar su producto al mayoreo y luego regresa a su casa para preparar las bolsitas individuales que vende a $0.10 centavos. Recorre cantones y municipios vecinos en su motocicleta para vender su producto, en ocasiones cubre una distancia de 150 kilómetros para vender.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar tres lbs especias combinadas, tres de pimienta, tres de comino, tres de canela, mostaza, tubitos de pegamento instantáneo y maíz. José espera que sus hijos estudien y se formen en una profesión para que se ganen la vida de manera más fácil, quiere mejorar su casa y comprar 4 vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
José, 56, is in a relationship and has 5 children. He stayed in education until 5th grade of basic education but because of the armed conflict in his country he had to quit his studies. His partner is a housewife and only she and the children live with him. 

José is a merchant. Since he was 12 years old he worked with his parents who always had a shop. He sells spices and condiments. He takes a bus to the capital, where he buys his produce from a wholesaler and then returns home to prepare the individual sachets which he sells for $0.10. He goes through neighbourhoods and neighbouring communities on his motorbike to sell his products, sometimes travelling 150 kilometres to sell. 

He is asking for a loan to buy three pounds of mixed spices, three of cumin, three of cinnamon, mustard, tubes of super-glue and corn. José hopes that his children will study and train in a profession which will allow them to earn a living more easily. He wants to improve his house and buy 4 dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy three pounds of mixed spices, three of cumin, three of cinnamon, mustard, tubes of superglue and corn

loans.name: Mwenda's Group

texts.en:
Mwenda is a thirty-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She is a single mother of five children, three of whom are in school. In addition to growing trees, Mwenda also cultivates maize and cowpeas and supports her family with farming.

She decided to join Komaza to earn money from the sale of trees. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to pay school fees and build a good house for her family. Mwenda’s favorite part about working with Komaza is relishing the strong partnership with Komaza.

Mwenda is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
Maria es una joven de campo que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos, cerdos y peces.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar para comprar algunos animales para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón para albergarlos.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
María is a young woman from the country who has had to overcome many adversities in her life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to come out ahead and continue progressing with her family.

For a long time, she has wanted to begin a business breeding and selling chickens, pigs, and fish. It is because of this that she is requesting a great economic encouragement from Kiva lenders and the Interactuar Corporación to purchase some animals to breed and materials for the construction of a shed to house them.

With this new business, she will be able to generate a higher income for her family, which is everything to her, and she will be able to improve her parents’ quality of life.

She will work every day to drive her business and make it a sustainable and profitable business.

Support a hard-working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase some animals to breed and materials for the construction of a shed.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, su esposo es empleado. Desde que abandonó la escuela trabajó en diversas actividades con su madre para apoyar a la familia con los gastos del hogar, trabajó también como empleada doméstica pero hoy en día solo se dedica a cuidar a su hijo y a los oficios del hogar.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar mano de obra para construir una pared en su vivienda, está deteriorada y teme por la seguridad de la familia. Sus sueños es que su hijo termine sus estudios, mejorar la casa y que a su esposo nunca le falte trabajo.
texts.en:
María, 27 years old, is married and has one child who is 2 years old. Her husband is employed. Since she abandoned school, she has worked in a varied of activities with her mother to support her family with home expenses. She also worked as a domestic worker but now she only dedicates herself to caring for her son and her home.

She is requesting the loan to purchase construction materials and to pay labor costs to construct a wall for her home. It is deteriorated and she fears for her family’s security. Her dreams are that her son finishes his studies, to improve her home, and that her husband never lacks work.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and to pay labor costs to construct a wall for her home.

loans.name: Francisco Aldemir

texts.es: Francisco de 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto con su esposa, el posee un taller de carpintería ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, el está  solicitando un crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco, 38 years old, lives in his own home with his wife.

He owns a carpentry shop located in his home, and he has had this business for several years. 

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and other materials, so that he can attract more clients. In this way, he will be able to achieve his goal of improving the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and other materials.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es: Ríos de Agua Viva es un grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socias laboriosas que tomaron la iniciativa para volver a solicitar los financiamientos de la institución Adim con el fin de seguir mejorando sus niveles de vidas y la de su familia. Este grupo lo coordina la señora Zoila quien tiene la edad de 40 años, soltera se dedica a la comercialización de bisuterías en su localidad de manera ambulante, este negocio lo impulso hace más de veinte años y este crédito lo solicita para la compra de aretes, cadenas, pulseras, brazaletes, prensa de cabello, relojes, lazos de colores, trabas pequeñas y medianas, etc. La segunda socia  es Eufemia de 55 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta bisuterías, Marlene tiene la de edad de 57 años y comercializa productos variados como bisuterías y Jeanette tiene la edad de 42 años y su negocio es la venta de bisuterías en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Ríos de Agua Viva is a communal banking group made up of four hard-working members who took the initiative to request loans from Kiva partner Adim with the aim of continuing to improve their quality of life and that of their families.  This group is led by Zoila, who is 40 years old, single, and works selling costume jewelry in her town as a walking salesperson.  She began this business more than 20 years ago and she is asking for a loan in order to purchase earrings, necklaces, bracelets, armbands, hair accessories, watches, colored hair ties, small and medium fasteners, etc.  

The second member is Eufemia. She is 55 years old and works selling costume jewelry as well.  Marlene is 57 and works selling varied products such as jewelry. Jeanette, the fourth member, is 42 years old, she sells costume jewelry, and she runs her business out of her home.

loans.use: to purchase earrings, necklaces, bracelets, armbands, hair accessories, watches, colored hair ties, small and medium fasteners, etc.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Hello there! The above picture presents to you Everlyne, who lives in the Nandihills area of Kenya, also known as the Home of Champions because it produces so many elite runners who have broken so many world records. 

Everlyne is the mother of two lovely angel-looking boys and has been doing farming for the past ten years. Through dairy farming and poultry keeping, she has been able to produce milk and eggs. Everlyne is a very dedicated farmer who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every bit of farming because, through farming, she is able to take care of her family’s needs and wants.  Everlyne also runs the only posho mill in her village. Although she experiences challenges in farming, her attitude keeps her going. Enjoying what she does, she has even nicknamed her cow. 

Everlyne is seeking a 50,000 KES loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forages. This assists the animal in digestion and prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food. With the loan, she would be able to increase her milk productivity and also increase her income levels, hence reducing the poverty level that is currently facing her. Everlyne’s biggest dream is to get out of this poverty level, and this loan will be a stepping stone toward improving the living standards of her family and increasing her income level.

loans.use: buy a chaffcutter

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and power bills.

For the past two years, Kazungu has operated  a school giving education to the pupils in the community.  She faces a challenge of competition from other competitors.  With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she  wants to purchase chairs and desks for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy school chairs & desks

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Isah, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: pay expenses until he can sell his crops

loans.name: Alh Usaini

texts.en: Alh Usaini is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh Usaini would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh Usaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Alh Usaini expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: pay expenses until he can sell his crops

loans.name: Yohanna Mani

texts.en: Yohanna Mani is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yohanna Mani joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Suzana, Dabora and Akimu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohanna Mani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna Mani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yohanna Mani  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: pay expenses until he sells his crops

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Asa, Amina and Juspine.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Haruna  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: pay expenses until he sells his crops

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en: Salisu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Salisu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Zahardini, Musa and Fa'Iza.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Salisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salisu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Salisu  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: pay expenses until he sells his crops

loans.name: Lucia Concepcion

texts.es: Lucia de 39 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tamales de elote, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ella vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y esta solicitando un credito para la compra de elotes por mayor para poder tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucia is 39 years old and for many years she has worked in producing and selling corn tamales.  She sells them by foot in the different neighborhoods in the region.  She lives in her own home with her husband.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy corn in bulk so that she can generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos nietos, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace varios años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Juana is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her two grandchildren. She has made a living making clothes for several years, and her workshop is located in her residence. She has many customers due to the quality of her clothing. She is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc. so that she can continue her work that generates good profits.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Agriculture is fundamental to Kenya's economy. But it is much more than an economic activity. Farmers like Joan are stewards of Kenya’s countryside and provide the citizens with the option of buying locally-produced food. 

Joan started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his 1 acre, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines and motorcycles, to help her run the farm. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops such as maize. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population. 

Joan is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Joan will have more space to expand her business output. 

The money from this investment will be put back into the business to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her two children who are in public schools. 

She feels blessed to have the support of her handsome husband through all her undertakings. Make a $25 loan, and push Joan’s dream closer to reality.

loans.use: to purchase more land for farming

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos ya mayores de edad de 22, 0 y 18 años de edad, además vive con ellos su nieto de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida como cocinera de mariscos en una playa cercana, además su compañero de vida y sus hijos le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar. Guadalupe desea construir columnas en su vivienda, y así poder levantar posteriormente las paredes para construir un cuarto en su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para construir columnas en su vivienda, y así iniciar la construcción de su vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 46 years old and lives in a house with her husband and their three children.  Their children are 22 years old, 18 years old, and the third is less than one year old.  She also lives with her grandson who is 3 years old.

She is a hard worker and earns her living by working as a chef in a seafood restaurant at a nearby beach.  Her husband and her children also help pay the household expenses.

Guadalupe wants to build columns in her house to further raise the walls in order to build a room. She is seeking a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and manual labor to build columns in her house.  This will be the first step in the construction and the entire project will be completed little by little.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and manual labor in order to construct columns for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Tinatini

texts.en:
Tinatini is a 40-year-old married woman who takes much effort in her family's welfare. She lives with her husband and son. Both are private workers and generate 150-200 GEL. 

Tinatini is a really hard worker who has developed an agribusiness, and does her best to make financial stability for her family. She cultivates a family-owned vineyard, and also a plot of land where she harvests maize and takes care of cattle and pigs. Tinatini always has high quality products and sells them in a local market.
 
In order to make her work more productive, Tinatini decided to start dairy farming, and purchase sheep. She requested a loan from local financial institutions and was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. She will purchase sheep, and produce milk products for local selling and will also sell lambs at a good price.

The loan will greatly assist Tinatini, and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: To start dairy farming and purchase sheep

loans.name: Jibrin

texts.en:
Jibrin is a Babban Gona Farmers Organization maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jibrin would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jibrin can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Jibrin expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 61 años de edad, está casado y tiene 7 hijos todos independientes y con su propia familia. No estudió su esposa es ama de casa y además de ella un nieto de 8 años de edad vive con él.

Pedro ha sido agricultor toda su vida, desde hace más de 10 años trabajo con su esposa en el sacrificio de cerdos y reses para venta de su carne ya que poseen los permisos necesarios para esta labor y lo apoyan dos hijos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos pequeños y engordarlos para el sacrificio y venta de su carne, ya cuenta el lugar donde los tendrá. Pedro sueña con tener su propia granja porcina, para dar el cuido a los animales él mismo desde que nacen así no tener que estar comprando.
texts.en:
Pedro is 61 years old, he is married and has 7 independent children who have their own families. He did not study, his wife is a housewife and an 8 year old grandchild also lives with them.

Pedro has been a farmer all his life, for more than 10 years he has worked with his wife slaughtering pigs and cows to and sell the meat, as he has the necessary permits for this work. Two of his children help him.

He is asking for a loan to buy small pigs and fatten them for slaughter and the sale of their meat, as he has space where he can keep them. He dreams of having his own pig farm, to care for the animals himself from birth and not have to buy them.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and fatten them for slaughter and the sale of their meat.

loans.name: Samaila Alhaji

texts.en:
Samaila Alhaji is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila Alhaji joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hamza, Buhari and Shamsiya.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila Alhaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila Alhaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Samaila Alhaji spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for the children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Las Mariposas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Alejandra is one of the members of Las Mariposas (The Butterflies) 1 & 2. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. These 10 women are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community.

Alejandra makes her home in a simple structure with her two children. She is a single mother, and her children are attending school. Alejandra is excited to be taking out her tenth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She runs a beauty salon, and this loan is intended for purchasing miscellaneous hair and beauty supplies. She is also producing hair products and she sells them to her clients in her beauty salon.

She will use the profits to cover her home expenses and to provide her children what they need. Also, she is planning to reinvest in the success of her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products

loans.name: Todo Se Puede 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yesenia is one of the members in the group, Todo Se Puede (Everything is possible) 1, 2 & 3. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child. Her most difficult challenge was to finish studying for her university career.

Yesenia is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva field partner, Esperanza International Dominican Republic, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. Yesenia and her husband run an Internet cafe, which they started almost two months ago, when Yesenia's husband bought a computer and decided to get more at a low cost and provide this service to their community. 

With income from this business and an investment with her first Esperanza International loan, the business is running very well and Yesenia could study to be a beautician. Now, with this loan, she will start her beauty salon next to the Internet cafe. She will buy hair and beauty products, a hair dryer, a chair for clients, a blower, brushes, and other equipment.

Yesenia is excited to open her beauty salon and start working on one of her passions. Her dream is to have a successful business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Cándida, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Turbo, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante ubicado en su casa.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Cándida ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Cándida is a modest and hard-working woman that has dedicated a large part of her life to the care of her children. She lives in Turbo where she earns a living preparing various meals - such as lunches and breakfasts - in a small restaurant located in her house.

Her meals are well known by her neighbors in the region who visit her restaurant because they know they will be able to eat a delicious meal.

Cándida has decided to improve her business and grow her sales.  This is why she is seeking a loan. She will use it to buy ingredients and supplies for her recipes.

This loan will help her grow her business and make the necessary income that gives her the opportunity to continue supporting her family and her business.

Support this woman with a loan and make her dreams come true!

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her recipes.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Caroline has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay her for items bought on credit.

With this 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans and to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un joven campesino de 30 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de zanahoria y papa, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de El Carmen de Viboral, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. 

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y asi mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Rodrigo, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a young farmer that is 30 years old.  He is a humble, hard-working man. He has worked on farms since he was a child and is thankful to all that he learned from his parents.

This has enabled him to progress and today he has his own carrot and potato crops. He works the land every day and he sells all that he harvests in the market in El Carmen de Viboral.  Additionally, he works as a laborer on different farms in the area. This helps complement his income, which he uses for the welfare of his parents who both struggle to get by.

With this loan from Corporación Interactuar, he will buy agricultural supplies in bulk such as fertilizers, pesticides, and others.  He will then be able to continue growing his crops, he will increase his harvest, he will have a bigger production, and he will be able to improve his income when he sells his products.

Rodrigo, with his entrepreneurial spirit, his strength, and his tenacity, wants to continue fighting to reach his goals of having his own farm.  He wants to grow a larger variety of products and increase the profitability of his business, which would guarantee economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in bulk, such as fertilizers, pesticides, and others.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sani joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Thomas and La'Azaru.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Sani spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for the children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gruhalaxmi Group

texts.en:
Nandini, the lady standing with raised hand in the photo, is a hardworking, active and confident woman from village Damjhar of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Her age is 37 and she is residing with her husband, a son of 19 years, and a daughter of 17 years old. Damjhar is a remotely located village located in the poorest area of India.

Nandini has a turmeric cultivation farm of 2 hectares with a deep bore well facility being managed by her husband for the last six years. Along with turmeric she has also cultivated different types of vegetables like brinjal (eggplant), cauliflower, cabbage, chilly, ladies finger etc. in her farm. She sells this produce in a nearby town 20 kilometers distant. 

From the above two businesses, Nandini earns a monthly income of 6000 INR. With this scanty income Nandini somehow maintains her family. She says, “I want to expand my business and cultivation but due to lack of proper fencing of the farm it is not possible to utilize the whole of the area. 

After Mahashakti started their intervention in her village, Nandini, along with 14 other women from her village, formed a Self Help Group named Gruhalaxmi and Nandini took out a loan of 12,000 INR. With this loan she will purchase stone, bricks and cement and barbed wire for a strong fencing of her farm, so that she can use the entire area for cultivation and earn more income for her family. 

Nandini has big dreams of the marriage of her daughter, higher education for her son, and converting her small farm into a big one. Among the other 14 members, eight members are doing vegetable cultivation, two members have a general store, another two have a rice huller and the other two have milk businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing stone, bricks, cement, and barbed wire for a strong fence around her farm

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María de 53 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta bachillerato, tomo la decisión de no comprometerse a una vida en pareja, por lo que vive con su madre.

María trabaja en un chalet, ayudándola a una amiga tiene varios años de trabajar con ella y le paga por prestar sus servicios, también tiene un negocio en su casa que maneja su madre. Diariamente camina 500 mts para llegar al lugar de trabajo a las 6:00 am y sale a las 2:00 pm.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para su tienda, aprovechando la temporada navideña que es cuando más las personas quieren comprar artículos de temporada como adornos, bebidas productos de cocina. María espera resulte su inversión para mantener las ventas estables en su negocio y poder cubrir los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old, she is single and has no children. She studied to high school level. She took the decision to not commit to a life with a partner, so she lives with her mother.

María works in a snack bar, helping a friend. She has worked with her friend for several years and is paid for her work, she also has a business in her house which her mother manages. Every day she walks 500m to arrive at her workplace at 6am and she leaves at 2pm.

She is asking for a loan to buy produce for her shop, taking advantage of the Christmas period, which is when people most want to buy seasonal items like decorations, drinks and cooking products. María hopes that the result of her investment will be to keep sales stable in her business and be able to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy decorations, drinks and cooking products.

loans.name: Ayaga Yaro

texts.en:
Ayaga Yaro is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayaga Yaro would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayaga Yaro can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Ayaga Yaro expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure his children, Khalid, Ali and Habiba, are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zangu

texts.en:
Zangi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Zangi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Nasiru, Mujahidu and Safiya.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zangi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zangi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Zangi spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children and to eventually to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for the children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Indede

texts.en:
Indede is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Indede would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Indede can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Indede is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Nuhu, Afiniki and Elisha.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Samaila  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for the children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saratu Uwani

texts.en:
Saratu Uwani is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu Uwani would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu Uwani can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Saratu Uwani, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jamilu, Zahara and Hassan.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Musa  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products, cosmetics, clothing, etc.

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en:
La'azarus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. La'azarus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Lami, Hauwa and Amina.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azarus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, La'azarus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, La'azarus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Angela a sus 46 años de edad, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo y por necesidad económica se motiva a independizarse y conseguir ingresos por su cuenta, por eso desea iniciar un negocio de comidas rápidas que estará ubicado en una esquina muy transitada del barrio donde reside en municipio de Bello.

Ella desea ofrecer en su negocio arepas de queso, patacones de plátano, chorizos con arepa, butifarras, arepas de chócolo, gaseosas entre otros, con esto espera conseguir los recursos necesarios para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. 

Angela es una señora trabajadora, pujante, emprendedora, solicita el crédito como apoyo para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (sillas, carpa) e insumos para elaborar los alimentos (carnes frías, aceite, arepas, plátanos, gaseosas) para tener disponibilidad y variedad de productos que satisfagan los gustos de todos sus clientes, de esta forma podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.

Gracias al apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar y a los prestamistas de Kiva podrá montar este negocio y conseguirá ser independiente.
texts.en:
Angela, 46, is a hardworking, strong, enterprising woman.  She wants to become independent to earn her own income because of financial need and a lack of job opportunities.  That's why she wants to start a fast food business that will be located on a very busy corner of the neighborhood where she lives in the town of Bello.

In her business she wants to sell cheese "arepas" [corn pancakes], patacones [fried plantains], chorizo arepas, Catalan sausage, corn arepas, soda, and other things.  With that she hopes to earn the resources she needs to satisfy her basic needs.

Angela's requesting the loan to support a purchase of fixed assets (tables and chairs) and ingredients to make her dishes (cold cuts, oil, arepas, plantains, soda) to have a variety of products available to satisfy the desires of all her customers.  That way she'll be able to have a better quality of life and greater well-being.

Thanks to the support of Corporación Interactuar and of Kiva lenders she'll be able to set up this business and become independent.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets such as tables and chairs, and ingredients to make the dishes

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 47 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 2 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de sus ventas.

Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio con la ayuda de Interactuar y en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten. 

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Luz, at 47 years of age, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works in her own business, a grocery store that she began out of the need to generate income in order to help her family get ahead. 

Despite adversities, she has the strength and determination to pull herself up and move forward, and thanks to these efforts she has been working in this field for two years. 

Her goal in life is to continue progressing and for that she wants to strengthen her business, using a loan to purchase a range of supplies such as snacks, grains, fruit, soft drinks, and in general basic family food products.  In this way she will be able to offer her customers the best quality and service, and will be able to notably increase her sales and the income that she receives from sales. 

Luz states that her greatest desire is to continue growing her business with the help of Kiva field partner Interactuar and in the future she wants to convert her business into a supermarket in which her customers can find all of the products that they need. 

By supporting this credit you will be contributing to the empowerment of Colombian women!

loans.use: to purchase a range of supplies such as snacks, grains, fruit, soft drinks, and in general basic family food products.

loans.name: Wo Fee Ekome Group

texts.en:
The Wo Fee Ekome ('let us be one') Group consists of four members who live in Chorkor, Accra, Ghana. They have applied for a loan of GHS 5,100 from ID Ghana to invest in underwear,  assorted soaps, second-hand clothing and slippers. 

Florence is a 36-year-old, single woman who lives in Chorkor, Accra, Ghana with her three children. She is the featured borrower. She has been selling underwear for seven years.  Currently, she wants to buy more underwear, but she doesn't have enough capital. She decided to apply for a loan of GHS 1,400 from ID Ghana in order to purchase more underwear to sell to customers. Florence looks forward to improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mirna Morelia

texts.es:
Mirna de 58 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos de 28, 25, 23 y gemelos de 18 años de edad, ella estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su esposo murió hace algunos años, solo vive con sus hijos gemelos ambos estudian sus otros hijos también la apoyan.

Mirna es comerciante, en su casa tiene una negocio en el que vende productos de cocina, al ser la única en la zona tiene una fuerte demanda de productos, también tiene un molino de nixtamal; tiene un camión que maneja su hijo en el que transporta materiales. Ella trabaja de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm.

Solicita el préstamo pagar gastos médicos, ha tenido problemas de salud y por el momento no tiene el dinero. Espera recuperarse para seguir trabajando y estar pendiente de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirna is 58 years old. She is a widow and has five adult children (ages 28, 25, 23 and 18-year-old twins). She studied until the 9th grade. Her husband died several years ago and she only lives with her twins, who are in school. Her other children help her financially.

Mirna has a business at home, where she sells cooking products. As this is the only business in the area, there is strong demand for her products. She also has a corn grinder and a truck that one her son uses for transporting materials. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. 

She is requesting the loan to pay for medical expenses. She has health problems and does not have the money for the treatment at the moment. She hopes to recover to be able to continue working and look after her children.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Farangiz

texts.ru:
Фарангис уроженка села Шахристан. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. В настоящее время занимается воспитанием маленького ребёнка. Её старший сын учится в медицинском колледже. Она обратилась в МДО Арванд за кредитом для оплаты учебы сына. 
Она заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Farangiz is a native of Shahriston.   She is married and she has three children.  At the moment she is raising her youngest child.  Her oldest son is a medical student.  She has turned to MDO Arvand to request a loan to pay her son's university tuition.  She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, who leads the Woodworkers of Jesus artisan collective in El Salvador, specializes in the hand-carving and painting of naif style crafts. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood, paint and brushes. Maria has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story: "I am from the warm and beautiful country of El Salvador. Surrounded by mountains, it is a privileged place in the shadow of the Cerro Miramundo with the coolness of the Cerro el Pital. Tourists interested in handicrafts visit our area in the Department of Chalatenango. My designs are created with great care and delicacy. Before they are finished, they pass through the hands of designers, carpenters, painters, varnishers and packers. For the most part, these people combine their craft work with their domestic chores. This lets them take care of their families while earning an income, which permits a better quality of life for the family and community." "Thank you for your support through this microcredit. It means I'll be able to stock up on raw materials and have constant work to do." Use the link below to view Maria's hand-painted pinewood carvings on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7916

loans.use: to invest in the bulk purchase of wood, paint and brushes.

loans.name: Balazhon

texts.ru: Балажон, 59 лет, женат. У Балажона- высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи он занимается животноводством, стартовав 35 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Балажона, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 1 бычок, 1 нетель и 20 овец. Балажон в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку клевера для скота. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт сарая для скота.
texts.en: Balazhon is 59 years old and married.  He has a higher education.  He has been raising livestock for the past 35 years, and this activity constitutes his family's main source of income.  Thanks to his very hard work, he currently owns four cows, one young bull, one heifer and 20 sheep.  In order to further grow his business, he has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 25,000 som (KGS).  He will use this loan to buy clover as forage for his livestock.  He is planning to reinvest the earnings from his loan into further increasing his number of domestic animals.  He is also planning to save enough money to repair the barn where he keeps his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase clover as forage for his livestock.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es: Solicita el préstamo para comprar artículos navideños para el negocio que tiene con sus esposo, aprovechando la temporada navideña. Espera le resulte la inversión y mantener estables la ventas en sus negocios que son su principal fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
She is asking for a loan to buy Christmas items for the business she has with her husband, making the most of the Christmas season. 
She hopes that she will get the investment and that she will be able to keep her sales steady in her businesses which are her main source of income.

loans.use: to buy Christmas items for her business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria, junto a su esposo ha podido formar una unidad familiar y productiva bastante fuerte, ya que no solo prima el amor si no también los deseos de salir adelante y progresar como familia.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y pollos de levante, es una actividad aprendida de su esposo quien actualmente se dedica a esta actividad y ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos durante mucho tiempo.

Ella pide un auxilio económico para comprar algunos cerdos pequeños e irlos cuidando y criando para posteriormente venderlos.

Es una mujer soñadora y con gran voluntad, tanto así que ya piensa en grande y desea tener una marranera con gran capacidad.

Tiene gran ilusión y expectativa con este proyecto y confía en el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Maria, together with her husband, has been able to create a close-knit and productive family that is very strong such that not only does love abound but also a desire to get ahead and to progress together as a family.

She works raising and selling pigs and chickens, which is a business activity that she learned from her husband who currently works in this field as well.  This has been the main source of income for a long time. 

She is asking for economic assistance in order to purchase some small pigs that she will care for and raise in order to later sell them. 

She is a dreamer with great will, so much so that she is thinking big and wants to have a large capacity hog operation.

She has great hopes and desires for this project and is confident in the good heart of the Kiva lenders who will help her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase some small pigs that she will care for and raise in order to later sell them.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es: Doris, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea del municipio de Las Flores, Lempira. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva 10 años de hacer sus propias parcelas de cultivo de maíz y frijol, el cual vende en el mercado  local de la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizar su cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Su plan es ampliar el cultivo para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doris is 35 years old, lives in a common-law relationship with her husband, has a son and resides in a small village in the municipality of Las Flores, Lempira.  She has always worked in agriculture.  It has taken her ten years to make her own plot of land for the cultivation of corn and beans which she sells in the local area market. 

She has asked for a loan of 5,000 lempiras in order to buy manure and to fertilize her crop of corn and beans.  Her plan is to increase the crop in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and to fertilize her crop of corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized laminate, wood, nails, cement, sand and gravel to construct a hallway that connects with the bathroom.

loans.name: Estefanny

texts.es:
Estefanny es una mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es emprendedora, inteligente, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo y responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio constante en todas las áreas de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo; con una temperatura durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Estefanny es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo amarrado, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní que ya no utiliza y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que se dedican a la venta de comida, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la sastrería; sabe cortar, proporcionar, y coser bien la ropa. Es buena sastre porque es entendida, hábil, y fiel en su oficio, la cual sabe muy bien coser, juntar los pedazos, repulgar, echar ribetes, y hacer vestidos conforme a la proporción del cuerpo: pone alamares y cayreles, al fin hace todo lo que tenga en su poder para dejar contentos a los dueños de las ropas. “mi trabajo es mi pasión, llevo realizando ropa desde que soy muy joven, ahora tengo mi taller de costura en un lugar de la casa de mis padres y me va muy bien…” comenta. su sueño es tener su casa propia donde instalar un taller de sastrería, ella desea realizar la compra de materiales de trabajo por mayor, como; telas, tijeras, agujas, hilos, reglas, etc., para equipar bien su negocio y estar preparada para los clientes de temporada. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Estefanny solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de sastrería por mayor para equipar su negocio y estar preparada para las ventas de temporada.
texts.en:
Estefanny is a 21 year old single woman with no children, who has a seamstress business. She is enterprising, intelligent, happy, optimistic, responsible, with a positive attitude and dedicated to her work. Her business is located in the southern zone of the city, an area known for constant business in all areas. The climate here is warm, tropical and humid, with a daytime temperature of 21-35 degrees centigrade throughout the year.

Estefanny has an olive complexion, long dark hair, medium height, and her first language is guarani which she doesn't use today, and her second language is Spanish which she uses in business. She lives with her parents who sell food. They live in a brick home with drinkable water and electricity.

Her business is a seamstress shop. She knows how to cut, proportion, and sew well the clothing. She is a good seamstress because she is talented, understanding, and faithful to her work, which she knows very well how to sew, along with piecing, trims, hems and making uniforms to a body's proportions. She does what needs to be done in order to satisfy her customers. She states, "My work is my passion. I have been doing it since I was very young. Now I have my own seamstress shop in my parent's home and it is going very well."

Her dream is to have her own home with her shop located there. She wishes to buy materials at wholesale such as fabric, needles, thread, rulers,etc. to better equip her business and be prepared for her customers for the upcoming season's sales.

This is the second loan sequence with the institution in 5 years that she has had this business. It is for these reasons that Estefanny seeks a loan to buy materials at wholesale to equip her business and be prepared for her customers for the upcoming season's sales.

loans.use: to buy materials for her seamstress business and to be prepared for the upcoming season's sales.

loans.name: Alfred's Group

texts.en:
Alfred is a 60-year-old proud father of 7 children. He is the group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Alfred has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Alfred described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Alfred’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay back another, higher-interest debt.

loans.name: Fredis Osman

texts.es: Fredis, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Petoa, Santa Barbara. Fredis trabajo por varios años en una maquila y hace 6 años quedo sin empleo y con las prestaciones sociales que recibió instaló su propio negocio de una pulpería, para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser frijoles, arroz, manteca, harina, azúcar, pan, huevos, cereales, condimentos, refrescos, embutidos, carnes, churros, y otros abarrotes. Ha mantenido el negocio con la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar mas productos alimenticios como granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, embutidos, carnes, churros, productos de aseo,  pan, y refrescos, para mantener siempre surtida la pulpería y vender. A futuro piensa en remodelar su vivienda para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Fredis is 42 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner. They have two children and live in a small village in the Petoa municipality in Santa Barbara. Fredis worked for various years in a factory but lost his job six years ago. With the social benefits he received he started his own small grocery store to sell staple goods such as beans, rice, lard, flour, sugar, bread, eggs, cereals, condiments, sodas, cold cuts, meats, fried dough and other groceries.

He has maintained his business with various loan investments. Currently he asks for another loan of 20,000 Lempiras to buy more food products, such as basic grains, sugar, lard, cold cuts, meats, fried dough, toiletries, bread, sodas to stock his grocery store and to sell.  

In the future he plans to renovate his home so that his family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products such as basic grains, sugar, lard, cold cuts, meats, fried dough, toiletries, bread and sodas.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза 36 летняя замужняя женщина из городка Турсунзаде. Она вежливая и общительная женщина. Ее муж гастарбайтер в Российской Федерации.  Она живет вместе с тремя детьми. Фируза дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она на дому принимает заказы. Данное ремесло она освоила еще в юности и по сей день своим ремеслом в дом приносит источник дохода. Причина по которой Фируза обратилась за кредитом является приобретение новой швейной машинки. Ей не хватает $2000, чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку марки "Janome". Она надеется, что ей помогу и она сможет купить машинку и продолжить работу.
texts.en: Firuza is a 36-year-old married woman from the city of Tursunzoda.  She is polite and sociable.  Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia.  Firuza lives with her three children and sews women's clothes from home.  She takes orders at home.  She learned this craft in her youth and, to this day, this activity still constitutes a source of income for the family.  Firuza has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine.  She is missing 2,000 USD to buy a new "Janome" sewing machine.  She is hoping to receive some support, so that she can make this purchase and continue her activity.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern, sewing machine.

loans.name: Neftali Antonio

texts.es: Neftalí de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida y su hija de 9 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando con su apoyo. Él es un hombre emprendedor que al no tener un empleo decidió hace 8 años dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de pan francés y pan dulce, actividad que le ha permitido brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, por lo que se siente muy satisfecho. La vivienda de Neftalí carece de las condiciones adecuadas para su servicio sanitario, ya que como se observa en la fotografía el servicio sanitario solo está cubierto con una cortina y tela metálica, por lo que él desea construir un  cuarto que le permita tener una mayor privacidad, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y lámina para construir un cuarto para el servicio sanitario.
texts.en: Neftalí is 38 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and 9 year old daughter who is attending school with his support. He is an enterprising man that upon not having a job 8 years ago decided to make and sell French bread and sweet bread, and activity that has permitted him to provide better living conditions to his family, for which he feels very satisfied.  Neftalí's home deserves adequate conditions for the bathroom, as you can see in the photograph the bathroom is only covered with a curtain and metal roof, so he would like to build a room that will permit one to have greater privacy. Therefore he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and laminate to build a room for the bathroom.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and laminate to build a room for the bathroom.

loans.name: Silvia Yaneth

texts.es:
Silvia de 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 8 y 4 años de edad, solo estudió hasta 7° de educación básica, no continuo por la inseguridad que había en aquel tiempo debido al conflicto armado y sus padres decidieron que dejara de estudiar. Su esposo es chofer de una ruta de buses.

Cuando Silvia dejo de estudiar apoyó a su madre con la venta de tortillas y a su padre en los trabajos agrícolas, hoy en día cuida a sus tres hijos y apoya a su esposo en la siembra y cuidando una novilla.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta que facilitara a Silvia el transporte cuando tenga que ir al pueblo tenga alguna emergencia. Silvia espera dar estudio completo a sus hijos y quiere comprar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Silvia is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children ages 13, 8 and 4. She only completed a 7th grade education and didn't continue for the insecurity that existed during that time due to the armed conflict and her parents decided that she would leave school.

Her husband is a bus driver. When Silvia stopped studying she supported her mom with the selling of tortillas and her father with the farming chores. Today she takes care of her three children and supports her husband with the planting and taking care of a heifer.

She seeks a loan to buy a motorbike that will enable Silvia to have transportation when she goes to town for some emergency. Silvia hopes to provide her children an education and she wants to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es una mujer edad madura que lleva mucho tiempo divorciada y ha tenido 4 hijos Ella vive sola en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad y afortunadamente no tiene ningún defecto Mariva es profesora de primaria Marina necesita un prestamo para concluir su vivienda pues esta en la fase de vaciado de losas Marina no tiene a quien acudir, sus hijos tienen sus propios gastos pero al menos ella goza de buena salud y con un trabajo estable
texts.en:
Marina is an older woman who has been divorced for many years and has had four children.  She lives alone in La Paz in a brick and cement home which is her own and fortunately does not have any defects.  Marina is an elementary school teacher.  She needs a loan in order to finish her house since 
she is at the stage where it has been dug and the cement floors poured, but the rest needs to be built.  However, she does not have anyone who can help her financially.  Her children have their own expenses.  However, she at least enjoys good health and a stable job.

loans.use: To finish her house, which has a foundation and cement floors but is unfinished.

loans.name: Nery Alexander

texts.es:
Nery de 33 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, su pareja es ama de casa y se encarga de administrar una tienda que inicio con su pareja y que está ubicada en el centro del caserío. 

Nery es agricultor desde pequeño, aprendió trabajando con su padre, cultiva maíz y frijol pero también parte de su tiempo lo dedica a la tienda que inicio con su esposa hace ya dos años.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar bebidas, condimentos y otros productos de cocina, son los que más se venden en esta temporada por estar próxima la navidad y no cuenta con dinero suficiente para comprar debido a los gastos que tuvo cosechando.

El sueño de Nery es proveer siempre a su familia de las cosas necesarias para vivir.
texts.en:
Nery is 33 years old, married with two children. His partner is a homemaker and manages the store that they decided to set up in the center of their village. 

Nery has been farming since he was little, and learned by working with his father. He grows corn and beans, but also dedicates part of his time to the store he opened with his wife two years ago. 

He is requesting this loan to buy drinks, condiments and other cooking products, those that sell the most during this season leading up to Christmas. He doesn’t have sufficient funds to buy stock because of the expenses he had while harvesting. 

Nery’s dream is to always be able to provide for his family all the things they need to live.

loans.use: to buy drinks, condiments and other cooking products.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: María de 66 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su nieta de 18 años y su hermano desde hace algunos años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 8 años tomo la decisión de instalar un molino de nixtamal y una tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda y es gracias a ello que sostiene la economía de su hogar, además su hermano le aporta para los gastos económicos. En la vivienda de María se encuentra una pared que está bastante deteriorada como se observa en la fotografía, y ella tiene el temor que en cualquier momento se pueda dar un accidente, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y pagará mano de obra para reparar la pared de su vivienda, que se encuentra deteriorada.
texts.en:
María is 66 years old and has lived in her own house with her 18 year old grand-daughter and her brother for a number of years. She is an enterprising woman who 8 years ago made the decision to install a corn mill and a store with basic food items in her house. It is thanks to these that she supports the household economy. Also her brother helps with the expenses.

In Maria's house one wall is in poor condition as you can observe in the photo. She is worried that an accident could happen any time. So she has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel,bricks, re-bar and to pay for labor to repair the wall that is in disrepair.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, re-bar and pay for labor to fix a wall of her house.

loans.name: Sonia Yolanda

texts.es:
Sonia de 52 años de edad está casada y teien 3 hijos ya mayores. Estudio hasta 2nd grado de educación básica, no continúo porque su madre murió y tenía que trabajar con sus hermanos para poder mantenerse.

Sonia es comerciante, inicio con la venta de verduras, iba con poco al mercado para se dio cuenta que le dejaba ciertas ganancias ya mayor se dedicó a la venta de ropa con lo que se ha mantenido con muy buenos resultados hasta el día de hoy.

Solicita el préstamo para limpiar la parcela que tiene sembrada con marañón, se acerca la temporada de cosecha y con el suelo limpio es mucho más fácil recoger la semilla. Nada le gustaría más Sonia que aumentar el inventario de su negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de producto ya que es su fuente de ingreso principal.
texts.en:
Sonia is 52 years old, married, and has 3 grown children. She completed a 2nd grade education, not continuing in school because her mother died and she had to work with her siblings to support herself.

Sonia is a vendor. She began by selling vegetables. She would go with a little to the market and realized that she earned some income so later she opened a business selling clothing which which she has had very good results up through today.

She seeks a loan to clean the parcel of land that is planted with cashews, as the harvest time is approaching and cleared ground is much easier to recover the seed. Sonia really enjoys increasing her business's inventory in order to offer a greater variety of products as that is her main source of income.

loans.use: to clean the parcel of land that is planted with cashews.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel de 27 años d edad, está casado y tiene una hija, estudio hasta 3er grado de educación básica, su esposa es ama de casa y se encarga de los oficios del hogar y de cuidar a su hija.

Joel es chofer de una ruta de buses y también es agricultor, cuando se da la oportunidad trabaja como albañil, ha trabajado de esta manera desde hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo  para cubrir los gastos de la cosecha de su cultivo pagando mano de obra. Su sueño es tener un negocio familiar, una tienda en la que se vea involucrada la familia.
texts.en:
Joel is 27 years old, married, and has one daughter. He completed a 3rd grade education. His spouse is a housewife and in charge of the chores of the home and taking care of their daughter. Joel is a bus drive and farmer. When he has the opportunity he also works as a bricklayer. He has done this work for 8 years.

He seeks a loan to cover the harvest expenses from her crop, paying for labor. His dream is to have a family business, a store where the whole family can work together.

loans.use: to cover the harvest expenses from her crop, paying for labor.

loans.name: Bocana De Ostiones Group

texts.es:
CARMEN  tiene 27 años de edad. Vive con su hermano- su esposo y 3 hijos en la casa de sus suegros.
2 de sus hijos y su hermano estudian ya que su último hijo es muy pequeño.
Su esposo es jornalero y se dedica a la electricidad. Por eventos realiza obras de instalaciones en domicilios.
CARMEN con los créditos anteriores inició su negocio de compra venta de ropa para todas las edades. Hoy gestiona su tercer crédito y lo invertirá en la compra de: pantalones jeans- vestidos – blusas – camisetas e interiores para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio.
Espera en un futuro no muy lejano. Poder tener su local con el confort de una boutique para brindar la comodidad a sus clientes y poder incrementar sus ventas. Construir su propia casa y darles a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Carmen is 27 years old. She lives with her brother, her husband, and 3 children in her in-law's home. Two of her children and her brother are in school and her youngest is very young. Her husband is a day laborer and works installing electricity in homes. With previous loans Carmen began her business selling clothing for men, women and children. Today she seeks her third loan and will use it to buy jeans, dresses, blouses, t-shirts, and underwear in order to increase the business's merchandise.

She hopes in the near future to be able to have a location in the comfort of a boutique in order to provide comfort to her customers and be able to increase her sales. She will build her own home and give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy jeans, dresses, blouses, t-shirts, and underwear in order to increase the business's merchandise.

loans.name: Moisés David

texts.es: Moisés es un joven de 22 años, a quien su mamá le propuso dedicarse a la actividad comercial para que generara sus propios ingresos, su madre se ha dedicado al comercio por muchos años y su consejo fue asumido por él, desde entonces él vende a sus amigos y referidos del barrio en el que reside en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, prendas de vestir como camisas, suéteres, jeans y calzado, también comercializa perfumes y teléfonos celulares, los cuales ofrece para cancelar a cómodas cuotas.  Actualmente lleva en el negocio un año de funcionamiento, aunque con escaso capital ha logrado solventar la situación y genera sus compras de contado, él está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de ropa, calzado, bolsos, perfumes y teléfonos celulares, los cuales estará ofreciendo a sus clientes. Moisés desea a largo plazo comprarse un apartamento, fruto de su trabajo al cual dedica 10 horas diarias todos los días, él es consiente que su principal desafío es ahorrar para poder conseguir sus metas.  Su propósito a largo plazo para el negocio es abrir un almacén al público y conseguir ampliar la cobertura de clientes.
texts.en: Moisés is a 22-year-old young man, whose mother suggested he work in sales to generate his own income. His mother has worked in sales for many years and her advice was taken by him. Since then, he has sold, to his friends and people referred to him in the neighborhood where he lives in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, clothing articles such as shirts, sweaters, jeans and shoes. He also sells perfumes and cell phones, which he offers at comfortable payments. He currently has had the business for one year, however with scant capital he has managed to make the situation solvent and make his purchases in cash. He is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in the purchase of clothing, footwear, bags, perfumes, and cell phones, which he will be offering to his customers. Moisés wants, in the long term, to buy himself an apartment, the fruit of his work which he does for 10 hours daily. He is aware that his primary challenge is saving to be able to achieve his goals. His long-term goal for the business is to open a shop to the public and be able to expand his customer coverage.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, bags, perfumes and cell phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron sheets and building materials for her house.

loans.name: Estebana

texts.es:
Estebana, tiene 65 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, tiene una granja de cerdos desde hace más de 20 años, al desempeñar esta actividad puede tener recursos económicos que utiliza para aportar en los gastos de su grupo familiar, cuida de los animales y luego los vende en su localidad.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para cerdos, serán de ayuda para engordarlos y mantenerlos saludables así que podrá venderlos más fácilmente, espera tener un buen margen de ganancias.
Su visión es mantener el negocio activo para resarcir sus deudas y dar a sus hijos los conocimientos de una buena administración en el negocio.
texts.en:
