Estebana, 65 years old, lives with her husband and three children. They have had a pig farm for over 20 years. Doing this work, she can have economic resources that she uses to pay the family expenses. She takes care of the animals and then sells them in the area.

She will use the loan to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for pigs. They will be of help to fatten them and keep them healthy, so that she will be able to sell them more easily, she hopes to have a good profit margin.

Her vision is to keep her business active to pay off her debts and give her children the knowledge of good management for the business.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for pigs, they will be of help to fatten them and keep them healthy.

loans.name: Kusiima Women's Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 35-year-old Ugandan, a married and hardworking woman living in Kagadi. She operates a retail shop to generate income. She hopes to grow her business despite capital insufficiency. 

Teddy is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, shoe polish and other things to sell. 

She is a member of Kusiima Women’s Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, shoe polish, and other things

loans.name: María Oneida

texts.es:
María de 49 años de edad, no tubo hijos ella vive con su compañero de vida.
Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas ya tiene varios años dedicandose a este negocio, en el cual le va muy bien, ella hace pupusas de diferentes variedades como de chicharron con queso, revueltas de queso, frijol y ayote, queso con loroco, ademas una de las especialidades en su negocio es la pupusa carnavalera que lleva varios ingredientes y todas saben muy bien.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar maíz y frijoles a bajo precio ya que estos son la base de su negocio.

María  sueña con tener un local mas amplio donde pueda atender a su clientes y sus familias que frecuentan el negocio.
texts.en: María is 49 years old and didn't have any children with her husband. She sells pupusas (a traditional food dish) and has several years working in this business, which is going very well for her. She makes different varieties such as pork rind with cheese, eggs and cheese, bean and pumpkin, in addition to some special editions. Her pupusa business uses various ingredients and all are very tasty. The loan she seeks from CREDICAMPO is to buy corn and beans at a low price as these items are the basis for her business. Maria dreams of having a larger space where she can attend to her customers and friends that frequent her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans at a low price as these items are the basis for her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tiene 44 años de edad, viuda y tiene dos hijos de 25 y 27 años de edad que ya se acompañaron y tienen su propio hogar. Estudió hasta 3er grado de educación básica, no continuó porque su madre murió cuando ella tenía 10 años; hace 8 meses murió su esposo por lo que vive sola y nadie depende de ella.

Susana  es agricultora, aprendió con su padre desde los 15 años, después con su esposa trabajo en cultivos como el pipián y el plátano, actividad que todavía realiza y le apoya un hermano. Camina un kilómetro para llegar a la parcela donde siembra y trabaja de 6:00 am a 12:00 m

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semilla, fertilizante y pago de mano de obra  para sembrar 7,000 mts cuadrados de plátano. Susana se propuso la meta de mejorar sus casa, poner una tioenda en su casa y comprar dos vacas productoras de leche.
texts.en:
Susana is 44 years old, widowed, and has two children ages 25 and 27 who are now married and have their own homes. She completed a 3rd grade education, and she didn't continue in school when her mother died when she was 10 years old. Her husband died 8 months ago so she lives alone and doesn't have any dependents.

Susana is a farmer, something she learned from her father 15 years ago. Then she worked with her husband on crops such as banana and chili, work that she still does with the help of her brother. She walks 1 kilometer to arrive at her land where she plants and works from 6 AM until 12 PM. She seeks a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pay for labor to plant 7000 square meters of banana. Susana proposes a goal of improving her home, opening a store in her home, and buying two cows for milk production.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pay for labor to plant 7000 square meters of banana.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María de 31 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 7 años y su hijo de 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que demuestra esfuerzo y tenacidad prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace mucho tiempo, y es gracias a ello que se gana la vida. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que desde hace algún tiempo ha observado que las láminas de este están presentando filtraciones por lo que sus pertenecías se están deteriorando, además la madera ya termino su vida útil y teme que en cualquier momento pueda ceder causando un accidente sobre todo por sus hijos, por lo que desea cambiar el techo lo antes posible, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 31, is a hardworking woman who lives in her own house with her life partner and her daughter, 7, and son, 9.  She's a woman who has shown strength and tenacity providing housekeeping services in the home for a long time--thanks to which she earns a living.

María wants to put a new roof on her house because she has noticed for some time that the metal sheets are leaking and her belongings are getting damaged.  Also, the wood has outlived its usefulness and she's afraid that it could collapse at any time and cause an accident, especially on her children.

For that reason she wants to replace the roof as soon as possible, so she's requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, beams, and pins to put a new roof on her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, beams, and pins to put a new roof on her house

loans.name: Ehromkhon

texts.ru:
Эхромхон 39 летняя замужняя женщина, занимающаяся бизнесом. В 2012 году Эхромхон начала свой торговый бизнес по купле и продаже детских игрушек и одежд в магазине. Начать этот бизнес ей помог ее подруга. Она видела ее трудное финансовое положение и поэтому посоветовала ей занаяться бизнесом вместе с ней. Эхромхон сейчас хорошо справляется с торговлей и она хотела бы расширить его. На сумму запрашиваемого кредита Эхромхон собирается приобрести ассортимент детских одежд и игрушек для развития торговли. 
Эхромхон в настоящий момент живет в городе Худжанд вместе с сдвумя детьми, а муж находится в России на заработках. Эхромхон усердная и деятельная женщина. Она трудится во благо сеьми и хочет обеспечить своим детям хорошее будущее.
texts.en: Ehromkhon is 39 years old, married, and she works in retail, having started her own business in 2012.  She buys and sells children's toys and clothes for a shop.  A friend of hers helped her get started in this business.  She saw Ehromkhon's difficult financial situation and invited her to work with her.  Ehromkhon now efficiently runs her business and she even wants to increase it.  She plans to use her loan to buy a variety of children's clothes and toys to expand her retail activity.  At the moment, Ehromkhon lives in Khujand with her two children while her husband works in Russia.  Ehromkhon is a hardworking and dynamic woman.  She works hard to provide for her family and she wants to give her children a good future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of children's toys and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Juana Magdalena

texts.es: Juana de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos, pupusas y tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de repellar y afinar el cuarto de la cocina, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su hijos puedan vivir mas omodos.
texts.en: Juana is 55 years old and lives in a home of her own along with her two children.  She sells breakfast, pupusas and tortillas from her home and makes her living in this way.  She would like to make improvements to her home by finishing her kitchen, but she does not have enough capital.  She is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, and pay for labor so she and her children can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Cornel's Group

texts.en:
Cornel, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Cornel is representing his group of 14 farmers in Teso District, and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Cornel has been a farmer for 15 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Cornel is planning to send his children to school.

A total of five acres will be planted by Cornel's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Gabriel's Group

texts.en:
Gabriel, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 8 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group, because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Gabriel will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. Gabriel plans to use the profits he gains this year to repair his home.

In total Gabriel’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Yuly Yomaira

texts.es:
La señora Yuly es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de eventos y banquetes.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán su esposo y sus hijos a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar los materiales para la adecuación y reformas del espacio que utilizara para los banquetes.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una mujer llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Yuly is a very enterprising and creative lady who has wanted to be independent and have her own events and banquets business for a very long time.

She can now make her dream a reality, thanks to her ability to work, the help she receives from Corporación Interactuar, and from those who want her to get ahead in her business.

Her husband and children will depend on this business and she will teach it to them so she can leave this legacy.

She is asking for financial support in order to buy the supplies she needs to fix up the banquet hall.

You can help out a woman who is full of life and family encouragement with a loan.

loans.use: to fix up her banquet hall

loans.name: Yoheyly Mercedes

texts.es:
Yoheyly siempre fue solidaria con los demás desde que era pequeña. A medida que iba creciendo, esta joven de 21 años de edad, se vio interesada en ayudar a la población en el ámbito de salud, razón por la cual nunca dudo en estudiar enfermería. Ahora ella cursa el cuarto año de la licenciatura en enfermería, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su esposo y padres, quienes trabajan en una empresa privada. 
Esta joven emprendedora, que ha sido reconocida en la universidad por su excelencia académica que le han permitido tener media beca, necesita concluir con este sueño de convertirse en toda una enfermera. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para pagar el título universitario y las mensualidades de sus últimos meses en la carrera. Esto le permitirá convertirse en una profesional completa, con el sueño de establecer una atención de salud y continuar especializándose.
texts.en: Yoheyly always wanted to help others ever since she was little. While she was growing up, this 21 years old young woman, was interested in helping people with their health, which is why she never doubted her choice to study nursing. Now she is in her 4th year to be a licensed nurse, thanks to her effort and support from her husband and parents who work in a private business. This young woman has been recognized by the university for her academic excellence and awarded a half scholarship. She needs to finish this dream of becoming a nurse. Therefore she seeks a loan to pay for her university credential and the monthly payments of the last months of her studies. This will enable her to become a professional, with the dream of establishing herself in the health field and continue specializing her education.

loans.use: to pay for her university credential and the monthly payments of the last months of her studies.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been selling alcohol since 2000, and deals in motorcycle transport as his other source of income. Despite price fluctuations, Edward is hopeful of his business growth. 

He is asking for a loan to buy more alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel is a weaver in Oaxaca who specializes in Zapotec wool rugs. He would like to bring on additional weavers at his workshop, and invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including natural dyes and wool yarn.

Israel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Israel and his family have been weaving Zapotec rugs for many generations. "We purchase wool from a nearby farmer and we dye it with natural dyes. With your kind help, our family will be able to get ahead, and we will also be able to help support other families in our village. Thank you for believing in us!"

Use the link below to view Israel's Zapotec wool rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/339

loans.use: to bring on additional weavers at his workshop, and invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including natural dyes and wool yarn

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 21 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. As a group leader, Joseph is representing his group of 12 farmers in Teso District in Kenya. He is excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Joseph's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Joseph and his group will receive a total of 11 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Solomon's Group

texts.en:
Solomon is a 65-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Solomon has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Solomon described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Solomon’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Truphena's Group

texts.en:
Truphena , pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2007 and decided to represent her group, because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Truphena will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also a solar light. Truphena plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Truphena ’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of seven acres of land. They will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Pascal's Group

texts.en:
Pascal, pictured above, has nine children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Pascal is representing his group of 16 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Pascal has been a farmer for nine years, and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Pascal is planning to send his children to school.

A total of seven acres will be planted by Pascal's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 16 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in batik wall art. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of supplies, including dyes and mounting boards.

Samuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I have developed my own techniques in batik production using reactive to achieve the same or better effects than would be derived in paintings. The results have been marvelous! My themes are mainly of women, beach scenes, and landscapes. I try to depict the daily activities of women in Africa to support the fight for equality for the African woman."

"I thank you all for the support and for making this microcredit possible."

Use the link below to view Samuel's batik wall art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3551

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of supplies, including dyes and mounting boards

loans.name: Wilmer Hugo

texts.es:
Wilmer es un hombre de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un bebé de 6 meses, y su negocio es la chapa y pintura.
Él es emprendedor, responsable, amigable, paciente y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’, un lugar estratégico caracterizado por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad mediante todo tipo de transporte, donde la gente se aglomera para conseguir movilidad a su hogar, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura promedio entre 2-12 grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Wilmer es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre, con su pareja y su pequeño bebé, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la chapa y pintura de automóviles; sus inicios fueron com ayudante de su padre que se dedica al mismo rubro y actualmente se encarga de pintar rayones, desabollar golpes, arreglar coches siniestrados, cambio de color, etc. Las herramientas que mayormente utiliza son; destornilladores, Martillo de carrocero, Martillo de bola, Maza, Martillo de lima y lima de repasar, Martillo de nylon, de madera y maza de goma, Cinceles o cortafríos, Granetes y botadores, Destornillador a golpe, lijas y otros. “dime de qué color es tu coche y te diré cómo eres, que si lo que tu coche dice de ti, que si qué colores son los más seguros… Está claro: el color de la carrocería de tu coche es muy importante…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller reconocido por su buen trabajo y necesita realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina compresora, que sirve para aumentar la presión, desplazar y rociar la pintura sobre la superficie del auto. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Wilmer solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina compresora para pintar autos y con los beneficios cuidar a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a 24-year-old man, who lives with his partner, has a 6-month-old baby, and his business is a body shop and paint shop.

He is enterprising, responsible, friendly, patient, and hard working. He does his work in the "Cruce Villa Adela" zone, a strategic location characterized by connecting the various zones of the city through all sorts of transportation, where the people gather to get transportation to their homes, with a cold and dry climate with an average temperature of 2-12 degrees centigrade during the day, all year, at an average altitude of 3800 meters above sea level. 

Wilmer is tanned, short, has short black hair, his native language is Aymará and he speaks Spanish. He has his life in his mother's house, with his partner and their small baby. They live in their own house, made of brick and cement, and which has drinking water, electricity and gas services. His business is a body shop and paint shop for cars. His beginnings were as an assistant to his father who works in the same field, and currently he is in charge of painting stripes, flattening out dents, fixing vehicles damaged in an accident, changing the color, etc. The tools that he uses most are screwdrivers, bodywork hammer, ball peen hammer, mallet, hammer file, body file, nylon hammer, wood hammer, rubber mallet, chisels or cold chisels, punches and nail pullers, impact driver, sandpaper, and others. "Tell me what color your car is and I will tell you what it is like, and what it says about you, and what colors are safest...It's clear: the color of your car paint job is very important..." he says. His dream is to have a shop known for its good work and he needs to make an investment in his business by purchasing a compressor, which helps to increase the pressure, to spread and spray the paint over the car's surface. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the year that he has been doing this work independently. 

For these reasons, Wilmer asks for a loan to purchase a compressor to paint cars and, with the profits, to care for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor to paint cars and with the profit, take care of his family.

loans.name: Lenah's Group

texts.en:
Lenah, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Lenah is representing her group of seven farmers in Matete District, and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Lenah has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Lenah is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 2.75 acres will be planted by Lenah's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store. With this business she has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days.

She wants to take advantage of her good fortune, and so recently took out a 25,000 PHP loan to restock her store with assorted items to sell. She is thankful for the capital that has been extended to a small-time borrower like herself.

Gina’s future plans are to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with assorted items

loans.name: Muntari

texts.en: Muntari is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Muntari joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Masahunu, Ali and Magaji.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Muntari would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Muntari can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Muntari  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Donahon

texts.ru: Донахон 62 года, замужем, мать 3 детей, есть внуки. У Донахон среднее образование, на протяжении 34 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Донахон есть 10 коровы и 25 овец, также у нее есть 1,8 ГА поливной земли, на которой она выращивает хлопчатник, арбузы и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Донахон нужно до наступления холодов перекрыть крышу, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку железа, досок и прочих строительных материалов. Донахон является лидером группы "Нурэл", кроме нее в группе состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое.
texts.en:
Donahon is 62 years old, married and the mother of three children.  She also has grandchildren.  Donahon has a secondary level education and, for the last 34 years, she has been in the farming and cattle business.  Today, Donahon has 10 cows, 25 sheep, and 1.8 ha of irrigated land where she raises cotton, watermelon, and corn, both for sale and for use on her farmstead.  

Donahon needs to reroof her house before the weather turns cold, and so she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy metal roofing, boards, and other building materials.  Donahon is also the leader of the Nurel group, which consists of two other members.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for reroofing her house

loans.name: Alfred's Group

texts.en:
Five farmers in the Matete District form Alfred’s Group and are being represented by Alfred, who is the group leader, pictured above. He is 43 years old, is married and has four children. Alfred has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Alfred isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Alfred will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Alfred's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 1.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Yunana

texts.en: Yunana is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yunana joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Basiru, Ibrahim and Ummi.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yunana would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yunana can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yunana  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Solomon Dauda

texts.en: Solomon Dauda is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Solomon Dauda joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Aliyu, Kezia and Safiya.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Solomon Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Solomon Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Solomon Dauda  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Philimon

texts.en: Philimon is a maize farmer from Rukku village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Philimon would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Philimon can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Philimon, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Lawal

texts.en: Alhaji Lawal is a maize farmer from Dankwaire village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Lawal can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alhaji Lawal, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a maize farmer from Barangwaje village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Peter would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Peter can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Peter, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nitcer

texts.en:
Nitcer is 36 years old and lives in Labuyo, Tangub City. He is married with one school-age child. For the past ten years he has supported his family by operating a motor and electrical shop, earning approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Nitcer has been a member of PMPC for two years. He has requested a 50,000 PHP loan to be used to buy additional materials, equipment and accessories so he can increase the services he has to offer.

Nitcer’s goal is to buy a wide and comfortable space where he can relocate his shop and expand his business operation.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, equipment and accessories so he can increase the services he has to offer.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is from Baybay, Leyte. She has two children, ages 5 and 11. She started raising hogs two years ago. She is asking a loan of 6,000 PHP as an additional capital to buy feed and piglets. She is hoping that this loan can help sustain her business.

She works hard so that they can have a better life. It is her dream to be in the business for a long period of time.  The income will benefit her children. It will be used for school fees and healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis used the previous loan to buy materials for making uniforms and men's and ladies’ suits for selling.

Francis is thirty-three years old and married with four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Francis offers tailoring services by making men’s and ladies’ suits plus school uniforms.

Francis has a dream of buying land for building a residential house and farming. However, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital.

Francis wants money to buy materials for making men’s and ladies’ suits for selling during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making men's and ladies' suits for selling during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Lorbie

texts.en:
Lorbie is a 36-year-old, married woman with five kids. Her oldest child is 11 and the youngest is 6. Together with her family, she lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. She engages in fishing. She catches fish and sells them to the nearby market, as her main source of livelihood. She has been engaged in this kind of business for two years now.

Lorbie is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fishing net, materials for pump boat construction like plywood, nails, and epoxy (adhesive) and to purchase two pigs for a start-up of hog raising. This will help Lorbie transport her catch easily, improve her yield, and in the coming months to raise and sell hogs, as well. In the future, Lorbie would like to expand her sources of livelihood to support the needs of her growing children, especially in financing their education.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, materials for pump boat construction like plywood, nails, and epoxy(adhesive) and to purchase two pigs for a start-up of hog raising.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a new cacao farmer who lives in the village of Red Bank, located in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He is eager to join the cacao industry because he sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. Alexander believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop that is good for the environment and will help develop his local community. 

Alexander wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he could expand his cacao farm by purchasing grafted,disease resistant cacao seedlings. He plans to use the revenue generated from his crop to educate his children and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase cacao seedlings

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita is a 40-year-old mother of four children ranging in age from 6 to 18 years old, with two of them being developmentally challenged and receiving some disability income. The family are members of the ethnic Egyptian Albanians. Drita has been buying and reselling used clothes at some specially built booths in their home town.

Drita and her family previously lived in a hut built and covered with cardboard. Their living conditions and lack of nutrition had a terrible negative impact on their health. Their living conditions have changed slightly in the last few years and Drita praises VFA for providing them with loans. Drita will use this requested loan to stock up on inventory of secondhand clothing to resell. Note that Drita has proved her responsible nature with her four previous loans.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory of secondhand clothing to resell

loans.name: Angel Amilcar

texts.es: Ángel de 32 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor que al no encontrar otra forma de ganarse la vida decidió dedicarse a la venta de panes con jamón, repollo y kétchup, y así lograr sostener la economía de su hogar por medio de su negocio. Él es un hombre que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos uno de  7 meses y otro de  3 años de edad, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder brindarles un lugar propio donde vivir. Ángel ha observado que cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que él desea tener más productos que ofrecer, pero el carretón con el que cuenta es muy pequeño, por lo que desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: un carretón grande que le permita ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes y así cumplir con la demanda de productos solicitados.
texts.en:
Ángel, age 32, is an enterprising man.  Upon not finding another way of making a living, he decided to sell bread with ham, cabbage, and ketchup.  This way he manages to support his household through his business.  

He lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children.  One is seven months old, and the other is three years old.  He is very happy to be able to provide them with their own place to live.

Ángel has observed that each day there are more customers who request his products.  Therefore, he wishes to have more products to sell.  However, the cart that he has is very small.  He wishes to get a loan from FUSAI in order to buy a large cart that will allow him to offer a larger quantity of products to his customers.  This way he will meet the demand for requested products.

loans.use: to buy a larger cart.

loans.name: Milagro Santos

texts.es: Milagro es una mujer emprendedora que cuenta con 55 años de edad y desde hace 24 años decidió instalar una pequeña tienda de productos básicos, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con una fuente de ingresos que le permite también estar pendiente de su vivienda. Ella es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia desde junto a sus 3 hijos de 16, 12 y 8 años de edad, de los que ha tenido que hacerse cargo después de la pérdida de su esposo.  Milagro desea invertir en su negocio, ya que siente que si esté estuviera mejor surtido tendría un mayor margen de ganancia, es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, papel higiénico, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, champú, jabón, etc.
texts.en:
Milagro is a very enterprising 55 year old woman who set up a small convenience store 24 years ago.  She is happy with her source of income that also allows her to care for her home.  She is a single mother who lives in a home of her own with her three children, ages 16, 12, and 8, whom she has had to raise after the loss of her husband.

Milagro wants to invest into her business and better stock her inventory.  If she could do this, she would have a better profit margin, so she is asking for a loan through FUSAI in order to buy candy, bathroom tissue, rice, beans, sugar, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 54-year-old, married woman and a mother of a 13-year-old child. Merlinda lives with her family in Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now.

Merlinda is asking for a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. With a loan, Merlinda will be able to improve her hog raising business, thus allowing her to sell healthy pigs after several weeks. In the future, Merlinda hopes to expand her hog raising business in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Garba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Garba, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Decell

texts.en:
Decell is 28 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Decell has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Decell aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: El Amor 1 Group

texts.en:
Sandra is the coordinator of the El Amor (The Love) 1 group, which is based in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic that has unreliable access to resources such as potable running water and electricity. Sandra runs a Fantasia, which is a small general store in the neighborhood where people can find jewelry, accessories, cosmetics, underwear and other products like clothes or shoes.

Sandra has proven she is an excellent Esperanza client by repaying five loans. She plans to use this loan, her sixth, to continue to grow her business and to buy more miscellaneous products to resell. She will buy women's accessories, cosmetics, clothes, etc. She hopes to someday have a bigger store. Sandra would like to use the money she earns in her business to continue improving her business and to save for her coming future. The loans she has taken with Esperanza in the past have helped her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, cosmetics, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Anabel de 48 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Anabel esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que le ha ido muy bien últimamente
texts.en:
Anabel, 48, lives with her life partner and her children.  She makes a living selling shoes.  Her business in located in her residence.  With what she obtains from her sales, she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  
Anabel is once again requesting a loan in order to buy shoes wholesale so as to be able to continue her work since it has been going very well lately.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. For several years she has had a business making and selling tortillas.  Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. She is seeking a loan to buy quintales (1 quintal = 100 pounds) of corn and lime in order to continue making tortillas and in this way be able to generate greater income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quintales (1 quintal = 100 pounds) of corn and lime

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio sigue dedicándose a su negocio de restaurante, él socio elabora diferentes tipos de platos como sopas, arroz con pollo, saltados entre otros, el socio continua trabajando conjuntamente con su esposa, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member has a restaurant business where he makes different dishes such as soups, rice with chicken, roasted meat, etc. The member continues working along side his wife. He wishes to be able to continue working in this way in order to continue supporting his family. The member seeks a loan to buy rice, oil and other items. The member is thankful for the loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other items.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita farms and sells palay, or rice in the husk. She is working hard now to prepare for post-harvest activities. She wants to be sure that she has ample time for threshing, drying, storing and processing her harvest before another growing season.

Anita needs help to accomplish this. She presented her proposal to pay for post-harvest operations to Paglaum MPC and received a 15,000 PHP loan.

Anita hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 45 year-old Aminata.  She is married, and has 5 children aged 25, 23, 20, and4 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who live with her because he is her brother's son, so she has   to help him.  In 2013, Aminata established her grocery provision shop business. She began her business because she want  to be self-employed and not rely on the husband .Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1000000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000, in order to improve her business and to engage in junks selling. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 429000. In the future, Aminata plans to engage in selling junks bails so that she will be supplying customers. Very hard working she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to improve her business

loans.name: Esteban Daniel

texts.es: Daniel es un joven que vive en el campo él tiene un hijo de 3 años, Daniel tiene 20 años de edad y se dedica a la crianza de ganado, Daniel  vive con su madre y con un hermano y comenta que su padre falleció pero que fue él quien le enseño  a la actividad de la ganadería y a la agricultura,  Daniel va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una vaca para aumentar con las otras vacas que ya tiene, lo que Daniel espera es que su negocio sea más rentable por medio de la venta de leche  y de ahí le gustaría asegurar un buen futuro para su hijo y también le gustaría retomar sus estudios que los dejo por falta de recursos económicos cuando falleció su padre.
texts.en:
Daniel is a young man living in the country.  He has a 3-year-old son.  Daniel is 20 years old and works raising cattle.  He lives with his mother and with a brother.  He says that his father has died, but he was the one who taught Daniel agriculture and how to raise cattle.  

Daniel is going to invest his loan in the purchase of a cow to add to the herd that he already has.  Daniel hopes this will make his business more profitable through milk sales.  In this way he would like to ensure a good future for his child. He would also like to go back to school; he had left school due to a lack of financial resources after his dad died.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
María de 21 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijas ambas estudian en el kínder. Ella abandono sus estudios porque se acompañó desde muy temprana edad, su pareja trabaja ordeñando ganado en una hacienda de la localidad. Solo él y sus hijas viven con ella.

María anteriormente tenía un comedor en el pueblo, en un puesto que alquilaba en el mercado, así trabajo por 5 años pero tuvo problemas de salud y el negocio no fue sostenible motivo por el que tuvo que cerrarlo; hoy en día trabaja como empleada en un comedor en el centro de la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a viernes.

Solicita el préstamo para construir una habitación para ampliar su casa, ya que la familia está creciendo y necesitan vivir más cómodamente. María no descarta la posibilidad de seguir estudiando, sacar un técnico en manejo de alimentos para optar a mejores oportunidades de trabajo además quiere dar el estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old, married, and has two daughters in kindergarten.  She was not able to continue her education because she married at an early age.  Her husband milks cows for a living.  Only he and her daughters live with her.

Maria used to sell food from a rented stall at the local market.  She ran it for five years and then had health problems and the business was not sustainable so she had to close it.  Now she works as an employee at another stall in the city center.  She works Monday through Friday.

She is asking for this loan to build a room onto her house because her family is growing and they need to be more comfortable.  Maria has not given up on school to earn a diploma in food management so that she will have better work opportunities.  She also wants to provide her daughters an education.

loans.use: to add a room onto her home.

loans.name: Mario Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es un joven de 28 años de edad, el vive con un hermano, su cuñada y 2 sobrinos que están estudiando, Fernando vive en el campo y se dedica a trabajar al jornal y a la ganadería, el crédito la va a invertir en la compra de terneros para ponerlos en un terreno por el que paga arriendo, la aspiración de Fernando es mejorar su negocio y en algún momento comprarse un lotecito para tener donde criar sus terneros.
texts.en: Fernando is a 28 year old young man. He lives with a brother, his sister in law and 2 nephews who are in school. Fernando lives in the countryside and works as a laborer and as a rancher. He is going to invest in buying calves to put them on some land he is renting. Fernando's goal is to improve his business and at some point buy a lot to have where he can raise his calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Glenda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Fatu. She is married and has one child, who is five years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because his parents are dead.

In 2002, Fatu established her grocery business. She began her business because her salary was not enough to take care of the family. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,100,000 every month from this business.

Fatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000, in order to improve her business by buying more groceries for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 500,000.

In the future, Fatu plans to open a water manufacturing company. Very hard working, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying more groceries for resale

loans.name: Kimchhung

texts.en:
A villager living in Siem Reap Province, Kimchhung is 41 years old. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school and one is in university. To support her family conditions, she grows rice and plants vegetables.  

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Agriculture. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Agriculture.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Alba Yali

texts.es:
Alba de 29 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, su esposo es empleado y trabaja como agente de ventas. Es ama de casa y se dedica a cuidar a su hijo y a los oficios del hogar.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una cocina de plancha para vender tortillas y así apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Sueña a futuro terminar de arreglar su casa, cambiando el ladrillo de piso.
texts.en:
Alba, 29, is married and has a son two years old.  Her husband is employed and works as a sales agent.  She is a homemaker and spends her time caring for her son and with housework.
She is requesting this loan to buy a kitchen griddle in order to sell tortillas and thus support her husband with the household expenses. She dreams of completing the repairs on her house, changing out the floor bricks, in the future.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen griddle in order to sell tortillas.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian, 32 years old, is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has 3 children and is married. As a group leader, Lilian is representing her group of 16 farmers in Teso District, Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Lilian's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, Lilian plans to send her children to school.

Lilian and her group will receive a total of 14 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Rael is 63 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader who is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Rael has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, Rael believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rael also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rael's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Oanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh, born in 1989, is a Thai ethnic woman. She is one of the youngest members in the cluster, but she is always exemplary in complying with the internal rules and regulations of the cluster, and is willing to help other people. She currently lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Both of her sons are obedient and lovely. Her elder son is studying at Kindergarten in Mai Son district. Her family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding, so the income is just enough for food and to save a little amount left. That amount is not enough to buy school supplies and to pay school fees for her children, so she needs a loan to cover the cost of education for them. She expects the loan amount will partially help her children have good conditions for studying, and she will work hard to earn money to repay the loan for M7-MFI.

loans.use: to cover the costs of education for her children.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.en:
Mauricio lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is a farmer (corn, beans and rice), age 27 years; he is unmarried. It is clear that Mauricio works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Mauricio is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit him to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Nantale

texts.en:
Nantale is a 30-year-old and has a business in  Mundri County of South Sudan. She  operates her own business. She buys and sells items such as medicines, soap, and candles. 

She is  requesting a 4500 SSP loan from WOYE MFI so that she can expand her business. She will be able to offer more heath care to the people of Mundri. Nantale hopes to build her own  in the community and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To provide more medicines to the customers

loans.name: Ambrosio

texts.es:
Ambrosio de 66 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad y con hogar propio. Su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella vive con él. Ambrosio es agricultor, desde joven trabajo en el campo con su padres y agradece a él todo lo que sabe; cultiva granos básicos especialmente maíz y frijol, parte de la cosecha la guarda y otra parte la vende.

Solicita el préstamo para cubrir los gastos de la cosecha y la preparación de esta para la venta, pagando mano de obra. Una de las aspiraciones de Ambrosio es aumentar su área de siembra para también aumentar sus ventas y con las ganancias realizar unas reparaciones a su casa.
texts.en:
Ambrosio is 66 years old, married, has 4 grown children and has his own home. His spouse is a housewife and only she lives with him. Ambrosio is a farmer, work he has done since he was young when he worked with his parents and he is thankful for what he learned from them. He grows basic grains, especially corn and beans. Part of the harvest he keeps and the other part he sells.

He seeks a loan to pay for the harvest expenses and prepare the harvest for sale, paying labor costs. One of Ambrosio's aspirations is to increase the area he plants in order to also increase his sales and earnings in order to make some repairs to his home.

loans.use: to pay for the harvest expenses and prepare the harvest for sale.

loans.name: Ruth Marisela

texts.es: Ruth de 39 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar, por medio de su negocio de venta de productos básicos y pupusas, actividad que realiza en su vivienda desde hace 15 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 2 y 10 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de poder darles esa seguridad a los suyos. Ruth desea invertir en su negocio, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: productos básicos y chicharrón, frijoles, harina de arroz, maíz, quesillo, etc. Para que su negocio de productos básicos siga prosperando al igual que su venta de pupusas.
texts.en:
Ruth is 39 years old and is a very enterprising woman who works hard to support her household, through her sales of basic products and pupusas.  She works out of her home, has done so for 15 years, and has a good number of customers who buy her products.  She lives in a home of her own with her life’s partner and two children, ages 2 and 10, and she is happy to be able to provide them with security.

Ruth wants to invest into her business but does not have the liquidity she needs.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy basic products, fried pork rinds, beans, rice flour, corn, cheese, etc. so that her basic products business can function at the same level as her pupusas business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ernestina's Group

texts.en: Joel and Ernestina live in a small village in Tecolutla on the eastern coast of the state of Veracruz in Mexico. Tecolutla is one of the closest beach to Mexico City and much of its economy is based on attracting people from the city. Joel is a fisherman with a variable salary who gets better paid for the fish in the peak seasons.  Ernestina is married and contributes to the household by cooking for fisherman and tourists. Her income depends as well on the season and reputation. She believes that if she is able to use a blender for her cooking, light the wooden table where she serves her customers at night, and put some music with a small radio, her sales would increase. She already have a small solar system they purchased through ERES Energía a year ago, and previously had a large solar panel that was a gift from a far away relative. This solar panel did not have the necessary components to work as a whole. She learned about ERES Energía's new rescue program and decided she wanted to purchase a maintenance plan, battery, charge controller and LED to get her Solar Home System working. Her alternative is to use a fuel-oil power plant to fulfill their energy needs but it was not only very expensive (35% of their income), but noisy and polluting. The repaired solar system will allow Ernestina to save money spent in energy per month, while reducing the noise and pollutants.

loans.use: to repair and retrofit a solar home system that will allow them to charge their cellphones and use home appliances such as a TV, radio and a blender

loans.name: Sale Wanzan

texts.en: Sale Wanzan is a maize farmer from Dogon Juri village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sale Wanzan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sale Wanzan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Sale Wanzan, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a large solar home system that will allow them to  use home appliances such as a TV, radio and a blender.

loans.name: Luz Angel

texts.es:
Luz Ángel es una joven estudiante de derecho, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Luz Angel, tengo 18 años de edad, nací en Santo Domingo y actualmente vivo en Cambita Garabito, municipio de San Cristóbal. Mi padre trabaja en el ayuntamiento municipal del mismo municipio y mi madre esta deshabilitada laboral por causas de un accidente cerebro Vascular.
Estudio en la Universidad dominicana O&M, curso el 4to. Cuatrimestre de la carrera de Licenciatura en Derecho. 
Para mí es muy importante este préstamo educativo ya que mis padres no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para pagarme mis estudios universitarios, porque los únicos ingresos de la familia son los generados por él y son muy mínimos, además de que debe sustentar los gastos del hogar. 
Mi meta es poder culminar mis estudios con excelentes notas, con la ayuda de Dios primero y luego de ustedes y comenzar a trabajar en mi área, para así ayudar a mi familia y darle un excelente servicio a mi comunidad ayudando aquellos que por no tener los recursos no puedan pagar un abogado cuando se le presenta la necesidad.
texts.en:
Luz Angel is a young law student. She is asking for a loan in order to be able to cover her education costs.  This is her story: 

“My name is Luz Angel.  I am 18 years old.  I was born in Santo Domingo and currently live in Cambita Garabito in the municipality of San Cristobal.  My father works in the municipal town hall in this same municipality and my mother is disabled due to a stroke.  

I am studying at the Universidad Dominicana O&M.  I am in the fourth term of the Law Degree Program.

For me, this educational loan is very important since my parents don't have the necessary resources to pay for my university studies because the only family income is that earned by my father and it is very minimal.  Besides, it has to sustain the household expenses.

My goal is to be able to complete my studies with excellent marks, with the help first of God, then of you and to begin to work in my field. In this way, I can help my family and give excellent service to my community, helping those who, due to not having resources, can't pay a lawyer when the necessity presents itself."

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en:
Esteban lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (potatoes and vegetables). Age 55 years; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Esteban works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, it will improve the living conditions.
Esteban is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and save in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: María Eva

texts.es:
María de 65 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad y con hogar propio cada uno. Ella es comerciante, desde que era niña comenzó instruida por su madre con pequeñas ventas, hasta el día de hoy que tiene un negocio en el que vende productos básicos y de uso diario en el hogar.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, granos básicos, aceita, papel higiénico, bebidas golosinas y más para su tienda para mantener su inventario y no ver afectadas sus ventas en esta temporada de gran demanda. María espera Dios le presta vida para seguir trabajando con entusiasmo.
texts.en:
Maria, 65, is married and has two, grown children with their own homes.  She is a merchant.  Since she was a child, her mother began to instruct her with small sales.  Nowadays she has a business where she sells basic, daily use products in her house.
She is requesting the loan in order to buy sugar, basic grains, oil, toilet paper, drinks, candies, and more for her shop in order to maintain her inventory and so as not to see her sales affected in this time of great demand.  Maria hopes that God will grant her life in order to continue working with enthusiasm.

loans.use: to buy sugar, basic grains, oil, toilet paper, drinks, candies, and more.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Finda.  She is married, and has three children ages 27,23 and 20 years. In 2013, Finda established her provisions, cooking oil, and toiletries business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband provide for the schooling of their children and the smooth running of their home. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000, in order to buy mayonnaise, peak milk, sardines, and cooking oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. Finda wishes to support her children to achieve a university education. She is very hardworking and is determined to continue to improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mayonnaise, peak milk, sardine, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is a 41-year-old woman from the city of Kutaisi. Her husband and son died several years ago and she only has a school-aged daughter. Khatuna was left alone to lead the family but is not involved in any business activity. The family's only source of income is from a lease. Khatuna owns a flat in the capital of Georgia, and she rents it and receives income every month. However, she still finds it hard to cover all costs and make good living conditions for her daughter. 

Khatuna has a great desire to be involved in her own business and to generate additional income. She has worked as a saleslady at the jewelry section and has great experience in this type of business. She now needs financial support to purchase stock of silver jewelry and to rent a place in the trade center. The center is in a great location in the city and Khatuna will always have customers. 

The start up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, gives poor people a chance to start or re-start businesses. The business initiative will be a great support to this motivated woman and her daughter, as they will generate more income and live in better conditions. Khatuna relies on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: to begin her business by starting to sell silver jewelry

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina lives in El Recreo a community of 50 people in Veracruz. She is an independent and hard working woman who lives from raising and selling cattle, selling fresh milk and cultivating oranges. She wakes up every day before the sunrise and needs light to get prepared and cook for her family before leaving to the field. Carolina bought a Solar Home System from a nearby town almost two years ago. Due to lack of maintenance and availability of repairs, the system stopped working 6 months ago and she has not been able to get the spare parts to get the system to work. At nights, she feels insecure because she doesn’t have enough energy to light her place, and needs to walk around with a lantern that needs batteries. She wants to repair her solar home system that will provide her with electricity again make her life easier in the mornings before leaving to the field and at nights when coming back from a hard-working day. Through this loan, she will purchase a new battery, charge controller and buy a maintenance plan on credit, to ensure her system works for the years to come.

loans.use: to repair a solar home system that will complement her energy needs

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Yakubu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Thuong's Group

texts.en:
Born in 1975, Thuong is part of this group of six borrowers. She is ethnically Thai but lives in Vietnam. She, her husband and her only son are located in Son La in Son La province.

Thuong raises pigs, but after deducting all costs she finds her income is just enough to buy food and put a little aside. She hasn’t enough money to buy a breeding pig and food for it.

Thuong and her group are applying for a 50,000,000 VND loan through M7-MFI to be apportioned among themselves. With her share Thuong will venture into pig breeding so as to make more money for her family. She will work hard to earn the money to repay her loan portion on time.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 52-year-old woman from the town of Albuera, Leyte. She is married with five children; the youngest is seventeen years old. Her husband work as a security guard. Teresita herself has farmed rice for the past 26 years to help meet her family’s needs.

Teresita is applying for a 8,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides and to pay for labor to help with the plowing. The loan will help her continue her farming while also supporting the basic needs of her family. She will use all her farming income to pay for healthy food for her family and school fees for her seventeen-year-old.

In the future, Teresita hopes to be successful by continuing to improve and expand her farm. She also wants to set up a piggery.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides and to pay for labor to help with the plowing.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta engages in a key duplication business. She is a forty-year-old married woman and has four children. Her oldest child is 21 and the youngest is 2. Aside from that, she runs a welding shop where her husband is the welding operator. Together with her family, she lives in Mcarthur, Leyte.

Julieta is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional supplies for the welding shop and additional capital for starting a food vending business. These materials will create greater improvement on the present operation of her welding shop, and this could be the start on the opening of a food vending business that will hopefully augment her income for the welfare of the whole family.

Julieta hopes that someday she could manage her livelihood successfully and continue sending her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for welding shop, and additional capital for starting a food vending business

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is nothing short of a visionary farmer. She is based in the outskirts of Nandihills town, in the South Rift region of Kenya. Her house, covered with corrugated iron sheet, is at the center of a compound within her luxuriant five acre farm. She started farming in 2005. Today, she makes money from selling milk, offering motorcycle transportation services and a side hustle. However, surrounded by fresh air, wide open space, and peaceful, natural sounds, she cherishes every minute spent with her cows. 

Florah is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Florah will have more space to expand her business output. The money from the investment will be reinvested back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable Florah to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her children who are in public schools. 

Make a $25 loan, and push Florah’s dream closer to reality.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
A father of seven children living in Siem Reap province, Seng is 45 years old. For his family's living, he grows rice on a four-hectare area as a single source of income, and this earns him about 34,000 KHR per day.

This is his third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid his past loans wisely to improve his living condition at a gradual pace. He will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that he can improve his family's living in a healthy way.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mua's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mua, born in 1965, is a Kinh woman living with her husband and her two children (one daughter and one son) in Son La city in Son La province. Her eldest, the daughter, has completed vocational training and has a job, and her son is studying at a university of economics.
  
Her family’s main occupation is doing a small business. Her husband is a security guard at Son La College.  It is calculated that after deducting all costs, their annual income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and the remaining amount left is not enough to pay for her children’s education costs. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan to pay for her children’s education costs.

So, she really hopes that the amount borrowed will partially help her family have money to cover the children’s education costs and invest more in their education for better studying conditions. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education costs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a single woman who is currently looking to better her life. She recently suffered the loss of her fiancé which caused significant financial hardship. Marilyn had become disabled while her fiancé was alive, and he  was assisting with the bills; however, when he died, she was unable to pay her bills on time and her credit began to suffer. Despite her hardships, Marilyn has taken on the responsibility of raising her fiancés two teenage children, helping her own son through school as well as supporting her niece and nephew after the passing of her sister. Marilyn is trying to make her home as safe and energy efficient as possible for her family by replacing the gas water heater currently installed in her home. Due to the heavy water usage of Marilyn’s large family, the cost of gas for the water heater is significant. She is hoping to not only reduce the monthly utility cost,  but also provide a safer living environment by installing a much more efficient solar water heater.
