Marilyn will use this loan to finance a safer, more efficient, solar water heater for her home.

loans.use: to pay for a safer, more efficient, solar water heater for her home.

loans.name: Zamarys

texts.en:
Zamarys (pictured right) is a married woman who has suffered a few setbacks in recent years. Zamarys’ husband, Michael (pictured left), unfortunately became disabled and was deemed unable to work; therefore, she became the main provider for the household. It has been difficult for Michael to obtain disability, and during this time the couple was faced with the choice of giving up their home or losing their car. The couple decided to turn in their car and shift expenses to save their home. Zamarys has since found employment that better supports the household until her husband can recover. Living on one paycheck does not allow any out of pocket funds to make necessary repairs to their home, such as replacing an old water heater that is no longer repairable. Zamarys has little credit history as she normally does not borrow funds. 

In order to lower the cost of their energy bill, Zamarys will use her KIVA loan to not only buy a new solar water heater to replace their old unserviceable unit, but to also help rebuild her credit.

loans.use: to pay for a solar water heater to replace an old unserviceable unit.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Robertina is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress) 1, 2 & 4, which is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her son. Robertina enjoys working but one of her most difficult challenges is to pay for her son's university.

Robertina is excited to be taking her 16th loan with Kiva field partner, Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to invest in her cosmetic products sales business by buying different products such as deodorant, body lotion, perfume, makeup, etc.

Robertina is used to saving some of her profits in order to help her son with his university expenses (books, transportation, study fees, etc.) every three months. She wants to improve her business and become a successful businesswoman. Robertina dreams of having a successful business and seeing her son become a professional. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy deodorant, body lotion, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pipes, faucets, elbows joints, corrugated tin, cement, sand, etc. in order to install drinking water and change the roof of her residence.

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ha, born in 1969, is a Kinh woman. She lives with her husband and her son in Son La city, Son La province. Her son is studying at a university in Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam. 

Her family lives mainly based on her husband’s monthly meager salary and from chicken breeding to improve meals for the family. Due to the salary being too small, she has to be frugal with her spending in order to have enough money to cover her family’s living expenses. The amount she saved is not enough to cover her child’s education costs. Therefore, she currently needs to borrow a loan to pay for her child’s education costs.
 
She will find an extra job to work to earn money to repay M7-MFI and she hopes the loan amount will help her child have better conditions for studying and having a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for her child’s education costs

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
Daniel, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir nuevamente en su negocio, por lo que solicita más capital para comprar abono, fertilizantes y preparar la tierra para sembrar granos básicos, espera que sus cultivos tengan como resultado una cosecha abundante y sana.
Con el préstamo anterior ha podido tener una mayor cantidad de granos básicos, abasteció a todos sus clientes y a su familia, con la novilla ha aumentado el número cabezas de ganado.
texts.en:
Daniel sees the need once again to invest in his business for which he requests more capital in order to buy manure and fertilizers and to prepare the soil for planting basic grains.  He hopes that his crop will result in an abundant and healthy harvest.
With the previous loan, he was able to have a greater quantity of basic grains.  He supplied all his customers and his family.  With the heifer, he has increased the number of head of cattle.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers and to prepare the soil in order to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh, born in 1971, is the Kinh’s woman. She lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in the Mai Son district, Son La province. Her oldest daughter is studying at a senior high school, and her son is studying at kindergarten.

Her family’s main occupation is sow breeding, pig breeding for meat; and she makes tofu, which she can salvage the soybean residue for the breeding. It is said that selling several herds can bring in tens of VND million every year in profit, but it is just enough for covering food. The rest is not enough to invest more in the breeding business to get more income for the family. That is why she really wants to borrow a loan for investing in this purpose.

She will work hard to earn money to repay to M7-MFI and she hopes that the loan will help her family invest in developing better breeding and her family life will be improved.

loans.use: to invest more in the breeding business

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Thanh is one of this five-member group seeking a loan. Born in 1962, she is Kinh, Vietnam’s ethnic majority. She is married and has two sons. The family currently lives in Son La within Son La province.

Thanh’s family’s main income is from breeding pigs for slaughter, but it takes several months for the pigs to reach market size before she can sell them. This means waiting for this anticipated income, which she uses to cover all her investments in the pigs and her family’s living expenses. She would like to do more sow breeding, but she hasn’t enough money to do so.

Thanh’s group is applying for a 55,000,000 VND loan through M7-MFI that will be apportioned among the members. Thanh will use her share to invest in breeding sows. She then anticipates her next herd of pigs will bring her family a significant profit.

loans.use: to invest in breeding sows.

loans.name: Nhi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhi, born in 1974, is a Kinh woman. Nhi, her husband and her two sons currently live in Son La city, Son La province. The family’s main income is from her husband’s meager salary, so Nhi has to calculate and consider their spending so that they save enough money to cover her family’s living expenses and her two sons' education expenses. 

Nhi wants to invest in breeding to get more income for the family. She needs to borrow a loan to invest in sow breeding and pig raising for meat to improve the family's living conditions. Nhi hopes the loan will help her family invest in breeding more effectively and bring them a substantial profit next year. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in sow breeding and pig raising for meat

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a 60-year-old married woman from Albuera, Leyte. She has had a sari-sari store or mini-grocery store business for fifteen years now, selling goods to the people in her community. Violeta is a hardworking woman who tries her best to earn a living so that she can help her husband in supporting the needs of their household like food and paying bills. Violeta is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional items to sell like noodles, toiletries, coffee, milk, sugar, salt, detergent, canned food, cooking oil and chips to replenish her stocks. With the loan, Violeta will be able to augment her stocks so that she can cater to more customers in their locality. Violeta hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as noodles, toiletries, coffee, milk, sugar, salt, detergent, canned food, cooking oil and chips

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: Solicita el préstamo para hacer arreglos en su vehículo, al ser su fuente principal de ingresos debe tenerlo en el mejor estado posible. José tiene pensado comprar un juego de llantas para su vehículo y reparar la carrocería para mejorar la apariencia de su equipo de trabajo.
texts.en: José is requesting a loan to make improvements to his vehicle.  Since this work is his main source of income, he must have his vehicle in the best possible condition. José has plans to buy a set of wheels and repair the bodywork to improve the appearance of his vehicle.

loans.use: to make improvements to his vehicle

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Battambang province, Chanthou is 48 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school and the other two are in university. She grows cassava on three hectares area as her main source of income. Moreover, she grows rice on one hectare to supplement her income.

This is Chanthou's fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide and pay for harvest cost. She hopes that she can get more yields.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and pay for harvest cost.

loans.name: Ron

texts.en: A father of eight dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Ron is 56 years old. He struggles to support his famiiy via cassava growing and rubber planting. For Ron, this is his third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid back his past loans wisely to improve his living condition in a gradual pace. He will spend his entire loan portion to pay tuition fee for his son who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Finance and Banking. He hopes that his son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for his son who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Finance and Banking.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang, 42, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two dependent children, one is in school and one is in university. To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows cassava and pepper as her main source of income. Moreover, she earns extra income via selling grocery items. She can earn income about 8.10 USD per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to pay tuition for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Biology. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Biology.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria continua dedicándose a su negocio de salón de belleza, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de peinados,cortes,tintes entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de tientes, tijeras, secadoras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria continues to work at her beauty salon. She is a responsible and enterprising person. She continues to offer different types of hairstyles, cuts, colors, and other services. This allows her to move her family forward.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy hair color, scissors, dryers, and other items.

She is grateful for the loan she is receiving and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy hair color, scissors, dryers, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chair and clippers and to contract an employee.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 55-year-old married woman with five children from Albuera, Leyte. She has five children who are mostly adults; the youngest is thirteen. Delia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the education of her child. Perla has been in the hog raising business for twenty-two years now. She takes every opportunity to earn a living. As of this time, Perla lacks the financial resources to improve her hog raising business. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements.

Perla dreams of expanding her venture to generate more income so that she will be able to continue sending her child to school for better learning and education. Moreover, she wanted to let her family experience fullness of life. Any additional revenue will be used for reinvestment of the same business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Sokkhim

texts.en: A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Sokkhim is 35 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. Nowadays, she grows cassava on two hectares area as a single source of her income. She can earn income of about 41,700 KHR per day. For Sokkhim, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pay for labors and plowing cost. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pay for labors and plowing cost.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 37-year-old married woman with six children, residing in Mcarthur, Leyte. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 1 year old respectively. She owns and operates a passenger van. She has been engaged in this kind of business for eight years now. Aside from operating a passenger van, she engages in farming.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to pay for the repair of the air conditioning in the van and to purchase farm supplies. This will improve the ventilation of the passenger van and create impact on her farming business as well. In the long run, both businesses will create a higher improvement on her day-to-day livelihood. Thus, providing her family with proper diets and better living condition.

In the future, Jocelyn is hoping she could continue send her children to school and help improve her livelihood status as well.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the air conditioning in her passenger van and to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and other materials.

loans.name: Crisencio

texts.en:
This is Crisencio. He sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan enhanced his business. He was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped him provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

He is very positive that he could improve his business more if you will let him borrow an amount of 50,000 PHP again. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for their jeepney. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Crisencio is working hard to expand his business as well and improve their general living conditions. He only dreams of giving his children a better future by providing for all their educational needs. He meets every week with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer. She sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy more coconut needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional 'buko' or coconut that she has to sell in the market. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Jennifer wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to help support the needs of her family. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for coconut needed in her business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng, 59, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and a mother of six children. She grows rice, and raises pigs and ducks as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn more income as a motor taxi driver. This is the fourth cycle for Heng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans wisely, to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. She will spend her loan to buy more motorbike to transport the factory worker. She hopes that she can earn more income to buy cows to raise.

loans.use: to buy more motorbike to transport the factory worker.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en: After running the pig business with his own capital, I Wayan resumed lending at MUK because he wants to expand his business. I Wayan plans to develop the pig business by making new cages and buying new sows. With 8,000,000 IDR loan, I Wayan can buy two sows, make three new iron cages and superior quality feed. He had dreams of being a successful seller of piglets. I Wayan is still doing his job as a driver to meet the needs of families every day. Being a successful pig farmer and making his family happy is the main goal of I Wayan.

loans.use: to purchase two sows, make three new iron cages and superior quality feed

loans.name: Sila's Group

texts.en:
Sila, 51, lives in Kampong Cham province and is a mother of seven children. She secures the basic needs in her family via cassava growing on one and a half hectares area. Moreover, she can earn more income via fish catching. This is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. 

She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for a plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree majoring in Finance and Banking.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Khim is 50 years old and a mother of three children. For her family, she grows beans as a single source of her income. Now she can earn income of about 33,800 KHR per day. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. 

She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her farmland. 

She hopes that she can improve her farmland better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Moon

texts.en:
Moon is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last many years. 

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore Moon has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Moon is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Residing  in Kampong Chhnang province, Chreb is 47 years old and a mother of seven children. 

To support her living, she grows rice on one and half hectares area and raises pigs to earn more income. She has been involved this business for ages and it earns her about 7 USD per day. 

For Chreb, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her family will have electricity to use like other families.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Senghorng's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Kampong Cham province, Senghorng is 30 years old and a mother of one kid. To support her family's condition, she grows cassava as a single source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 21,700 KHR per day. 

This is the second cycle for Senghorng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. In a group of two members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland.

loans.name: Marbely

texts.es: Marbely: Es una señora amable y alegre, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 33 años de edad, casada con dos hijos: La mayor de 14 años estudia su segundo año de secundaria y el menor de 7 años su segundo grado de primaria (se presenta en la fotografía). Con el propósito de apoyar con los ingresos en el hogar, desde hace 7 años estableció su pequeña pulpería, anteriormente alquilaba un tram, pagando mensualmente C$ 700 (Setecientos Córdobas Netos). Gracias al financiamiento anterior otorgado por PANA PANA, le han permitido construir un anexo de madera en su terreno, donde tiene su pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar un juego de muebles de sala y productos para su negocio: Jabón de lavar ropa, granos básicos, chiverías, huevos, sopas instantáneas, papel higiénico, pasta dental, cloro, pollo, carne molida, embutidos, gaseosas. Su sueño es construir una fosa séptica e inodoro, mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marbely is a friendly and happy woman from Puerto Cabezas, Nicaragua. She is 33 years old and is married with two children. Her older daughter is 14 and is a sophomore in high school and her younger son is 7 and is in second grade in elementary school (he is in the photograph). 

Seven years ago Marbely opened a small grocery store in the hopes of helping to generate income for her family. Before that she rented a market stall for which she paid 700 Nicaraguan Cordobas [about 26 dollars] every month. Thanks to the previous loan she took out with Pana Pana [Kiva Field Partner] she was able to build an additional structure on her property, where she now has her store. 

With this loan, Marbely would like to buy a set of living room furniture as well as products for her store: washing soap, cereal grains, snack food, eggs, chicken, ground beef, sausage, soft drinks, instant soup, toilet paper, toothpaste, and bleach. Her dream is to install a septic tank and toilet and to improve her store's infrastructure.

loans.use: buy a set of living room furniture and products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the sheets of metal, wood, nails, cement, sand, and gravel she needs to cement the floor and change the roof in her house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 30-year-old married woman, and a mother of three children aged 10, 9, and 6. Evelyn lives with her family in Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in the hog-raising business for more than eight years now. She is also a fish vendor.

Evelyn is a hardworking person. She wants to give her best, in order to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed and fish to sell. With a loan, Evelyn will be able to grow healthy pigs, and also sell more fish in the market.

In the future, Evelyn hopes of making her business sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed and fish to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be good. She operates a retail shop where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a shoe exhibition within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita de 39 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es un hombre trabajador y se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo; ellos son padres de  4 hijos,  y solo dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando viven con felicita y su esposo.

Felicita, trabaja como domestica desde hace tres años, los oficios los aprendió de sus padres desde que era joven trabajaba en su casa, luego que estaba sin trabajo quiénes son sus patrones ahora le llamaron para que trabajara donde ellos.  El lugar donde trabaja le queda a 15 minutos de su casa y se traslada a pie. Casi siempre trabaja de 7 A.M a 5 P.M

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 10 metros de tierra que le vende su hermana, para rellenar el terreno donde tiene su casa.  El crédito mejorara su calidad de vida, ya que tendrá más espacio para sus hijos y podrá cercar mejor su propiedad, será satisfecha la necesidad de tener más amplio su terreno.


El sueño de Felicita es construir más grande su vivienda, ya que con la tierra que va comprar se le hará más fácil y así no tendrá problemas con sus vecinos. Todo esto lo va lograr con esfuerzo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Felicita, 39, is married. Her husband is a hard-working man and works by planting basic grains such as corn, beans, and sorghum. They have four children and two of them are in school and live with Felicita and her husband.

Felicita has worked in the home for three years. She learned these skills from her parents and had worked in the home from a young age. As soon as she didn’t have work, her parents called her so she could work with them. Her workplace is 15 minutes from her house and she walks there. She almost always works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.

The loan that she’s requesting from CrediCampo is to buy ten meters of earth being sold by her sister so she can fill in the land by her house. This loan will improve her quality of life because she’ll have more space for her children and she’ll be able to better enclose her property. She will be happy to satisfy the need of having more land.

Felicita’s dream is to build a larger home. With the earth she will buy, it will be easier and she won't have problems with the neighbors. This will all be achieved with effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy ten meters of earth being sold by her sister so she can fill in the land by her house.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en: Rhodora is 38 years old from the municipality of Albuera, Leyte. She is married with two children aged fifteen. For many years, Rhodora has been engaged in raising pigs and selling affordable clothes locally known as RTW or Ready-to-wear clothing. RTW is cheaper compared to designer clothes. Most customers are into this kind of clothes for being trendy. Rhodora is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more clothes to sell and feed to keep her pigs healthy. She dreams of expanding her business in the future so she can keep her children in school and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and feed to keep her pigs healthy

loans.name: Flor De Naranja Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FLOR DE NARANJA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de la Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys ella es conviviente y tiene 29 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz,cacao, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz,cacao, trigo y quinua.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de frutas.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “FLOR DE NARANJA”. This bank is located in the Huayopata district, Convencion province and Cusco department.

Gladys is a member. She is married, 29 years old, and has 2 children. She has a business selling grains. She sells corn, cacao, wheat and quinoa. She works from 8 AM until 5 PM. She has had this business for 4 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her grains. She seeks a loan to buy corn, cacao, wheat and quinoa.

The other members have businesses selling animals, selling grains, grocery store, selling fruit. Gladys is thankful to those who form part of this dream through their support and she promises to make the loan payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn, cacao, wheat and quinoa.

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
Juana de 28 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene dos hijos y ambos estudian. Su esposo es docente y es quien trabaja para mantener a la familia. Ella es ama de casa y se encarga de hacer los oficios del hogar y cuidar de sus hijos pero admite que le gusta mucho cocinar.

Solicita el préstamo para aplicar una capa de cemento a las paredes de su casa,comprará material y pagara mano de obra ya que son de adobe y están expuestas, con esto se volverán más resistentes al tiempo y su familia tendrá más seguridad. Juana espera tener el apoyo de CrediCampo para que en un futuro le apoye para cambiar el piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Juana, who is 28 years old, is in a relationship and has two children, both in school.  Her husband is a teacher and it's he who works to support their family.  She is a housewife in charge of the housework and taking care of the children, but she acknowledges that she really likes to cook.

Juana is asking for the loan to apply a layer of cement to the walls of her home.  She will buy the materials and pay for labor.  The work is needed  since the walls are made of adobe, without any covering.    With this addition, they will be more resistant to wear, and her family will enjoy greater  security.  Juana hopes to have the support of CrediCampo so that in future the organizaation may help her to replace the floor in her home.

loans.use: to apply a layer of cement to the walls of her home

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
In 2013, Leonardo  had his first loan from PMPC. He is from Tangub City, Philippines. Leonardo is 47 years old and is married. 

He and his wife help together in raising their family. They were stretching their resources to sustain the family needs, especially the education of their children. Leonardo was playing with the idea to start a bakery business, since he and his wife have the baking skills, but have no starting capital. He joined PMPC after hearing that he can request financial assistance.  Leonardo applied for a loan to start his bakery business, and it's doing well. 

Recently, he requested a loan to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients, to increase his production, to provide for more customers. And he has planned to roll up his additional revenue for the fast-approaching holiday season. Leonardo is thankful for financing his capital needs. In addition, he wants to expand and improve his business and hopes to live a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients, to increase his production, to provide for more customers

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Fidelia de 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 32 y 29 años de edad, su hija estudió hasta 5° grado de educación básica, pero Fidelia al igual que su hijo no tuvieron esa oportunidad, su espose es agricultor, actualmente él, su hija y dos nietos viven con ella.

Fidelia es comerciante y desde hace 5 años tiene una tienda de productos básicos que comenzó por iniciativa, además vende pupusas y bebidas frías, por lo general lo hace en su casa  para que le apoye su familia.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, producto de higiene personal y demás para su tienda, piensa que es necesario hacer esta inversión para estar prevenidos por el aumento en las ventas que ha tenido últimamente. Espera que con su negocio cubra los gastos de estudio de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Fidelia, 60, is married and two children ages 29 and 32. Her daughter studied until 5th grade, but Fidelia and her son never had the chance to go to school. Her husband is a farmer and currently he, their daughter and two grandchildren live with Fidelia.

Fidelia is a merchant and for 5 years she has run a store selling basic products that she started on her own initiative. She also sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and cold beverages. She generally works out of her home so that she has help from her family.

She asks for a loan to buy basic grains, drinks, snacks, personal hygiene items and more to stock her store. She thinks that this investment is needed to adjust to her recent increase in sales. She hopes that her business will cover the cost of schooling for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, snacks, personal hygiene items and more.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en: Roselle is an employee with two children and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has a riceland where she generates extra income to sustain the needs of her family. However, her riceland needs assistance with its physical features. She needs to buy fertilizers and chemicals to maintain the growth of her plants. This is the reason why she requested a loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC to have a good crop harvest. This is a big help for Roselle and for her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals for rice cropping, to maintain the growth of the plants

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 56 years old, married, and a resident of Sto. Niño, Pagadian City. She earns a living by selling fish. She has been a member of PMPC for many years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000.  She will use it to buy boxes of fish to sell, to sustain her family's living. Rosalinda deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell, to sustain her family's living.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 58 years old and lives in Tuburan District, Pagadian City. In order to help the family, she has a sari-sari store. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 20,000. She will use the loan to purchase inventory, such as soft drinks, canned goods, candies, chocolates, etc. She plans to send her children to college, so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, such as soft drinks, canned goods, candies, and chocolates.

location.town: Pagadian - Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga Del Su

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 52 years old, married, and a resident of Tuburan District, Pagadian City. She earns a living by making furniture. She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use the loan to buy materials for her furniture-making business, such as wood, vanish, paints, etc. Vilma deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy materials for her furniture-making business, such as wood, vanish, and paints.

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012. She appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900. This loan is intended to buy sacks of rice and cases of soft drinks, to satisfy the demands of the customers. Lina dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life, and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and cases of soft drinks, to satisfy the demands of the customers.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, 42, is a mother of seven children living in Battambang province. She struggles with her family condition via rice cropping on tawo hectares area and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. She can earn an income of about 31,100 KHR per day. 

This is her eighth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for the labor fee. 

She hopes that she can improve her family living condition better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay the labor fee.

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
One month before the settlement day, Ni Ketut, as the head, informed all the members of Sri Cendana group to prepare the repayment. With eight members, they made their repayment of 10,000,000 IDR. During the period, all the members can keep the pigs well. Nutritious feeds and controlling by the Vet make the pigs grow healthy and fat. They can sell at a good price. Ni Ketut sold her four pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. 

Sri Cendana group gets the new loan from MUK. With the eight members, total loan of 10,000,000 IDR. The loan period will be used to buy piglets and repair cages. 

Ni Ketut is using a loan to buy superior piglets and feed. The price for superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from 500,000 - 600,000 IDR. These pigs will be maintained for five months for fattening. Ni Ketut expects that during the loan period, the pig will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. One member can’t attend the meeting because of a religious ceremony at her Temple.

loans.use: to buy superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en: Cherry Mae is vending, at her little sari-sari business in Dao, Pagadian City, Philippines. She is 28 years old and has been a PMPC member for four years. Her business helps her to meet the needs of her family. She has many customers in her business, and as a result she needs to purchase stock for her sari-sari business. Because of this demand, she availed a loan amount of PHP 14,000. This help, provided by PMPC, will help Cherry Mae to gain more customers.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, rice, canned goods, shampoo, and other stock for the sari-sari.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion has farmland, consisting of various plants and animals. She lives in Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She sustains the welfare of her family through her farm. However, every farm needs proper maintenance to be a beautiful and productive one. Because she needs to buy fertilizer and spray, she borrowed an amount of PHP 13,000. This financial assistance given to Salvacion will help her to beautify her farm's surroundings.

loans.use: to buy spray and fertilizer, for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her sewing business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in sewing pillow cases, bed sheets, and curtains. Filipinos love to decorate their homes especially at the Christmas holidays. They usually want new curtains, pillow cases, and bed sheets at this time of the year. She also sells personal products of popular brands on the side. She earns a minimum of PHP 8000 a month. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Juanita hopes to grow her business. She dreams to improve their quality of life through all her hard work and grow in her relationship with God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her sewing business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has two children, ages 4 years and 10 years. He describes himself as social. He operates a retail business, where he sells mobile phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a safe and convenient place, and his primary customers are of all types.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a larger stock of mobile phone accessories. His business goal is to have bigger business premises, within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a better life and take his children to better schools. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock and to buy farm inputs to enable him to do farming.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin, a local resident from Kandal province, is 54 years old and a mother of six children; she does rice cropping as a single source of income to support her family condition. 

For Yin, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. 

She wants to focus on her son's education instead. Therefore, she applies for a new loan in order to pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue the bachelor degree majoring in Electrical. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree majoring in Electrical.

loans.name: Jake Clyde

texts.en:
Jake Clyde, a hardworking bachelor and young entrepreneur, is 24 years old. He is living with his parents in Tangub. Jake Clyde has always dreamed of managing his own business. He quit his job and invested his small savings in a rice retailing business, from which he earns a good income. Jake Clyde has had the business for three years now, and out of his revenue he helped his parents in renovating their house.

Jake Clyde recently signed up for his membership in Paglaum MPC, after he learned that he can access insurance and other financial assistance. He applied for a loan, to purchase additional floor tiles and bags of cement for their house. He is now on his way to repaying the loan with his profit. Jake Clyde wishes nothing more than to make his parents happy and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase additional floor tiles and bags of cement for their house.

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy, 48, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nardito and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nancy operates a pineapple growing farm. She grows pineapple in their farm located in Cavite, it is in the high lands where it is suited to grow pineapple. She sells her product to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nancy wants to have her own storehouse for the pineapple and other fruit staples that she sells. She dreams that she could also have enough savings for their house renovation. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies she needs to continue the operation of her farm business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is thankful that she was granted an 11,000 PHP loan which she used to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She also has a small farm at her backyard. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense.

She would now like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Part of the loan she will use to buy farm fertilizers to yield a good crop. It is very important that her jeepney is always in a good running condition to ensure continuous efficient service to her customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment the financial help that will be given her for it will greatly help in sending her child to college. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Marilou hopes to save to be able to buy another jeepney. She wants to give her children the best education until college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Aineah

texts.en:
Aineah is a married man. He has three children, with ages ranging from 3 to 12 years. He describes himself as motivated. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a populated area, and his primary customers are travelers. He says his biggest business challenge is insecurity.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle engine for his old motorcycle. His business goal is to have a vehicle, within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life for his family and expand business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle engine for his old motorcycle.

loans.name: Gelacio

texts.en:
Gelacio is thankful that he was granted a 19,000 PHP loan which he used to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle. Through his earnings he is able to send his child to school and meet their daily living expense. 

He would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy tires and fuel and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle. It is very important that his jeepney is always in a good running condition to ensure continuous efficient service to his passengers. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his transport business and the financial help that will be given him for it will greatly help in sending his child to college. He wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Gelacio hopes to save to be able to buy another tricycle unit. He dreams to improve their quality of life and aims to give his child the best education until college. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Lorena Concepción

texts.es:
Lorena de 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos estudiando. Estudio hasta bachillerato, su esposo es agricultor solo él y sus hijos viven con ella. Ella hoy en dia es ama de casa se dedica totalmente a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar a sus hijos  mientras su esposo trabaja.

Solicita el préstamo para terminar los acabados de su casa, tiene que comprar las puertas para poder habitarla. Lorena tiene pensado iniciar un negocio y vender tortillas para ayudar con los gastos de la casa a su esposo.
texts.en:
Lorena, 31, is married and has three school-aged children. She studied through high school. Her husband is a farmer and lives at home with Lorena and their children. Lorena is a housewife who takes care of all the household needs and watches her children while her husband works.

She asks for a loan to put the finishing touches on their house. She needs to buy doors in able to move in. Lorena plans to start a business selling tortillas to help her husband with the costs of the home.

loans.use: to buy doors for her house so that she can move in.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena lives in Oecusse and is a business women. She has been doing business since 2006 with her own working capital of $200. She is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store; flour, aqua, biscuits, noodles, candies, balm, cigarettes, rice, shampoo, coffee, lighters and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, aqua, biscuits,  noodles, candies, balm, cigarettes, rice, shampoo, coffee, lighters and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2008. She appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900. This loan is intended to buy flowers, fertilizers, and pesticides. Merlina dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life, and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy flowers, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia es una mujer de 41 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 14 y12 años, y su negocio es la venta de mochilas, carteras, bolsones para viaje, etc.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, paciente, constante y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un puesto de venta en la calle, en la populosa feria ’16 de Julio’ caracterizada por el comercio informal; donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor para arar. De clima frio y seco (2ºC -12ºC), a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Sofia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (pollera, manta y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica al transporte interdepartamental, sus hijos estudian en la escuela y toda la familia vive en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la venta de; mochilas, carteras, bolsones para viajes, maletín, bolsa de mensajero, minibandoleras, tote (los totes son bolsos de asas para llevar a la mano), flight bag, etc. Labor que realiza los jueves y domingos durante todo el día en la feria 16 de julio, el resto de los días ambula en diferentes ferias y mercados, “empecé como vendedora ambulante, luego me compré un puesto en la feria 16 de julio y también en otra feria…” comenta. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de mercadería por mayor para abaratar costos y tener productos para vender. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sofia solicita un préstamo para la compra de bolsos, carteras y maletas de viaje por mayor para abaratar costos y ofrecer  a sus clientes mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Sofia is a 41 year old married woman who has two children ages 14 and 12. Her business is selling backpacks, wallets, suitcases, etc. She is a good mother, responsible, patient, constant, and hard-working. She has a stall on the sidewalk for her business in the busy "16 de Julio" area which is known for its informal businesses where one can find anything from a sewing needle to a plowing tractor. This area has a cold and dry climate (2-`12 degrees centigrade) at 3800 meters above sea level.

Sofia has a dark complexion, long curly hair, and dresses traditionally (layered skirt, shawl, hat); her first language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for business. She lives with her husband who is an interstate driver. Her children are in school and the whole family lives in its own home with potable water, electricity, and gas.

Her business is selling backpacks, wallets, suitcases, messenger bags, totes, flight bags, etc. She works Thursdays and Sundays, all day, in 16 de Julio. The other days she travels to other markets. She states, "I began as a street vendor, then I bought a stand in 16 de Julio and one in another market."

Her dream is that her children become professionals and to build her house. She wishes to expand her business by buying merchandise at wholesale to reduce costs and offer her customers greater variety.

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in 8 years that she has had this business. For this reason Sofia seeks a loan to buy purses, wallets, and suitcases at wholesale to reduce costs and offer her customers greater variety.

loans.use: to buy purses, wallets, and suitcases at wholesale to reduce costs and offer her customers greater variety.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rustico acompañada por su conviviente y sus hijos, pero 02 de ellos son económicamente independientes y sólo 01 que tiene 10 años depende de ellos. Candelaria vive en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú, contando con servicios de agua y luz.Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Candelaria es la cria y venta de animales menores(patos, gallinas, conejos, cuyes, etc.) con una antigüedad en el negocio de 4 años, esta actividad la realiza en su casa de material rustico. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de una cantidad mayor de animales para poder aumentar y diversidad su stock, para poder atender los diferentes gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios y buenas ganacias.
texts.en:
Candelaria, 49, is married and lives in a rustic home with her husband and children. Two of her children are grown and financially independent and only one, aged 10, is still dependent on her. Cendelaria lives in a rural part of the district of Pucará in Jaén province, region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. She has water and electricity services for her home. People in her community work primarily in farming, cattle and commerce.

Candelaria raises and sells small animals (ducks, hens, rabbits, guinea pigs, etc), an activity she has been doing for four years out of her home. The loan will be used to buy more animals so that she can increase and diversify her stock. This will help her tend to the different tastes and preferences of her consumers. In the short term, this will increase her profits, and ultimately it will improve the quality of life for her family. There isn't much competition in the area so she can get good prices for her animals and make good profits.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase and diversify her stock.

loans.name: Pudak Sari Wangi Group

texts.en:
The Pudak Sari Wangi group proposed a loan to develop their pig  business. After several loan cycles, the group succeeded in maintaining the pigs and proved to help the families' income. The pigs can grow fat and healthy, they can sell them at the high price, and of course they had a satisfactory profit.

Now after evaluating and considering the season now, now is the rainy season, the Pudak Sari Wangi continue their loan and use it for farming. All of them are also farmers. And now they receive an increasing loan size. They will use the loan to purchase seeds, farming tools and fertilizer. They still manage the pigs at their home. 

Ni Luh uses her portion of the loan to buy farming tools and fertilizer for her cacaos, cloves, coconut and other crops in her garden. She hopes that six months from now she can increase the result from her garden. Ni Luh and other member of Pudak Sari Wangi group expect a long-lasting partnership with MUK, until they have enough savings to continue their effort with their own money.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Jairus

texts.en: Jairus is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of meat, and renovate his business premises. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat and renovate his business premises

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 60 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es una tienda con artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es independiente, fuerte, luchadora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizado por el comercio informal de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Juana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza sola con su trabajo, vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es una tienda de abarrotes con alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, fideo, arroz, leche, refrescos, etc. Se encuentra ubicado en su casa, que es un lugar muy comercial, “a mi edad es difícil ser independiente, por suerte me va bien y sin mucho esfuerzo, el secreto es abrir todos los días desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche…” comenta. su sueño es tener una tienda más grande y desea realizar la compra de mercadería por mayor para estar abastecida para fin de año. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad por mayor, para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a 60-year old woman who is single and has no children. Her business is a store that sells food items and basic necessities.

Juana is independent, strong, determined, responsible and hard-working. She operates her business in the southern part of the city, which is characterized by informal trade and a warm, tropical and humid climate. The temperature there ranges from 21-35 degrees Celsius all year round.

Juana has a dark complexion, long, black hair and she is short in stature. Her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish to run her business. Juana has a small grocery store and sells basic necessities such as bread, sugar, noodles, rice, milk, sodas etc. She runs the shop out of her home, which is a quite commercial. She says, "at my age, it is difficult to be independent. Luckily, it has gone well for me and without a lot of effort. The secret is to open up shop every day early in the morning and stay open until late at night." Juana's dream is to have a bigger shop, and she wants to make her purchases wholesale to have her store well-stocked for the New Year. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has run her business.

These are the reasons Juana is requesting a loan- to purchase wholesale food and basic necessities to stock up her business.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale food and basic necessities to stock up her business.

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
Edwin de 25 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica, no continuó por no tener la capacidad económica para cubrir los gastos. Su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

Edwin desde muy joven trabajaba con su padre en el campo después de salir de estudiar, hoy en día se dedica a la venta de pan que él y su pareja de vida elaboran por la mañana para luego salir a vender por las tardes de casa en casa.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar material y construir un horno artesanal, el que tiene ya se quedó pequeño en comparación a la demanda de producto que tiene. Su más grande sueño es construir su propia vivienda con el fruto de su esfuerzo en la venta de pan para vivir cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 25 years old, married, and has two children. He went to school until the 9th grade, but didn't continue because he didn't have the economic resources to cover the expenses. His partner is a housewife and only she and the children live with him.

From a very young age, Edwin worked with his father in the fields after he got out of school. Now he works selling bread that he and his life partner make in the morning, so that later they can sell it house-to-house in the afternoons.

He is requesting the loan to buy materials and build an artisanal oven. The one he has is now too small compared to the demand he has for his product. His biggest dream is to build his own home with the fruit of his labors selling bread, so that he can live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy materials and build an artisanal oven

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
The humid and rocky Kapsaiya area within the Kapsowar area of Kenya can be considered a hardship area. Even with savannah plains and little human activity, there exists a farm that stands tall, a farm with over two high-pedigreed Freshian cows, producing over 20 litres of milk. It’s quite an outstanding feat, considering the harsh terrain and other handicaps, like the lack of electricity from the national grid, and also because of being dependent on traditional methods of harvesting water. 

Kiva lenders, meet Mathew, the man credited with the success story of the farm. He is a loving husband with two children ,and has been farming for the past 10 years. Mathew passionately loves dairy farming, and this can be attested to by the fact that he knows his cows, each individually, because he works with them twice a day, 365 days a year. He and his wife have even named one of them “Birirmet.” 

Because he loves the cows, he runs his operation by four simple rules that have kept him and his herd happy. The rules are: breed them well, feed them well, clean them well and milk them well. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business that he engages in to make ends meet. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses, but he has still kept hope alive that he will improve. He is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Juhudi Kilimo serves poor smallholder farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to the farmers, Juhudi helps them acquire assets like dairy cows, poultry, irrigation equipment, and greenhouses. 

Through this loan from Kiva lenders, Mathew will buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income, and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan, and will also go toward the education of his children. 

He will also benefit from the cow manure, which will be used to increase the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan, he will also be able to build a bio-gas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions. Mathew waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a good quality dairy cow

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos ya mayores y que le apoyan en sus gastos, su esposa es ama de casa. Él es agricultor y tiene mucha experiencia en el área, cultiva granos básicos principalmente maíz y frijol. 

Solicita el préstamo para cubrir los gastos para cosechar, esta próximo el tiempo en que tiene que sacar su cultivo y prepararlo para guardarlo o venderlo. Juan tiene pensado aplicar una capa de cemento a las paredes de su casa, son de adobe y con eso serán más resistentes al paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Juan is 64 years old and married, with 5 grown children that help him with his expenses. His wife is a homemaker. He is a farmer and has a lot of experience in the field. He cultivates basic grains, mainly corn and beans. 

He is requesting this loan to cover his harvesting expenses, as the season is approaching when he will need to harvest his crops and prepare them to be stored or sold. 

Juan hopes one day to cover the walls in his house with a layer of cement, as they are made of adobe and with this coating would better resist the passing of time.

loans.use: to cover his harvesting expenses.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.es:
Delfin tiene 46 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con luz y agua en su vivienda; la miama que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú. Delfin es natural de la zona. La comunidad donde vive es pequeña y los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno y a la agricultura de arroz.

La actividad que desarrolla Delfin es la comercialización de platano, siembra de arroz en campaña, y además se dedica también a la crianza de ganado vacuno. Delfin solicita su crédito para adquirir un motor de 4 pulgadas para el bombeo de agua ya que en su parsela tiene un pozo y su motor actual le esta fallando. El objetivo Delfin es comprar el motor, para poder regar su parsela y vender el agua a sus vecinos. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Delfin is 46-years old. He is single and has two children. He lives in his parents house, and they have electricity and water in their home. Their home is located in the District and Province of Morropón, Piura Region, on Perú's northern coast. Delfin is a native of the area. The community where he lives is small, and the people makes their livings raising cattle and growing rice.

Delfin's business is selling bananas and planting rice in the countryside. In addition, he earns his living raising cattle. Delfin is requesting his loan to acquire a 4-inch motor to pump water. His plot of land has a well, but the motor he currently has is failing.

Delfin's goal is to purchase the motor to be able to water his plot of land and to sell water to his neighbors. This will allow him to improve his income in a short period of time, increase his profits and, therefore, improve his own quality of life as well as his family's.

loans.use: to acquire a 4-inch motor for pumping water.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be flexible. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to own a boutique within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will grow his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 to 15 years old. She describes herself as honest and god fearing. 

She operates a farm where she grows green grams (mung beans), cabbages, onions etc. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finance. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy seeds, pesticides and pay for labor costs. 

Her business goal is to be the best farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her farming business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, pesticides and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has two children, aged 5 years and 10 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells ladies shoes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in fashion trends. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to be able to import shoes within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will sell in wholesale. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Ana Yaneth

texts.es:
Ana de 36 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora actualmente vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos estudiantes de 6°, 3° y 1° grado de educacion básica. Ana labora como promotora de salud desde hace 10 años en el mismo lugar donde reside. Ademas, aprendió el oficio de corte y confección que en sus tiempos libres aprovecha para hacer unos trabajitos y asi obtener un poco mas de ingresos para los gastos de la casa.

  El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un terreno que ofertan a un bajo costo, pero a ella y su esposo les faltaba una parte del dinero para completar y pagarlo.

Su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos junto con su esposo y lograr que ellos sean unos profecionales a futuro para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 36-year-old hardworking woman who currently lives with her husband and her three children, these last ones attending to the 6th, 3rd and 1st year of elementary school. 

Ana has worked like a health promoter for the last 10 years at the same place where she lives. She also learned the trade of dressmaking, and in her spare time she uses these skills to obtain more incomes for the household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a plot that is being offered at a low cost. However, she and her husband don’t have the enough money to pay for it. 

Her dream is to get her children ahead with the help of her husband, and help them become professionals so in the future they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a plot that is being offered at a  low cost.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a single woman. She has three children, whose ages range from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she makes sweaters to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are retailers and schools. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of thread. Her business goal is to have a big knitting shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of thread

loans.name: Juan Fernando

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 21 años, con animoso de estudiar, de ser alguien de buscar un mejor futuro y encaminar su familia por un mejor camino, al provenir de una familia humilde no tiene el dinero para pagar sus estudios, por tal razón a partir del emprendimiento solicita un apoyo para iniciar su propio negocio de salsamentaría que es una tienda donde ofrecen mayor variedad de productos.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá iniciar en el local que ven en la foto, podrá adecuarlo e iniciar a generar su propio ingreso.
Juan espera el apoyo de toda persona que apoye a un joven que quiere cambiar su futuro a partir de trabajo y estudio, no quiere tener el destino de sus amigos que recayeron en las drogas y en vandalismo por tal razón ayuda a este joven con sed de progreso.
texts.en:
Juan is a 21-year old young man with a desire to study, to be someone looking for a better future and to direct his family toward a better path.  Juan comes from a humble family that didn't have the money to pay for his schooling.  That is why he is undertaking a new enterprise.  He is requesting a loan to start is own "salsamentaría" business; a store that offers a large variety of products for sale. 
With the help of the loan, Juan will be able to open for business in the store front shown in the above photo.  He will be able to fix it up and start generating his own income. 
Juan hopes for the support of anyone who would help a young man wanting to change his future through work and education.  He doesn't want to have the same future as his friends, who have fallen into drug use and vandalism.  And so help this young man with a thirst for advancement.

loans.use: to rent and fix up a storefront (shown in the photo).  He is a 21-year old young man looking to change his present situation by working and studying.

loans.name: Naghma

texts.en:
Naghma is 48 years old and lives with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns an auto spare parts shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, and lives near his shop. His shop is situated in the vehicle spare parts market, and it is challenging for him to sell his product with his competitors. This competition highly affects his daily sales. 

To grow his business, income, and abstain from the competitors, he decided to offer some additional and stylish spare parts. Naghma's son hopes that this strategy will work positively and the customers will attract towards his new products. Therefore, Naghma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy some additional and stylish spare parts. She says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her son's auto spare parts shop

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie signed up for her membership with PMPC, and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Margie is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce, to have family income

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander has owned and operated a transportation service  for over ten years to earn a living. He had supported  the family's daily needs with this income aside from farming. While he waits for the cropping and harvesting season, he does transportation services to earn. His previous loan used for buying spare parts and accessories has been repaid successfully. 

Recently, he took a new loan to buy tires and repair his  motorcycle for transportation services. He also used his motorcycle to commute between his farm and another village in town. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle to expand his business in the near future.
