loans.use: to buy tires and repair his  motorcycle for transportation services, and also use it  to commute between his farm and another village in town.

loans.name: Ada Cristela

texts.es:
Ada de 37 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene un hijo que esta estudiando 1er grado de educación básica. Ella estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su pareja es agricultor solo él y su hijo viven con ella.

Ada se dedica a lavar y planchar ropa ajena desde hace 6 años durante las mañanas, por las tardes elabora tamales de elotes y otros antojos para vender. Solicita el préstamo para pagar el arrendamiento de 10,000 mts cuadrados de terreno para sembrar y comprar semilla, fertilizantes y pesticidas.

Ada sueña con que su hijo se forme académicamente y sabe que podrá lograrlo si sigue trabajando duro.
texts.en:
Ada is 37-years old.  She is married and has one son, who is in his first year of primary school.  Ada, herself, went to school through 9th grade.  Her husband is a farmer.  She lives only with her husband and their son. 

For the last six years, Ada has made her living taking in clothing to wash and iron in the mornings and making and selling corn tamales and other snacks in the afternoons.  She is requesting the loan to rent 10,000 square meters of land to plant on and to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. 

Ada hopes for her son to excel academically, and she knows he can do it if he keeps working hard.

loans.use: to rent 10,000 square meters of land to plant on and to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to help provide for her family, especially for her children. For the past years she has run her own variety store and has made a good living doing so.

Helen has taken out and successfully repaid previous loans for her sari-sari store through CCT. Now she is applying for another loan, this time in the amount of 19,000 PHP. The new loan will be used for her auto repair shop. She has to buy additional equipment, spare parts and other things needed for the maintenance and operation of her shop.

Helen is determined to earn a greater income so she can better provide for her family. She sincerely wishes to give you heartfelt thanks and appreciation for any assistance in advance.

All CCT community clients, including Helen, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy equipment, spare parts and other supplies she needs to continue the operation of her auto repair shop.

loans.name: Reyes De Los Santos

texts.es: Reyes de 55 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, por medio de su tienda de productos básicos, la cual instalo en su vivienda hace 3 años. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo y su nieto, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecha de poderles ofrecer un lugar seguro donde vivir. Reyes desea que su tienda tenga una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su familia, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pan dulce, golosinas, galletas, huevos, detergente, jabón, cloro, sachets de champú, etc. Para que su tienda más productos que ofrecer y así dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Reyes is 55-years old.  She is an enterprising woman who works hard each day to support her household with the store she set up in her some three years ago.  Her store sells basic necessities.  
Reyes lives in her own home with her son and her grandson.  She feels happy and satisfied to be able to offer them a safe place to live.  
Reyes wants her store to have a greater quantity of products to offer for sale.  She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sweetbreads, sweets, crackers, eggs, detergents, soap, bleach, shampoo packets etc. so her store can offer more products for sale and she can better serve her customers.

loans.use: to invest in sweetbreads, sweets, crackers, eggs, detergents, soap, bleach, shampoo packets etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a new cart, which he will use as a means of transportation for his products.

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en: Imaculada is requesting a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as noodles, aqua, coffee, candy, condiments and other things to sell, including soft drinks. Imaculada started to open her kiosk in 2004 with her own working capital of $100.00. She sells to move where, because where there is market day, she also brought trade goods to sell. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy noodles, aqua, coffee, candy, condiments and other things to sell, including soft drinks.

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.en: Sharaf is a 22-year-old single man living in Irbid. He is studying earth and environmental science. Sharaf is asking for a loan to pay his semester fees, because his dad’s income is not enough to pay for his fees and to support his five siblings.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Rubia Esperanza

texts.es:
Rubia de 37 años de edad está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos estudiando. Su pareja es carpintero y trabaja duro para la manutención de sus hijos. Rubia es comerciante, tiene una pupuseria y cuenta con bastante experiencia, desde muy joven aprendió y en el negocio le apoya una cuñada.

Rubia solicita el préstamo para comprar una cocina de plancha, así preparará su producto en mayor cantidad y más rápido para despachar eficientemente sus pedidos. Tiene pensado construir un local de trabajo para tener un área más cómoda y brindar mejor servicio.
texts.en:
37-year-old Rubia has two children, who are studying, and a partner. Her partner is a carpenter and he works hard to support their children. Rubia is a business owner. She sells stuffed tortillas and has quite a lot of experience. She learnt the business at a young age and her sister-in-law helps her with the business. 

Rubia is requesting the loan in order to buy a grill so she can prepare her product faster and in greater quantities in order to see to her orders more efficiently. She has thought of building a place for her to work so she can have a more comfortable area and offer better service.

loans.use: to buy a grill

loans.name: Nilda Nemia

texts.es:
Nilda es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura promedio entre 2-12 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
Nilda es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en casa de la abuela que está construida de adobe y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de marcas como; Yanbal, Esika, Avon y otros. Los productos que mayormente vende son; lápiz labial, sombras, perfumes, aretes, maquillajes, etc. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda en un lugar estratégico, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de una computadora portátil, para realizar ventas y pedidos al detalle y por mayor. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nilda solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para realizar ventas al detalle y por mayor.
texts.en:
Nilda is a woman of 35. She is single and has two children, ages 8 and 10. Her business is selling cosmetics.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, independent, persistent, patient, responsible, and hard-working. She carries out her business as a street vendor in various fairs in the city, which has a cold and dry climate, with an average temperature between 2 and 12 degrees centigrade, which varies during the day.

Nilda has a dark complexion, short stature, and long, tied-back black hair. Her mother tongue is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her children, who are in school. They live in the grandmother's house, which is made of adobe and has potable water, electricity, and gas. 

Her business is selling cosmetics of brands such as Yanbel, Esika, Avon and others. The products that she principally sells are lipstick, eye shadow, perfumes, earrings, make-up, etc. Her dream is to expand her business and have a store in a strategic location. She wants to invest in her business through the purchase of a portable computer in order to make retail and wholesale sales and orders. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the five years that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Nilda is applying for a loan to purchase a portable computer to make retail and wholesale sales.

loans.use: to buy a portable computer to make retail and wholesale sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional variety of fish and to purchase a pig and pig feed

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 20 to 30 years old. He operates a retail business where he sells scrap metal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are metal recycling companies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of scrap metal. His business goal is to open another business outlet within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of scrap metal

loans.name: Celia Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Celia Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell beauty products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Celia Fe is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of beauty products to sell in her business.

Celia Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of beauty products to sell

loans.name: Cyd

texts.en:
Cyd is 54 years old and married with five children.

Cyd works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as rice, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

Cyd has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from processed food.

Cyd aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as rice, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she is earning an income as well. At the age of 64 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Luz wishes to become the supplier of crops in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Leovigilda

texts.en:
Leovigilda is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to buy raw ingredients. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would now like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings needed for her eatery business. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given to her.

Leovigilda dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her sewing business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. Filipinos prepare quite early for the Christmas season. They love to decorate their homes as early as the first week of December. She has to meet orders from her customers for new curtains and bed sheets in preparation for the Christmas holiday. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP a day. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Melania hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a bright future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en:
Several months had passed and the Sinar Rejeki group was able to pay off its prior loan on time. In the journey of its business, the group members are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs in a good way so that they get a satisfactory result. Because they get a satisfactory result, some of the members of the group earned enough money for saving. During this time, their activities were monitored by the Loan Officer for their achievements and serve as an example for other farmers. One member decided to resign after she earned enough profit and started a business with her own money. She was replaced by a new member.

Dewa Ayu sold all of her piglets and earns enough profit after deducting costs. From the profits she can fulfill her family's daily needs and saving requirements. She and all the members of the Sinar Rejeki group send their greeting to all Lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Because the prices of feeds are high, the Sinar Rejeki group applied for a new loan. Each member gets IDR1,500,000. The loan will be used to buy two high quality piglets and feed. To reduce costs, she still gives the mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and will not be attacked by disease. If she already had enough savings to venture capital, she would raise the pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy two high quality piglets and feed

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 22-year-old man from Iloilo, Philippines. He runs a small variety store business ("sari-sari") selling various goods and items to the people in his local community. Michael has operated his store for more than four years now. This is the source of his earnings. Michael wants to expand his store but lacks the financial resources to do so. As a result, he decided to join CEVI, a microfinance organization in the Philippines that caters to entrepreneurs like him. He is now requesting to borrow a loan worth PHP30,000 to buy more goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice, condiments, biscuits and chips, and shampoo and detergents. This loan will help him improve his inventory, thereby attracting more buyers and customers to his store. In the future, Michael hopes to make his business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice, condiments, biscuits and chips, and shampoo and detergents

loans.name: Sokveng

texts.en: Sokveng is a 20-year-old gas station attendant and an accounting freshman at a university in a city. He is from Takeo province in Cambodia. Being a gas station attendant, he can earn approximately $5 a day. Due to the fact that Sokveng is short of finances to pay for his tuition fee for a year, he decided to secure a loan. This loan will help him to go through the first year successfully. After graduation, he wants to work in a microfinance institution with a reasonable salary to improve his living.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Sokkheng's Group

texts.en: Sokkheng is a 40-year-old mother of two children living in Kampong Cham. To tackle with her family’s hardship, she grows cassava as her main source of income. In addition, her husband works for others for a fee to supplement income. Currently, she can earn an income of about KHR31,700 per day. For Sokkheng, this is her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of five to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her farmland.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro grows bananas and citrus fruits on their farm. With his desire provide their needs, Alejandro also grows pineapples on his farm. He is doing this because he wants to meet every need of his family. Alejandro says that it is hard to sustain at the same time, the cost of living and farming. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy organic fertilizers and pay for labor costs in caring for his pineapples until harvesting. Alejandro will be very glad if he obtains the loan to support his pineapple crop on his farm.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, and pay the labor costs to care for his pineapples until harvesting.

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province, Sen is 49 years old and a mother of four children. For her family's living condition, she grows rice on one hectare and works for others for a fee to earn more income. This is her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and pay for harvesting fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pay for harvesting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, cooking oils, batteries, flour, cigarettes, biscuits,  noodles, detergent, gambling cards and other things to sell.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa earns a living  by making and selling tableya (cacao beans) that are roasted and then packed in traditionally crafted banana paper. These are suitable to use to make hot chocolate drinks and the Filipino rice porridge (tsamporado). In the photo, Celsa displays her finished products of tableya, which is a coin shaped form and ready to deliver to her respective customers.

Aside from that, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various items like noodles, canned goods, beverages, eggs and soft drinks. She is 59 years old and a resident of Ormoc, Leyte.

Celsa is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more cacao seeds and stock for the store. With the loan, she can now have more supplies for tableya, (cacao chocolate tablets), and in the same manner, she can display various stocks for the store. In this way, this will cause her to improve her sales, thus being able to afford to buy healthy food. 

In the future, Celsa dreams of making her current business productive and sustainable

loans.use: to buy more cacao seeds and stocks for the store

loans.name: Valantino

texts.en: Valantino is 50 years old and married with three children living in Kasese Uganda. Valantino has been selling tomatoes since 2000 in order to get income for her family. She is a hardworking woman with a dream of expanding her business and buying land. However, she is faced with the challenge of limited capital and market competition. Valantino wants money to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon is a 56-year-old married rice farmer with four children from Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1979. Her husband is 53 years old and a motorcycle taxi driver. All of the children are garment and construction workers. Together, they can earn approximately $21.76 per day. Now Thon would like to request a loan to buy lumber to build a house for her daughter who has just gotten married. With this loan, she will able to build a house for her daughter. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland and build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house

loans.name: Noe Lizandro

texts.es: Noe es padre soltero vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Noe is a single father who lives in his own house with his two children.  He runs a bakery at home which he set up several years ago and has many customers because of the quality of the bread he bakes.  With the profit he earns he is able to cover the household expenses.

Noe is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, jellies, molds, etc. to continue working and to earn more income for a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, jellies, molds, etc.

loans.name: Rhuel

texts.en:
Rhuel is grateful that he was granted a 20,000 PHP loan that he used to buy raw materials for his stove-making business. Through his hard work and earnings, he is able to do rug-making as well and is able to support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

He would like now to apply for a PHP 27,000 loan, which he will use to purchase more raw materials to make stoves and rugs in preparation for the Christmas sales. It will definitely help cover his family’s daily needs and his children’s education expenses. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his investment and for the financial assistance that will be given to him.  

Rhuel dreams of being able to provide his children the best education to ensure them of a bright future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials to manufacture more stoves and fabrics to make rugs to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea de nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara.  Ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 20 años, vende ropa, como camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, calcetas, ropa interior, joyas, achinería y manteles para mesa. El producto lo exhibe en una vitrina en su casa y también vende de forma ambulante por pedidos. Para tener variedad de mercadería ha solicitado otro prestamo, que es el sexto ciclo con la institución y es por 25,000 lempiras, el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa nueva, achinería, lociones y joyas para aprovechar esta temporada de alta demanda. Tiene como meta tener un local o puesto estable en el mercado para la venta de mercadería y calzado ya que tiene buena experiencia en su negocio.
texts.en:
Emma, 50, is married and has four children.  She lives in a village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara and for 20 years has been selling clothing, shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, stockings, underwear, jewelry, trinkets and tablecloths.  Her products are on display at her home and she also works as a street vendor on an order basis.  In order to have a variety of merchandise she has requested a loan, her sixth in the institution, for 25,000 HNL which she will use to buy new clothing, trinkets, lotions and jewelry to take advantage of the high sales season.

Her goal is to have her own shop or stall at the market to sell merchandise and shoes, since she has good business expertise.

loans.use: To buy new clothing, trinkets, lotions and jewelry to take advantage of the high sales season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy many pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming on his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store like detergents, noodles, beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Rema Group

texts.fr:
Vincent fait partie du groupe  Rema et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 31 ans et est mariée à Ange, une photographe. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 1 à 5 ans, dont  1 étudie.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres de sa famille élargie qui étudient. 

Il  exploite un studio photo   depuis  8 ans. 

Il est à son  sixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une imprimante pour  produire beaucoup de  photos des clients, afin de gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  créer un studio  photo complet avec laboratoire, et voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Vincent is a member of the Rema Group, and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 31 years old and married to Ange, a photographer.  Together, they have two children aged one and five years old.  One of their children currently attends school.  He is also responsible for two further children from within his extended family.  Both of these children also attend school.

Vincent has been running a photography studio for eight years now.  This will be his sixth loan from the field partner, Turame.  The loan will increase his working capital and enable him to buy a printer to produce many photographs of his clients.  This will increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Vincent would like to create a photography studio complete with a printing laboratory.  He would also like to see his children continue to study.

loans.use: to buy a printer to produce many photographs of his customers.

loans.name: Liliney

texts.es: Liliney, es una emprendedora mujer de 32 años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de fritos, que son alimento de maíz procesado, plátano o yuca.  Su proceso productivo consiste en cocinar el maíz, la yuca y las papas cada una por separado, moler por separado y adquirir una masa de cada tipo, que luego es rellenada con diferentes ingredientes. Con el plátano es diferente la preparación, ya que no se cocina para moler sino que se sofríe en aceite bien caliente, luego es aplanado y rellenado.  Los productos terminados son comida típica en la región caribe Colombiana y son conocidos como “fritos”, cada producto tiene un nombre en particular; empanadas rellenas de carne de res, pollo o queso , arepas de dulce o de huevo, papas rellenas de carne de res, pollo o mixtas que contienen huevo cocido, patacones y caribañolas. Este negocio Liliney se lo compró a su antiguo propietario el cual presentaba un alto endeudamiento, por eso accedió a venderlo en el año 2012, desde entonces ha obtenido satisfactorios resultados. Sus ventas son canceladas inmediatamente, así mismo sus compras también las realiza de contado en tiendas aledañas al sector donde reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en insumos para la preparación de sus productos como huevos, harina de trigo, papas, maíz, aceite, sal, salsas, servilletas entre otros insumos. Liliney tiene 3 hijos a los que desea continuar educando y brindar un mejor futuro por eso es muy comprometida con su trabajo al que dedica 14 horas diarias.
texts.en:
Liliney, 32, is an entrepreneur who makes and sells fried foods using processed corn, banana, and yucca plant.  She cooks the corn, yucca and potatoes, each separately, grinds it and acquires different types of dough which she fills with varying ingredients.  Preparation of the banana is different since it is not ground but sauteed in hot oil, then flattened and stuffed.  The finished products are typical foods of the Colombian Caribbean region and known as "fritos" (fried foods).  Each one has its own name: beef, chicken or cheese patties, sweet egg cakes, beef, chicken or mixed meet stuffed potatoes with hard boiled eggs, banana fritters and croquettes.

Liliney bought the business from its previous owner who was badly in debt and sold the business in 2012.  Since then she has been obtaining satisfactory results.  Both her sales and purchases are conducted in cash, and she does her shopping in neighboring areas where she lives in Barranquilla.  She is requesting a CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy ingredients for her products such as eggs, wheat flour, potatoes, corn, oil, salt, sauces, knapkins and other items.  

Liliney has three children and wants to continue educating them and giving them a better future.  That is why she is so dedicated to her 14-hour work days.

loans.use: To buy eggs, wheat flour, potatoes, corn, oil, salt, sauces, knapkins and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Christmas products to sell.

loans.name: Chantheara

texts.en: Chantheara is a 23-year-old freshman taking a management major at a university. He is from Siem Reap province in Cambodia. He has also worked as a receptionist at a guesthouse since 2012, earning $7 a day. Now Chantheara would like to request a loan to pay his first-year tuition fee. With this loan, he will be able to finish the first year successfully. In the future, he is going to find a better job to help his parents.

loans.use: to pay his first-year tuition fee

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Desde El año 2010, Elida mujer de 63 años de edad, inició su negocio de producción y venta de alimentos, como panes y productos congelados como deditos, empanadas de carnes y diversas picadas.  Antes de emprender su actividad, generadora de ingresos, estudió en una escuela técnica especializada de Colombia, y aprendió el proceso de elaboración de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, para posteriormente con un pequeño capital, iniciar vendiendo entre sus vecinos, hasta que su hija decidiera promover los productos de tienda en tienda  y a propietarios de negocios de comidas rápidas,  lo que logró impulsarlo un poco más, y hoy sus deseos de crecimiento no se detienen. Elida vende no solo de contado, sino también a crédito, trabajando desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde todos los días, horario en el cual produce y ofrece los deliciosos productos en el sector donde habita. Su meta más adelante es tener su propio local,  para dar más posicionamiento a su microempresa, por eso necesita crecer y está aplicando a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como harina de trigo, grasas, queso etc, para incrementar su producción y con ello responder a la demanda decembrina que se acerca y trae consigo muchas fiestas familiares, que impulsan el consumos de los productos de calidad que vende Elida.
texts.en:
In 2010, 63-year-old Elida started a business making and selling food, such as bread and frozen goods, including meat pastries and various snacks.

Before starting this business to earn an income, Elida was studying at a specialised technical college in Colombia. There she learned how to make wheat-flour products and, with a little capital, started selling products to neighbours. 

Elida's daughter then began to try selling the products to different shopkeepers and owners of fast-food restaurants. This gave the business a bit more drive and now it just keeps on growing.

Elida does not just sell her goods for cash but on credit too. She works from 10am until 3pm, when she produces and sells her delicious products in the sector where she lives. 

Elida's future goal is to have her own premises, to give the business a better location. To do this Elida needs to expand and so is applying for a loan from "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" for her first loan. She will use it to buy basic supplies such as wheat flour, cheese, grease and more to increase production and respond to the demand in December that results from the many family parties. These parties always bring about an increase in sales of Elida's good-quality products.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies such as wheat flour, cheese, grease and more.

loans.name: Adévi Rébecca

texts.fr: REBECCA est une jeune femme mariée et mère deux enfants, puis est âgée  de 26 ans ;elle vit à Baguida et fait le commerce des pagnes qu’elle vend devant son domicile .REBECCA s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé ,commerce qu’elle a débuté depuis 2010.Dans le souci d’améliorer sa fréquence d’approvisionnement, elle sollicite un crédit pour aussi faire face à la concurrence afin de mieux vendre pour épargner en vue d’aider son marie dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Rebecca is a young, married woman with two children.  She is 26 years old and lives in Baguida.  She began selling pagnes (tradtional, wrap-around clothing) from the front of her home in 2010.  She buys her supplies three times a month from the main market in Lomé.  However, she would like to be able to improve the frequency with which she must buy supplies so, she has requested a loan.  The loan will also allow her to compete better against other retailers.

Rebecca would like to be able to help her husband provide for the needs of their household.

loans.use: to buy 7 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr: Commerçante des chaussures depuis 2010, ADAKOU est une femme battante âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants ; elle vit à Kpogan une localité de Baguida, et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché d’Avépozo situé à 5km de son domicile. ADAKOU désire un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock afin d’améliorer sa vente qui lui permettra de faire beaucoup plus de bénéfices, assurer l’éducation de ses enfants, mieux se nourrir et prendre soin de la santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Adakou has been selling shoes since 2010.  She is a tenacious, 39-year-old, married mother of three children.  She lives in Kpogan, a district of Baguida.

Twice a month she visits the Avépozo market, five kilometres from her home, to buy stock.  Adakou plans to increase her stock levels with the money from her loan.  This will improve her sales and profit levels.

With the increase in her earnings, Adakou will provide for her children's education, and provide for better food and healthcare for her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Rafiki Mwema Group

texts.fr:
Liliane  fait partie du groupe  Rafiki mwema et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à Célestin, un coiffeur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 4 à 15 ans, dont  3 étudient.
 
Elle exploite son  salon de coiffure depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des tondeuses modernes, pour servir efficacement ses clients et gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Liliane is a member of Rafiki Mwema Group and she lives in Bujumbura. She's 35 years old and married to Célestin, a hairdresser. They have 4 children together, and three of them go to school. Liliane has been running her hair salon for the past five years.

She's seeking her eight loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. She will use it to increase her working capital and buy modern hair clippers, in order to better serve her customers and increase her income.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to buy a land lot and see her children study.

loans.use: to buy moder hair clippers

loans.name: Julio Sabino

texts.es:
Julio, es casado, vive con su familia formada por su esposa, un hijo y dos nietos, todos son dependientes; su actividad económica es la fabricación de teja, aprendió a desarrollarla como mozo junto a su papá, luego decidió fundar su propio negocio, tiene 10 años de experiencia. Su horario de trabajo es 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.
Comprará zacate para quemar la producción de teja, con esto podrá seguir trabando por una larga temporada, sus ventas y ganancias serán mayores, espera mantener los clientes satisfechos y resarcir su deuda.
Sus proyectos son tener una fábrica de tejas más grande y mejorar la situación financiara familiar.
texts.en:
Julio is married and lives with his wife, son and two grandchildren who all depend on him.  His business if making tiles which he learned to do alongside his father.  He later decided to start his own business and has ten years' experience.  His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. 

He will buy hay to burn for tile production and this will provide him with long-term work.  His sales and earnings will increase and he hopes to keep his customers satisfied and pay off his debt.

His goal is to have a larger tile factory and improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: To buy hay for tile production to insure long-term work.

loans.name: Paaspanga De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur SIDIKI est le  représentant  du groupe PAASPANGA  DE ROLLO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé à 14 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Il  a 09 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait du maraichage depuis 04 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Il  veut  s’acheter  03 sacs d’engrais ; 04 boites de produit (insecticide).
Monsieur désire épargner ces bénéfices. Il  ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il compte s’essayer dans l’élevage.
texts.en:
Mr. Sidiki is the representative of Paaspanga De Rollo Group. He is doing well. He's married  and the father of six children. The eldest is 14 years old, the youngest is 7. Three of his children go to school. He has 9 people in his care.

He's been a garden farmer for the past 4 years. He gets his supplies at the market in his neighborhood. He wants to buy 3 sacks of fertilizers, and 4 boxes of insecticide product.

Mr. Sidiki would like to save his profits. He ambitions to expand his business and provide for his family's needs. He intends to try his hand at raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of fertilizers and 4 boxes of insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy reinforced concrete and nails for resale.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de quatre enfants, AKOUA vit à Avépozo et fait la restauration de la pâte fermentée communément appelée « Kome » emballée avec la balle de maïs ; elle s’approvisionne par manque de fond de roulement au moins deux fois par mois, puis vend en face du CEG  de la localité. AKOUA souhaite un prêt pour plus s'approvisionner afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’augmenter vue sa manière de les mettre à l’aise et de les accueillir ; ce qui lui permettra de gagner plus de bénéfices pour garantir l’éducation de ses enfants qui sont à sa seule charge.
texts.en:
Akoua is a widow and mother to four children.  They live in Avépozo.  Akoua prepares and sells 'Kome', a fermented paste wrapped in a ball of maize.  Due to shortage of funds, she must buy her supplies at least twice a month.  She then sells her Kome opposite the local high school. 

Akoua has requested a loan so that she can increase her stock levels and respond more efficiently to the demands of her customers.  As she is such a warm and welcoming person, she has many customers.  Akoua hopes to increase her earnings and be able to provide for the education of her children, as she is the only person who is responsible for them.

loans.use: to buy 40 bowls of maize, 3 kilos of fish and 1 litre of oil for her food business.

loans.name: Tunagurane Group

texts.fr:
Générose  fait partie du groupe  Tunagurane et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 59 ans et est mariée à Damas, un cuisinier. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 10 à 38 ans, dont  3 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge son père. 

Elle fait le commerce de tomates, aubergines, céleri  depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est  à son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup   de  tomates, des  aubergines et des céleris à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter un véhicule, et voir se enfants étudient.
texts.en:
Générose is a member of the Tunagurane Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 59 years old and married to Damas, a cook.  Together, they have seven children aged from ten to thirty-eight years old.  Three of their children are still in school.  Générose is also responsible for her father.  

She has been selling tomatoes, aubergines and celery for three years.  This will be her second loan with the field partner, Turame.  It will increase her working capital and enable her to buy many tomatoes, aubergines and celery for resale.

In the coming years, Générose would like to buy a vehicle and see her children study.

loans.use: to buy many tomatoes, aubergines and celery for resale.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is a fish vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. He is 38 years old, married and has three children ages 13, 10, 8. Randy has been in the fish-vending business for more than 13 years now. This business provides him the income that he needs to support his family, especially for the schooling of his children. 

Randy is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With a loan, Randy will be able to augment his stock, thus allowing him to sell more fish to the people in his town. In the future, Randy hopes to improve his fishing venture into a sustainable and profitable one. Moreover, he wants to save money to reinvest in his business and to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase stocks of rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, flours, sarong, cigarettes and soap (powdered and bar soap)

loans.name: Bajame

texts.en:
Bajame (or “Almond” in English) is a widowed mother of one and an Egyptian Albanian. She is 54 and lives in the city of Korce where most of her community has been living for many years. While the majority of them live in suburbia or basements of apartment buildings, some of them unfortunately, still live in shacks. A small number of them have made a better life these past 20-plus years since the collapse of the Communist regime. Among other talents, members of the Egyptian community have shown extreme talents at buying and selling new or used items and also crafts. 

Bajame is buying and selling bed linens and draperies. She sells in the streets as many vendors do. With the loan she is requesting from you, she will stock up on such items and also winter clothing. Due to the holiday season, she is certain that she can make some good money out of it.

loans.use: to buy inventory of new items (bed linens, drapes, winter clothes) to resell

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Sociology. Here is her story:

“Learning languages, studying different cultures, communicating with people, helping to solve social problems, and trying to make this world better have always been my passion. For this reason, I chose the Sociology Department because I know I will succeed in this field.

I live in a big family, which consists of six members: dad, mom, grandma and three children. My dad and grandma are pensioners; my mother is the only breadwinner in my family. My father is a veteran of the Batken events in 1999, where he had fought for the peace of the south part of our country against the terrorists. My elder sister is a student, who has a state scholarship and studies for free; she has a small stipend. My younger brother goes to kindergarten. I have realized that I cannot reach my goal alone. By applying for a Kiva loan, I have an opportunity to fulfill my furthest goal.

If I get the Kiva loan, I will study hard to be an educated person. The loan will allow me to maintain my 4.0 GPA, take up a full load of challenging classes, join different clubs, and be an active member of the AUCA community. I will represent AUCA well during my years in this university and beyond.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is 53 years old and lives in the frontier village of Getahovit in the Tavush region.  He is married and lives with his wife, daughter-in-law and grandchild. His son now is in the Russian Federation; he works there as a driver and transfers money once a month to cover some part of his family's needs. Yurik is a retired military serviceman who is engaged in farming now. He is skilled at swine breeding and has four pigs and five piglets on his farm. He sells a lot of meat from his farm, especially in the periods when the number of his piglets increases. Yurik wants his son to come back from Russia and  to be seriously engaged in farming.

Yurik wants to spend this loan on three cows in order to make his farm richer with cattle, and also to make a various assortment of farm products for more profitable sales.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Melva Roxana

texts.es:
Melva, es cosmetóloga, su núcleo familiar está formado por dos hijas, las cuales son económicamente independientes, todas viven juntas. El ofició lo ha aprendido mediante cursos y con el tiempo ha adquirido mucho más experiencia en el negocio, su sala de belleza funciona aproximadamente hace 5 años.
El capital lo utilizará para comprar diferentes tratamientos de belleza facial y para el cabello, el resto lo invertirá en la remodelación del  local; tendrá una mejor presentación de su negocio y ofrecerá mayor variedad de productos a un costo menor, espera aumentar su clientela, dar un mejor servicio y administrar muy bien el capital prestado y las ganancias.
Sus proyectos son terminar de cancelar la deuda por la compra de su vivienda, remodelar mucho mejor el negocio y su casa.
texts.en:
Melva is a cosmetician. She has a close family made up of 2 daughters, who are economically independent. They all live together. Melva learned her trade by taking courses and time has given her much more experience in her business. Her beauty salon has been running for 5 years. 

She will use the loan to buy different beauty treatments for the face and hair, and she will also invest in the renovation of her business premises. The appearance of her salon will be improved and she will be able to offer a greater variety of products at a lower cost. She hopes to increase her clientele, provide a better service and manage the capital provided by the loan and the profits. 

Her plans are to finish paying off the mortgage on her home, and make improvements to her business and her house.

loans.use: to buy different beauty treatments for the face and hair, and renovate her premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three pigs and cement to construct a pigsty to start commercial pig production

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia, siente que al apoyo que se le brinda cuando ella lo solicita le es de mucha ayuda para seguir mejorando su estilo de vida y condición económica. EL préstamo anterior le ha permitido tener a la venta frutas y verduras frescas para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Requiere un financiamiento para para comprar frutas, verduras, harina, levadura, manteca, etc., abastecerá el negocio con mercadería fresca y continuara elaborando la venta de pan, espera aprovechar esta temporada de buenas ventas para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
When Emilia has asked for support, she has received it. She sees this as something of great help in her pursuit of better living conditions and a better financial situation. Thanks to the previous loan, she could offer fresh fruits and vegetables and satisfy all her customers’ needs.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruits, vegetables, flour, yeast, butter, etc. This will help her to increase her stock levels with fresh supplies. She will continue to make and sell bread and hopes to take advantage of the upcoming season to sell more and make better profits.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, flour, yeast and butter.

loans.name: Gloria Edith

texts.es: Gloria es una mujer trabajadora que cuenta con 60 años de vida y habita en vivienda propia al lado de su hermana y sus 2 sobrinas. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecha. Gloria como se observa en la fotografía solo cuenta con un techo de teja que ha tratado de proteger con plásticos, pero al no ser el mejor material de protección siempre se presentan filtraciones, por lo que Gloria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, canales de lámina y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, esperando contar con este apoyo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking woman. She is 60 years old and lives with her sister and two nieces in a house of their own. She is a persistent woman who works as a housekeeper, an activity she enjoys.

As it can be seen in the picture, Gloria has tried to cover her roof with plastics. However, this is not the best material and the water leaks into the house. This is why Gloria is requesting a loan at FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, metal rain gutters and nails to repair her roof. She hopes to receive this help as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, rain gutters and nails to repair her roof.

loans.name: Namalgbzanga De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur INOUSSA est le  représentant  du groupe NAMALGZANGA DE ROLLO. Marié, il n’a pas d’enfant. Il  a 02 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait du maraichage depuis 02 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Il  veut  s’acheter  07 sacs d’engrais ; 02 bidons d’essence.
Monsieur désire épargner ces bénéfices. Il  ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Inoussa is the representative of the 'Namalgzanga de Rollo' Group.  He is married but doesn't have any children, although he is financially responsible for two people.

Inoussa has been working in agriculture for two years.  He buys his supplies from the local market.  He plans to use his loan to buy seven sacks of fertilizer and two drums of fuel.

His profits will be put to one side and saved.  In the future, Inoussa would like to expand his business and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy 7 sacks of fertilizer and 2 drums of fuel for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Relwende De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur YAMBASSIAN est le  représentant  du groupe REL-WENDE DE ROLLO. Marié, il est père de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé à 37 ans et le moins âgé a 17 ans. 01 vont à l’école. Il  a 06 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait du maraîchage depuis 03 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Il  veut  s’acheter  03 sacs d’engrais.
Monsieur désire épargner ces bénéfices. Il  ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yambassian is the representative of the 'Rel-Wende de Rollo' Group.  He is married and has eight children.  The eldest is thirty-seven years old, and the youngest is seventeen years old.  One of his children currently attends school, and he is financially responsible for a total of six people.

Yambassian has been working in agriculture for three years.  He buys his supplies at the local market, and will use his loan to buy three sacks of fertilizer.

His profits will be put to one side and saved.  In the future, Yambassian would like to expand his business and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of fertilizer for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Wendpanga De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur HAMIDOU est l  représentant  du groupe WEND PANGA DE ROLLO. Marié, il est père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 16 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Il  a 06 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait du maraîchage depuis 05 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Il  veut  s’acheter  18 sacs d’engrais ; 12 bidons d’essence.
Monsieur désire épargner ces bénéfices. Il  ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Hamidou is the representative of the 'Wend Panga de Rollo' Group.  He is married and has four children.  The eldest is sixteen years old, and the youngest is two years old.  Three of his children currently attend school, and he is financially responsible for a total of six people.

Hamidou has been working in agriculture for five years.  He buys his supplies at the local market, and will use his loan to buy eighteen sacks of fertilizer and twelve drums of fuel.

His profits will be put to one side and saved.  In the future, Hamidou would like to expand his business and provide more for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy 18 sacks of fertilizer and 12 drums of fuel for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Santos Vidal

texts.es:
Santos de 36 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio hasta quinto grado, dejo sus estudios porque su padre enfermo, entonces tuvo que trabajar para sacar adelante a la familia.- Junto con su esposa tuvieron 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 2 años de edad, los cuales se encuentran estudiando, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuido de sus hijos, mientras que Santos se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 22 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre quien siempre se dedicó a este negocio, para llegar a su trabajo Santos viaja en bicicleta 3 kilómetros, trabajando en el horario de 5:00 am a 11:00 am todos los días, en algunas ocasiones su esposa le ayuda en la agricultura.


El crédito que está solicitando Santos en la institución, es para comprar dos bueyes, para trabajar la tierra, dentro de un perìodo espera tener ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.- El sueño de Santos es darle a sus hijos todo lo necesario, para que puedan estudiar y para que sean personas de bien.- Ademàs, desea tener 10 vacas lecheras para poder producir queso y así poder venderlos para tener un poco más de ingresos y tener un terreno agrícola, aparte del que ya tiene.
texts.en: Santos is a 36 year old farmer who left school after the fifth grade when his father became too ill to work; consequently, Santos assumed responsibility for providing for his family. His wife is a housewife who cares for their 3 children, aged 12, 10 and 2 years, who all attend school. Santos has worked as a farmer for 22 years and he was trained in farming by his father, who had also been a farmer all his working life. Santos cycles 3 kilometres every day to get to work, working from 5am-11am every day, and sometimes his wife also helps him to farm. Santos intends to use the loan he is applying for to buy 2 oxen to plough his field as he hopes that this will soon enable him to increase his earnings and provide his family with a better standard of living. In the future, he hopes to provide his children with everything they need to study and grow up to be free from money worries. Furthermore, he would like to have 10 dairy cows so that he can produce cheese to sell and further increase his income. He would also like to have another field to farm along with the one that he already works.

loans.use: to buy two oxen so that he can work the land and increase his income, allowing him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es una mujer tenaz que cuenta con 67 años de vida y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 27 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con la compañía y el apoyo de su hija. Ella siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer valiente y trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace mucho tiempo. Elisa desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI que le permita invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, el cual se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que Elisa espera contar con este apoyo lo antes posible.
texts.en: Elisa is a tenacious woman who is 67 years old and lives in her own home with her 27 year old daughter. She is happy to have the company and the support of her daughter. She has always stood out as a brave and hardworking woman who has earned her living by providing domestic services for a long time. Elisa wants to get a loan from FUSAI that will allow her to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to change the roof on her house. It is in poor condition and Elisa hopes to have this help as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Emilia De La Asuncion

texts.es: Emilia de 73 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 38 años de edad y su nieto de 17 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con su compañía y su apoyo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos, además sus hijos ya mayores de edad que no viven con ella le apoyan económicamente, por lo que se siente feliz con el apoyo que le brindan. Emilia desea cambiar el techo de la galera, ya que como se observa en la fotografía el techo de esta se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, por lo que ella teme que pueda ocurrir un accidente si este se desploma, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de la galera y así evitar cualquier accidente y que el agua siga filtrándose.
texts.en: Emilia is 73 years old. She lives in her own home with her 38 year old son and her 17 year old grandson. She is happy to have the company and the support. She is a hardworking woman who provides domestic services. Her grown children that don't live with her support her financially, and she is happy with the help they provide. Emilia wants to change the roof on her shed. As can be observed in the photograph, it is in very poor condition and she is afraid an accident could occur if it collapses. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to change the roof on the shed and thus avoid an accident and keep water from leaking in.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof on her shed.

loans.name: Abelino

texts.es: Abelino de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos 2 varones de 7 y 10 años de edad y una niña de 10 meses de edad. ÉL es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como jornalero en una finca cercana, además presta sus servicios de seguridad a una vivienda cercana obteniendo ingresos extra, con lo que logra darle una estabilidad económica a su familia. Abelino desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el corredor y el interior de su vivienda, por lo que espera contar con el apoyo de este crédito para lograrlo.
texts.en: Abelino is 45 years old. He lives in his own house with his life's companion and their 3 children, 2 boys aged 7 and 10 and a 10 month old girl. He is a hardworking man who earns a living as a laborer in a nearby farm. He also provides security services at a nearby house for extra income, with which he is able to give his family financial stability. Abelino wants to acquire a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand and gravel to put in a cement floor in the corridor and in the interior of his home. He hopes to have the support of this loan to do it.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to put in a cement floor in the corridor and the interior of his house.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo de 63 años de vida habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 10 años de edad a la que está apoyando para que estudie. Él es un hombre trabajador que siempre pone todo su esfuerzo para salir adelante con su familia, además su compañera de vida apoya a los gastos del hogar con su negocio de venta de tortillas. Pablo desea construir una galera en el área de la pila, además desea terminar de instalar las mechas de agua potable, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, tubos y clavos para colocar techo al área de la pila e instalar mechas de agua potable, esperando contar con este apoyo lo antes posible.
texts.en: Pablo is 63 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their 10 year old daughter, who he finances while she attends school. He is a hardworking man who always exerts as much effort as necessary to provide for his family. His wife also brings an income home from her business selling tortillas. Pablo wants to build a galley area around his outdoor sink; furthermore, he would also like to install pipes to draw up drinking water from the ground. To this end, he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying: galvanised sheeting, wood, cement, pipes and nails for building the roof over the sink and to install drinking water pipes. He is hopeful that he will receive this support as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheeting, wood, cement, pipes and nails to erect a roof over the sink and to install pipes for extracting drinking water from the ground.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, iron bars, cement and roof tiles to repair the roof and the kitchen.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yaneth, de 37 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el cuarto grado, dejo sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos que tenían sus padres, junto con su compañero de vida procrearon 3 hijos de 22, 19 y 15 años de edad, de los cuales solo una se encuentra estudiando, los otros dos ya trabajan.- Yaneth vive con su hija menor y su nieta, su compañero de vida es jornalero y realiza trabajos agrìcolas, mientras que Yaneth se dedica a la venta de camarones en su casa, desde hace 18 años; trabajo que lo aprendió de su compañero de vida, y decidió dedicarse a este negocio para ayudarle en los gastos de la casa y para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El préstamo que está solicitando en la institución, es para comprar abono, semilla, veneno, foliares, gasolina para el equipo y para pago de mano de obra, para realizar sus cultivos. Con esto ella logrará tener mejores cosechas y podrá tener un poco más de ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor alimentación.

El sueño de Yaneth es ayudarle a su hija económicamente para que pueda estudiar mucho y llegue a ser una profesional, para que en un futuro tenga posibilidades de un trabajo mejor, ampliar su vivienda ya que en la que residen está muy pequeña y adquirir un carrito para salir a vender por las colonias el camarón.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 37 years old. She is a housewife and has a fourth grade education. She left school due to her parents' lack of resources. Together with her life's companion she has 22, 19 and 15 years old. Only one of them is in school and the others are working already. Yaneth lives with her youngest daughter and her granddaughter. Her life's companion is a laborer and does agricultural work, while Yaneth has sold shrimp from her house for 18 years. She learned the work from her life's companion and she decided to help in the business to contribute to the household expenses and be able to have a better quality of life. 

The loan she is asking the institution for is to buy fertilizer, seeds, foliar sprays, and gasoline for equipment and to pay for labor for the crops. With this, she will be able to have better harvests and feed her family better. 

Yaneth's dream is to help her daughter financially so she can study a lot and be able to graduate from college, so that in the future she will be able to have a better job. She also wants to add on to her house because the one they live in is very small, as well as to acquire a small cart to go out to sell the shrimp in neighborhoods.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, poison, foliar sprays, and gasoline for the equipment, as well as to pay for labor.

loans.name: Brayan Gabriel

texts.es: Brayan es un joven muy luchador y responsable, tiene 20 años de edad y asiste al colegio, el vive con sus padres y sus 3 hermanos, comenta que sus padres tiene bajos recursos económicos y no les alcanza para darles la educación a sus hijos, Brayan se dedica a trabajar al jornal desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde, luego a las 2 de la tarde ingresa al colegio a recibir clases y esto lo hace todos los días, y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores para obtener algo mas de ingresos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para tener buenas ganancias y seguir pagando sus estudios.
texts.en: Brayan is a young man who is a fighter and responsible. He is 20 years old and goes to high school. He lives with his parents and 3 siblings. He says that his parents have low income and don't have enough to give their children an education. Brayan works from 6 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. Later, at 2, he goes to high school. He does this every day. He also raises small animals to make more income. He is going to invest the loan in buying pigs to make good income and to keep paying for his education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jessica Silvana

texts.es: Silvana es madre soltera, tiene 21 años de edad, y 2 hijos de 1 año y 4 años, el mayor esta estudiando, ella vive con sus padres en una casa por la que pagan arriendo, Silvana se dedica a trabajar al jornal y también se dedica a criar animales menores, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos para  tenerlos en chancheras que de igual manera paga arriendo, la aspiración de Silvana es mejorar sus negocio para que las ganancias que le queden le alcance para cubrir todos los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en: Silvana is a single mother. She is 21 and has 2 children, aged 1 and 4. The oldest is in school. She lives with her parents in a house they rent. Silvana works as a laborer and she also raises small animals. With the money from the loan she is going to buy pigs to keep in sties that she also rents. Silvana's goal is to improve her business so that the profits she makes will be enough to cover her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
En la localidad donde se encuentra el grupo de préstamo Flor de Campo las personas se dedican a sembrar caña de azúcar, café y naranja principalmente. Es gracias al cultivo alternativo que los habitantes suelen tener empleo todo el año ya que la economía depende en mayor parte de la caña.

Los integrantes decidieron nombrar a su grupo haciendo referencia a la libertad y el lugar donde viven, todos ellos son:

María –Panadería  y Venta De Antojitos
Alejandro -Venta De Sandalias
Juana -Venta De Pan
Tomasa -Venta De Abarrotes
Aurora -Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo
Grisel- Venta De Ropa
Paula -Servicio De Jardinería
Tirso -Venta De Reloj
Raúl – Venta De Naranjas Por Mayoreo

Doña María es una mujer de iniciativa, al integrarse al grupo, comenzó a vender ropa pero cambió la actividad al tener pérdidas por la falta de pago de algunos clientes. Finalmente decidió que la mejor opción sería vender comida, hoy en día, gracias a los préstamos otorgados por VisionFund y sus ganancias, tiene una panadería. Ella está asociada con su hija quien ya tenía un horno y simplemente invirtieron en harina, manteca, azúcar y charolas para la elaboración del pan. “Lo mejor de la panadería es trabajar con mi hija” comenta María, cuya jornada comienza a las 7 am y a la 1 pm ya está lista una gran variedad de pan: conchas, laureles, recortes, bolillos, donas, pastelitos, teleras y cuernitos. Por el momento, María cuenta con el apoyo de dos repartidores, pero incluso ella, después de hornear, toma su canasto para vender en las calles de la comunidad. Durante los fines de semana y para incrementar las ganancias, María coloca un pequeño puesto fuera de la iglesia para vender comida típica mexicana. 

María necesita un préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar y manteca pues el frío en la comunidad comienza a sentirse y las ventas de pan se incrementan; los habitantes buscan una pieza para acompañar el café orgánico que también se produce en la comunidad. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de la señora Juana hija de doña María quien viste un suéter color ladrillo.
texts.en:
In the place where the Flor de Campo borrower's group is found, the people work growing sugar cane, coffee, and oranges primarily. It is thanks to the alternative crops that the inhabitants tend to have employment the whole year since the economy depends mostly on sugar cane. 

The members decided to name their group making reference to freedom and the place where they live. They are:

María – bakery and snack sales
Alejandro - sandal sales
Juana - bread sales
Tomasa - grocery sales
Aurora - shoe sales from a catalog
Grisel- clothing sales
Paula - gardening service
Tirso - watch/clock sales
Raúl – bulk orange sales

María is a woman with iniciative. Upon joining the group, she began to sell clothing, but changed her work after having losses due to some of her customers not paying. Finally, she decided that the best option would be to sell food. These days, thanks to the loans granted by VisionFund, and her earnings, she has a bakery. She works with her daughter who had an oven and they simply invested in flour, butter, sugar and trays for making bread. "The best thing about the bakery is working with my daughter," says María, whose day begins at 7 am and at 1 pm, a wide variety of breads are ready: conchas [shells], laureles [wreaths], sliced bread, rolls, donuts, small pasteries, teleras [sandwich rolls], and cuernitos [crescent shaped bread]. At the moment, María has the help of two delivery people, but she also is included. After baking, she takes a basket to sell in the streets of the community. On the weekends, and to increase the earnings, María sets up a small stand outside the church to sell traditional Mexican food.  

María needs a loan to purchase flour, sugar, and butter since the the cold in the community is beginning to be felt, and the bread sales increase; the inhabitants look for a piece to go with the organic coffee that they also produce in their community. 

*The photo was taking at the house of Juana, the daughter of María, who wears a brick colored sweater.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and butter.

loans.name: Brayan David

texts.es: Brayan es un joven de 24 años de edad, se encuentra dedicado a la elaboración de barandas en acero inoxidable. Cuando terminó su carrera técnica, trabajo en una empresa de químicos, después de esa experiencia ingresó a una empresa de soldadura en la que aprendió este arte, en la que un ingeniero al ver su desempeño le recomendó que iniciara su negocio como  independiente, el cual comenzó a funcionar en el año 2012 y a la fecha ha demostrado un crecimiento, tanto que ha generado cuatro empleos.  Este emprendedor joven ha conseguido sus clientes por recomendaciones que hacen sus propios clientes, efecto “voz a voz” de los productos de excelente calidad y lindos acabados.  Sus ventas se generan de contado por los servicios prestados, así mismo sus compras son de contado a proveedores de Barranquilla y Cali, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en una maquina para soldadura y en materia prima como acero, tornillos, remaches entre otros. Su horario laboral depende de la producción que tenga pero habitualmente es cada dos días en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m.   Brayan tiene metas establecidas a largo plazo; con su familia desea ayudarles para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y con el negocio continuar trabajando con compromiso y dedicación, para que su empresa sea reconocida a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Brayan is a 24-year-old young man, who works making stainless steel railings. When he finished his technical degree, he worked in a chemical business, after this experience, he entered a welding business, where he learned this art. There, an engineer, upon seeing his work, recommended that he start his own independent business. This began to operate in 2012 and to date he has shown growth, enough that he has created four jobs. This enterprising young man has gotten his customers through the recommendations of his own customers, in effect "word of mouth" that his products are of excellend quality and beautifuly done. His sales are done in cash for services rendered, and his purchases are also done in cash from providers in Barranquilla and Cali. 

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, financing, which is done through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in a welding machine and in raw material such as steel, screws, and rivets among others. His work schedule depends on the production he has, but generally is every two days from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Brayan has established long-term goals, with his family he wants to help them improve their living conditions and with the business he wants to continue working with commitment and dedication, so that his business is known on a national level.

loans.use: to invest in a welding machine and in raw material such as steel, screws, and rivets.

loans.name: Lunag Dev Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
34-year-old Mayaben (at center in the picture) hails from the Kutch district of Gujarat, in western India. She works as a tailor, contributing Rs. 5000 a month to her family’s income of Rs. 9000. Due to poverty, she was unable to attend school, but she wants to educate her young child. She diligently saves Rs. 3000 a month towards this goal, but needs to save more, given the increasing costs of living and education. She can increase her profits if she takes on more orders of sari falls, blouses, petticoats, and dresses – garments favored by the local women who are her customers. To achieve this, she needs a better sewing machine and more materials. It will take her a long time to gather the capital needed to invest in these purchases, and local banks do not cater to borrowers like Mayaben. 

To raise the microfinance she needs, under the guidance of the non-profit Prayas, Mayaben has formed a self-help group with Vanita, Laxmiben, Gitaben, and Valbai, also local women entrepreneurs with similar aspirations. Together, through Prayas’ partner Milaap, they hope to crowdfund Rs. 100,000 to fund their small scale businesses. Like Mayaben, Vanita will invest in scaling up her tailoring microenterprise. Laxmiben sells cloth and garments; she will use the loan to boost her inventory of high-demand items like dresses, dress materials, scarves, curtains, and t-shirts. Gitaben runs what is locally known as a “cutlery” business, selling accessories like bangles, hair pins, rubber bands, etc. The loan will help her stock up on more such items and sell greater quantities. Valbai, who sells vegetables, will purchase eggplants, potatoes, tomatoes, and okra in bulk at better rates; these vegetables are in high demand locally and fetch better prices. 

The investments these five women make using this loan will increase their incomes by over 50%. They will be able to re-invest in growing their businesses further, and will also increase their savings. Your timely loan will help put them in a position to guarantee that their children receive an education. They will repay your loan within 12 monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and grow her tailoring microenterprise

loans.name: Gaurav Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
53-year-old Narmadaben (at center, in the photograph) leads a group of 5 women micro-entrepreneurs from rural Dahod, a district in the western Indian state of Gujarat. Narmadaben runs her own ‘paan’ store, selling the popular local digestive made of stuffed betel leaves. She works hard to supplement her husband’s income, and diligently saves, so they can be financially stable and have a guaranteed income source as they age. 

However, their savings of four thousand rupees a month (~$68) will not be sufficient to meet their needs in their old age, given the rising cost of living and healthcare. So Narmadaben seeks to grow her microenterprise and increase her income. She plans to buy greater quantities of betel leaves and seasonings at better rates; this will improve her profit margins and also help her cater to more customers, increasing her income. 

She does not, however, possess the finances necessary to invest in this growth. Local banks do not provide microfinance to small rural entrepreneurs like Narmadaben, as she comes from a socio-economically backward family, and lacks the collateral for a loan. So Narmadaben formed a group with four other local women entrepreneurs in a similar situation. Deviben sells toys, and Kamlaben and Badliben sell vegetables – all three middle-aged women share the same goals as Narmadaben. The fourth member Hiraben runs a petty shop, and her goal is to save and send her two teen-aged children to college. Together, these women seek to crowdfund the Rs. 75,000 necessary to grow their businesses. 

With the loan, Deviben will be able to add new toys to her stock. Kamlaben and Badliben will buy vegetables that bring a higher profit, like tomatoes, okra, potatoes, bananas, and chilies.
