Hiraben will add utensils to the items she sells out of her small petty shop. These investments made using your loan will help increase their profits by an average of 50%. They will repay you in 12 monthly installments. The increase in their incomes will help them save better, reinvest in their businesses, and eventually realize their goals of financial stability and education for Hiraben’s children.

loans.use: To buy betel leaves and seasonings in bulk, at better rates, for her ‘paan’ shop microenterprise

loans.name: Shree Ganesh Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Maneeben, the group leader (center in the photograph) sells accessories like bangles, nose rings, chains, anklets, and necklaces, all of which are locally known as “cutlery”. Through her small business, she earns Rs. 3000 a month, supplementing her husband’s income, providing for her family of six, including two children. The money keeps her family financially afloat, and they save towards their children’s education. 

Having had no education herself, she wants things to be different for the children, so they can have better opportunities to uplift themselves from socio-economic backwardness. However, her family’s current monthly savings of Rs. 2000 are inadequate to meet these goals. So she seeks to grow her microenterprise. She plans to purchase her “cutlery” in bulk so she can cater to more customers and get her inventory at better discounted rates. 

Local banks, however, will not provide the microfinance Maneeben needs to invest in this growth. So she formed a group with four other local women, who like her, run small businesses and hope to scale up their enterprises. Three of the women from this group, Sushilaben, Chuniben, and Badliben, run their own provisional stores. Deetuben sells vegetables as a business. 

Maneeben and her group seek to crowdfund the Rs. 58,000 they need to grow their small businesses. They seek this amount as a loan, and will repay it over 12 monthly installments. Your loan will help Sushilaben, Chuniben, and Badliben to add more products like Vaseline, incense, sugar, oil, and ghee (clarified butter), which are items in demand and sell for higher prices, increasing profits. Deetuben will be able to sell more vegetables like tomatoes, okra, potatoes, bananas, and chilies. 

With these investments, their businesses will see an increase of up to 50% in profits. With the increased incomes, these five hardworking mothers will be able to reinvest in scaling up their businesses further. They will also get closer to their goals of ensuring financial stability and guaranteeing access to education for their children.

loans.use: To boost the inventory of bangles, nose-rings, anklets, and other accessories

loans.name: Jay Dshama Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Bimlaben is the featured borrower of this group. She started her own tailoring microenterprise so she could provide her children a better education than the primary schooling she has had. She has two teenaged children, and supports her family of five with the income she earns by sewing clothes like dresses, shirts, and putting together falls and interlocks on saris. Her small business brings in Rs. 5700 a month (~$95), and she diligently saves most of this, running her home supported by the income her husband brings in. 

Aware that these savings will be insufficient, she is working to increase her tailoring business’s earning potential. To improve her productivity and take on more customers, she wants to buy a new and better sewing machine. She expects this will bring in extra business worth Rs. 8000 a month (~$130). 

To put this plan into action, Bimlaben needs access to funds. Banks do not cater to rural small business owners like her. So, under the guidance of the non-profit Prayas and Milaap, she has formed a group with Shilpaben, Kakuben, Linaben, and Kaliben, who run petty shops and a provisional store respectively. With this loan, Shilpaben and Kakuben will add products like garlic, chips, and snacks to their inventory. Kaliben will start selling in her provisional store products like Vaseline, sugar, oil, ghee (clarified butter), and incense. These items have a higher unit cost and have a high consumption rate, which will boost their profits.

Together with her group, Bimlaben hopes to crowdfund the microfinance they need to develop their respective businesses. They seek a loan amounting to Rs. 35,000. Your loan will empower Bimlaben and her group to increase their incomes by up to 50%. 

Bimlaben, like her group members, will use this significant boost in her savings to educate her children, invest in the further growth of her microenterprise, and repay your loan in 12 monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring microenterprise

loans.name: Bukhari Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Jituben (the group leader) has formed a group with four other women from rural Surendranagar in Gujarat, India. Together with Sooltanben, Faridaben, Sushilaben, and Hasinaben, she seeks to crowdfund an enterprise loan of Rs. 100,000, which they plan to repay in 12 monthly installments. They need this microfinance to fund the small scale businesses that they run, so they can invest in serving more customers and increasing profits. 

Jituben buys clothes in bulk and resells them at retail prices to local customers. The income and savings she currently makes are insufficient to fulfill her goals of achieving financial stability and improving the living standard for her family. So she will use her share of the enterprise loan to stock up on more popular items like dresses, jeans, stoles, saris, and leggings. Buying in bulk gets her better rates and also reduces the trips she has to make for sourcing her inventory. Saving on these business costs will improve her profit margins. With a larger inventory, she will cater to more customers and increase her revenue. 

Among the other group members, Sooltanben and Faridaben also buy and resell clothes. They too will use the loan to stock up on the popular dresses, jeans, stoles, saris, and leggings. Sushilaben polishes diamonds, playing a role in the flourishing local diamond trade. She will use the loan to buy a special cutting machine, which will improve her productivity and income. Hasinaben is engaged in the local cottage industry of tie-dying, locally known as “bandhani”. She will use the loan to buy more cloth, so she can make and sell these fashionable, in-demand bandhani saris and dresses to more customers. 

These investments will lead to a growth of around 50% in their incomes. Your loan will help empower this group of 5 women to grow their businesses and achieve their goals of securing financial stability and uplifting their families. With their savings, Sooltanben, Sushilaben, and Faridaben will also be able to guarantee enough savings so their children can access a good education.

loans.use: To buy more dresses, jeans, stoles, saris, and leggings for her garment selling microenterprise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an 8-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household merchandise like  biscuits, powdered milk, cooking oil, pouch vinegar, spices, and canned goods. She is a 65-year-old married woman with four children. Her youngest is 17. She has been operating a store for 10 years now.

Clarita is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise like coffee, sugar, soft drinks, and toiletries. This will help her to cater to the needs of her customers, and there will be a variety to choose from.

This will cause an improvement to her income, thus being able to continue sending her youngest child to college.

Clarita is trying her best to make it successful so that will also help improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like coffee, sugar, soft drinks, and toiletries

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Ann, 27 years old and a single mother of one kid. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She operates a kiosk selling sugar, salt, cooking fat, flour and washing detergents to earn a living. She is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her manage the business more effectively. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more stock so that she can increase her income from improved sales. This will enable her cater for family needs such as food and paying school fees for her child.

Ann is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, salt, cooking fat, flour and washing detergents.

loans.name: Sreyhak

texts.en:
Sreyhak is an 18-year-old accounting freshman at university in a city. She is from Kandal province of Cambodia. 

Now Sreyak would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees for four years. This loan will help her graduate successfully. 

In the future, after graduation, she wants a proper job in a company to help her parents. When she has enough money, she also wants to own a house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Kuysin

texts.en:
Kuysin is widowed. She has experienced a lot of difficulties in life because after the death of her husband she has been only feed keeper of her family. Kuysin has a child, and she lives with her child in the North Tajikistan. 

She has been busy with buying and selling food items more than 14 years. She has a food shop where she sells a variety of food items. Kuysin at first sold her products in a local market where she had a little store. Little by little, with the passing of the time, she developed a business. 

Kuysin is going to increase working capital in the New Year season, and in this way to attract more customers. 

She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy bread, candies, cookies, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy bread, candies, cookies, etc. for increasing inventory

loans.name: Perus

texts.en:
Perus is married, with four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Perus has a retail shop and has been in this business for four years. She rents a shop and works there six days a week on a retail basis. She generates additional income by running a restaurant. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Perus aspires to become a wholesaler, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more products such as sugar, cartons of soap, bread, rice crates of soda, and cooking oil.

Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda, sugar, salt, loaves of bread, and cooking oil

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with two children and one goes to school. She also takes care of her mother. She has a business selling used shoes at the market and has been in doing this for nine years, selling to all categories of people on a retail basis only. 

Juliet has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She aspires to build her own house, and also educate her children. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha and her husband run a farming business. They both raise pineapple fruits on their farm. Editha and her husband work together and change ideas in order to grow their crops well and produce quality fruits. Their goals are to produce quality fruits, harvest more, and gain more profit to enable them to gradually improve their lifestyle. With this, Editha is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to pay the labor cost in growing pineapple fruits. She believes that their source of income has a big contribution in uplifting their standard of living. She hopes to manage well their farming business for a continued source of income.

loans.use: to pay the labor cost in growing pineapple fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and bags of cement to build a pigsty to venture into pig production.

loans.name: Badrikhon

texts.en:
Badrikhon was born in 1995. He comes from Tajikistan. Badrikhon is very hardworking man and he is not married. 

Badrikhon is a student of the first course at Tajikistan National University. Badrikhon studies well and he learns a lot. Badrikhon dreams of being a good specialist after graduating university. 

He is asking for a loan because he must to pay for tuition but his parents have no ability to help him. Badrikhon awaits your mercy and really needs your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Christien

texts.en:
Christien, 43, is a married woman with seven children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Christien has a photocopying business in the Philippines. Christien has been in this business for 15 years.

Christien requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

In the future, Christien would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her photocopying business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a very responsible father of two children. He has had to undergo many adversities in his life; nevertheless, he has always found the strength to get ahead and keep progressing with his family. 

Paul is 30 years old and a native of the village of Songhor in the Nandihills area of Kenya where he lives with his family and parents. His upbringing was challenging and he never went to college so that he could secure a formal job, but he did not surrender to that and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. 

Through farming, he has been able to take care of his family. His main source of income has been milk, eggs and crop farming, and through these ventures, he has supported his family because he is the only breadwinner. Paul passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of his animals “Brown,” which is an English word depicting the color of the cow. 

Paul stated that the most enjoyable bit about farming is “it gives me personal fulfillment and feeds my family." Although he has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious man. He has been facing challenges transporting his produce from the farm to the market. That is why he is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. 

The Nandihills area is a rural town and roads are very poor and transporting goods for Paul has always been a “nightmare.” He has been suffering losses because goods reach the market when they are not fresh, hence fetching a low price. Vegetables and milk are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and through the loan, he will be able to achieve his dream. 

He plans to employ someone who will be helping him in farm work and transporting the produce to the market, hence affecting the society positively through creation of employment. Increased profits from the loan will allow him to repay the loan fully and permanently change his living conditions and assure his aging parents of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport goods to market.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children from Ormoc, Leyte.  Her oldest child is 20 and the youngest is 2. Her husband earns a living by means of farming. He grows and sells rice. 

Corazon is in need of capital to pursue her hog-raising business. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy pigs, pig feed and vitamins. This will help Corazon raise and sell high-quality pigs in the months to come. She can now help her husband in paying the daily household expenses. With the profits, she can afford to buy healthful food and provide better living conditions.

In the future, Corazon would like to expand her hog-raising business to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy pigs, pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza was born in 1974. She is married and a mother of two children. She lives with her family in the capital of Tajikistan. 

Firuza is a very hardworking woman. She is a sewer. She makes a variety of women clothes. Firuza has been busy with this business more than 10 years. Firuza has regular customers, thanks to her good service. She always searches to find the way of improving her business. 

Now, she plans to buy a new sewing machine as she needs it, and fabrics. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Martina Angelica

texts.es: Martina de 52 años de edad es viuda vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martina is a 52-year-old widow who lives in her own home with her son.  

She has, for a few years now, devoted herself to the production and sale of tortillas.  Her business is located in her place of residence and has many customers.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn by the quintal [100lbs sac] and lime powder to continue making tortillas so she can have better profits and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the "quintal" [100lbs] and lime powder

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz de 41 años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa de un familiar, ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, Luz esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luz, 41, lives with her children in the home of a family member.  She works in agriculture and selling clothing as a street vender.  She manages to get ahead with what she earns from her work.

Luz is requesting another loan, but this time it's to buy more clothing wholesale so she can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es:
Medardo, ha obtenido muy buenos resultados con el uso de préstamos, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para comprar cerdos, pollos y bolis (es una golosina de forma alargada, vienen en distintos sabores y se venden congelada). Está ampliando la variedad de productos en su negocio para tener mejores ganancias.
Utilizo el financiamiento anterior para fortalecer la comercialización de animales de corral, teniendo así ventas mayores y un margen de ganancias mejor. Su familia se encuentra saludable. Hasta la fecha no manifiesta ningún problema en el negocio.
texts.en:
Medardo has obtained very good results with the use of loans, so he has decided to request a new loan to buy pigs, chickens and "bolis" (this is a treat in an elongated bag. It comes in different flavors and is sold frozen). 

He is expanding product variety in his business to have better profits.  He used his previous loan to strengthen the commercialization of farm animals, thus having higher sales and better profit margin. 

His family is healthy. To date there have been no problems with his business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, chickens and "bolis" (this is a treat in an elongated bag. It comes in different flavors and is sold frozen).

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es: Martha de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de granos básicos (azúcar, arroz, frijoles, etc.) desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de de mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Martha, 38, lives in her own house with her two children.  She has earned a living selling basic grains (sugar, rice, beans, etc.) for several years.  Her business is located near her home.

Martha's requesting a loan to buy more products wholesale to keep making sales.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vicuña wool wholesale to have material to work with all year.

loans.name: Jana 1 Group

texts.en:
Aziza is the featured borrower for Jana 1 Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and lives at the same time.

Aziza is a 46-year-old married mother of three children who started 16 years ago working in agriculture to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Aziza is a hard worker who is sacrificing to provide her family with better living conditions; thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house with a new living room to make it a healthier place for her family. 

Aziza is the first lady on the left of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Sara is the lady sitting in the middle, and Rana is the fist lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house with a new living room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and remodel a hot dog cart and to buy bread, sausages, and dressings, etc.

loans.name: Faraidah

texts.en:
Faraidah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of six children, and five attend school. She takes care of additional family members. She has sold used clothes at the market for six years and earns additional income from poultry farming. She works six days a week. 

She has requested 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenges include customers who do not pay their bills and the changing seasons. She would like to buy a plot of land to start farming. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Julia Gladis

texts.es:
Julia, cuenta hoy en día con un negocio mucho más popular, las nuevas demandas de sus clientes son mayores por lo que solicita más capital para comprar flores, papelería, listones, pegamento y otros accesorios para elaborar flores y decoraciones para ocasiones especiales, espera aprovechar la temporada navideña por las buenas ventas.
Su inventario esta mejor surtido con la inversión del préstamo anterior, ha podido cumplir con sus pedidos, ofrece nuevas creaciones, cancelo sus deudas con otras personas y eso la llena de satisfacción por que tiene más utilidades para seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Julia has a much more popular business these days.  The new orders from her customers are bigger, so she is asking for more capital to buy flowers, paper, ribbons, glue, and other accessories for making floral arrangements and decorations for special occasions.  She hopes to take advantage of good sales in the Christmas season.

Her inventory is better stocked thanks to the investment of her previous loan.  She has been able to finish up her orders, offer new creations, and pay off her debts to other people.  This fills her with satisfaction because she has more profits to keep prospering.

loans.use: to buy flowers, paper, ribbons, glue, and other accessories for making floral arrangements and decorations for special occasions.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children and all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses are school fees and food.

She is a tailor and she also sells African prints at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy materials for making African prints and other clothes. Her major challenges are the ever changing prices of clothes and defaulters.

She would like to buy an electric sewing machine to ease her work.

loans.use: To buy materials for making African prints.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a very determined, hardworking man devoted to his family, parents, wife and job. He is 40 years of age and very passionate and diligent about farming. 

He is considered to be a pacesetter when it comes to farming in his village of Koibarak in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Having done mixed farming for the past five years, he has gained a lot of experience, and he offers free extension services to young upcoming farmers. 

He is happily married and is blessed with four lovely school-going children. 

Philip enjoys generating income from selling milk, his harvest, and produce from his farm. He finds dairy farming very fulfilling, but the main challenge he faces is not being able to properly feed his dairy cows. He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. Through the loan, he will be able to cut hay into small pieces before mixing it with other forage to feed his cattle. The chaff cutter will aid his cattle in digestion and will prevent his dairy cattle from rejecting any part of their food. Proper feeding of your cattle is one of the most important factors in maintaining a high yield production of milk. Through proper feeding, his cow will produce more milk, and this will translate to more profits and improved living standards. 

When he was asked how this loan will benefit his family, Philip said, “more income.” Profits from the loan will be used in fully repaying the loan and improving the standard of living for his parents, family, and his school-going children.

Philip patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter to cut hay into small pieces to aid digestion for his dairy cows

loans.name: Maria Agripina

texts.es:
María, mejorara el inventario de su negocio y necesita ayuda con más capital para poder hacerlo, comprara arreglos florales para decorar, ropa usada, artículos plásticos, etc., su objetivo es cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes y mantener el negocio en el mercado.
Con ayuda de préstamos mantiene en su negocio la mercadería que es del gusto de sus clientes, tiene estabilidad económica y un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
María will improve the inventory in her business, but she needs help with more capital in order to be able to do so.  She will buy floral arrangements to decorate, used clothes, and plastic items, etc.  Her objective is to meet her customer demand and to maintain the business in the market.  

With the help of the loans she maintains the business, the merchandise is to her customers’ liking, she has financial stability, and she has a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy floral arrangements to decorate, used clothes, and plastic items, etc.

loans.name: Herminia Jazmin

texts.es: Herminia, tiene 31 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Trujillo, Colon.  Herminia logró establecer su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser azúcar, arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, verduras, refrescos, churros, productos de aseo, condimentos, etc.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es el segundo ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más productos como carnes, embutidos, granos básicos, productos de aseo, cereales, café, pan, huevos, verduras etc. para incrementar el inventario y las ventas. Su idea es tener una  fuente de ingresos para su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Herminia is 31 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She lives in the town of Trujillo, Colon.  Herminia managed to set up her own grocery store business where she sells basic household staples such as sugar, rice, beans, lard, eggs, vegetables, drinks, churros, cleaning products, seasonings, etc.  

The loan that she has requested is her second and is for 10,000 Lempiras.  With it she is going to buy more products such as meats, cold cuts, basic grains, cleaning products, cereals, coffee, bread, eggs, vegetables, etc., in order to increase her inventory and sales.  Her idea is to have a source of income for her family and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products such as meat, vegetables, cold cuts, basic grains, cleaning products, cereals, coffee, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Antonia Cecilia

texts.es:
Antonia, es una joven de 28 años de edad, es comerciante, estudió hasta bachillerato y no continuo sus estudios debido a que decidió acompañarse, y ahora es madre de 2 hijos uno de 6 años y el otro de 2 meses, el mayorcito se encuentra estudiando, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura, mientras que Antonia se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su madre quien siempre se dedicó a este negocio, para vender las frutas y verdura Antonia lo hace en los alrededores de la comunidad en el horario de 4:00 am a 12:00 del mediodía todos los días.


El crédito que está solicitando en la institución es para la compra de semilla de marañón y para surtir más su venta de frutas y verduras ella espera que con la variedad en sus productos, tendrá más clientela y siendo así lograra tener un poco más de ingresos para el sustento de su familia, el sueño de  Antonia es tener un negocio estable de venta de frutas y verduras, además, tener un terreno y una vivienda.
texts.en:
Antonia is 28 years old.  She is a merchant, who finished high school and did not continue her studies because she decided to move in with her common law partner.  She is now the mother of two children, one aged 6 and the other two months.  The older child is now in school.  

Her life partner works in agriculture, while Antonia sells fruit and vegetables for 8 years now.  She learned this type of work from her mother who always dedicated herself to this business.  To sell fruit and vegetables Antonia goes around the community from 4:00 am to 12:00 pm daily.

The loan she is requesting to the institution is to purchase cashews and to increase supply of fruit and vegetables.  She hopes that with the variety of products she will have more customers and be able to have a little more income to support her family. 

Antonia's dream is to have a stable business selling fruits and vegetables, in addition to owning some land and a house.

loans.use: to purchase cashews and to increase supply of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom (pictured here) is 46 years old and lives in the Chba Ampov district of Kandal province, Cambodia. Mom has been married since 1987 and has five sons. Two are married, one is a monk, one works as an electrician and another one is still young.

Mom has been a farmer for 10 years, while her husband has been a motorbike taxi driver for six years and is experienced. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase a new motorbike because she wants to change his old one. She hopes that she will change it because the motorbike is so old, it’s easily broken. Moreover, she will get a new one.

loans.use: to change the old motorbike for a new motorbike.

loans.name: Chansamret

texts.en:
Chansamret is an 18-year-old freshman taking a building-decoration architecture major at a university in a city. He is from Tbong Khmum province of Cambodia. 

Because he is short of finances to pay his tuition fees, he would like to request a loan. With the loan, Chansamret will be able to graduate successfully and find a job to build his future. After graduation, he wants to work in a company with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Tobias Rafael

texts.es: Tobias de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un taller de mecánica automotriz ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Tobias está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una caja de herramientas, micas y sostenes o burros de motores ya que los que actualmente posee están muy deteriorados, ya si poder para seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Tobías, 48, lives in his own home with his family.  He has had an auto repair shop at his house for several years.  He has a lot of customers because of his good work.  He's able to pay some of his household expenses with what he earns from his job.

Tobías is requesting a loan to buy a box of tools, auto lights, and motor supports or lifts because the ones he has at the moment are wearing out.  That way he'll be able to keep working and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy a box of tools, auto lights, and motor supports or lifts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her pineapple crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fryer to fry Tucuman empanadas in quantity.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en:
Sayohat was born in 1952. She is a careful mother of five children. Sayohat’s husband is a pensioner. He is a very kind man. 

Sayohat has been busy more than 15 years with buying and selling shoes. Her son and daughter-in-law help her with managing the business. Sayohat has a great experience in selling and thanks to her experience, she has developed the business little by little. She has a selling place in a local market and she dreams to open her own shop. 

Sayohat is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy coal to keep her house warm in the winter season. In winter the weather is cold and she must offer a good living condition for her children and grandchildren. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks Kiva and all lenders for help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal for the winter season.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has been helping her husband in working their own farm to make a living. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for the organic fertilization of her farm. Her budget with her previous loan was not enough to cover the entire farm, so she took a new loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer for a more productive farm. 

She is hopeful of gaining more income from her farm, for she has invested more capital in order to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer for a more productive farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for the store as well as pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan, sigue trabajando como payaso y ofreciendo el servicio de perifoneo, con el capital que tan amablemente los inversionistas Kiva le prestaron pudo reparar las bocinas de su equipo para seguir generando ingresos, con los que cancelo su deuda y da a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
Comenta que parte del equipo se dañó definitivamente sin posibilidad de arreglo y eso lo hace decidirse por un nuevo préstamo para comprar una consola nueva, de esta forma cumplirá con los contratos ya tomados de sus clientes y seguirá dando un buen servicio.
texts.en: Juan is still working as a clown and offering a loudspeaker service. With the capital that he kindly received from Kiva loan investors, he was able to repair his speakers and carry on generating income and therefore pay off his debts and give his family a better quality of life. However, he says that part of his equipment is damaged beyond repair and that he is asking for another loan to purchase a new console and therefore fulfil his existing contracts with his clients and carry on offering a good service.

loans.use: to purchase a new console and therefore fulfil his existing contracts with his clients and carry on offering a good service.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Khorn, 50, is a mother of six children living in Battambang province. To struggle for her family, she grows rice and raises cows to earn extra income. For Khorn, this is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. 

In a group of three members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
Desde muy joven sus padres le enseñaron el cuido de plantas  y ahora a sus 39 años de edad es un experto y muy prospero agricultor. José Raúl es un cultivador que disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Todas las mañanas  junto a su hermano, sale a regar y aplicar los tratamientos necesarios a su siembra de chiltomas para que tengan un buen desarrollo y  una buena producción.  Tras los altos precios de estos tratamientos, solicita préstamo para la compra de insumos y  fertilizantes que son necesarios en el oficio y que con sus ingresos le es difícil adquirir.
Con el apoyo de su esposa quien ejerce una carrera de maestra y  con otros bajos ingresos por la venta de frijol, Raúl ha logrado trasladar su producto  y venderlo en el mercado local de su ciudad. Su objetivo se encuentra ahora en diversificar sus producciones. Considera que con la siembra de maracuyá y otros granos podrá ampliar su engendro y obtener mayor ingreso para  el avance   de su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
From a very young age, his parents taught him to how to care for plants, and now at age 39 he is an expert and a thriving farmer.  José Raúl is a farmer who really enjoys his work.  Every morning, together with his brother, he heads out to water and apply the necessary treatments to his sweet pepper crops so that they develop and produce well.  Due to the high cost of these treatments, he is asking for a loan to buy the supplies and fertilizers that are needed for his job, and that are hard to get with his income.

With the support of his wife who is a teacher and with other small earnings from selling beans, Raúl has managed to ship his crop and sell it in the local city market.  His goal now is to diversify his production.  He thinks that by planting passion fruit and grains he will expand his production and get a better income in order to advance his family and his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay laborers' fee to support her farmland.

loans.name: Nevion

texts.en:
Nevion is a 30-year-old man who lives in a village in the district of Korca. 

He has been doing agriculture to earn a living for long time now, mostly by planting medicinal plants such as hollyhock flowers and selling them to buyers. While others in the village also have livestock (cows and sheep) and plant seasonal vegetables like beans, onions and potatoes as well as some grains, his focus has been on this type of medicinal flower since the land in his village and the climate in his region are very suitable and supportive of it.

Nevion is requesting 200,000 Albanian lek (ALL) to prepare the land he owns for planting and also to pay labourers.

This will be Nevion’s second loan with the institution.

loans.use: to prepare the land and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda is 30 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a very hardworking woman. Her working day usually begins early. Umeda feeds milk cows. She sells milk, sour cream and kefir to the local people. Umeda has worked in this field more than four years. She does her job honestly. Her customers like her milk products and buy them with pleasure. 

Umeda is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, soil, etc., as she plans to repair her house. Her house is in bad condition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, soil, etc., as she plans to repair her house

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.en:
Sheraly was born in 1970. He is married and has five children. Two of them are adults and three of them are non-adults. Sheraly always cares about his children. He has been busy with taxi service for the last three years. 

Sheraly’s wife is a farmer. She grows vegetables. They live together happily but poorly as their income is small. Sheraly’s son studies at the university and he must pay for his tuition. Sheraly is asking for a loan of 400 USD to pay for tuition of his son at the university. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for his son's university tuition

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika  is a very dedicated woman who wants to become successful in the future. She studied at the university and had her previous loans from GDMPC, which she used for her studies.

She borrowed this loan recently to pay the school tuition fee for the second semester.  She wants to have a better job after finishing her studies, and she believes that changes someone to become a better person. In the future, she wants to become successful with her family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Her name is Taciana, 61, and she is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio, a seafarer. She has a backyard business to provide for their daily personal and household needs.

Taciana has been a hog raiser for six years already. Investing in a piggery is a good and profitable business as female pigs conceive twice in a year and can produce as many as 12 piglets each time. Aside from this, she also makes rugs for sale.

To help her raise healthy hogs, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she will use to buy more feeds and clean grain. Part of the loan she will use to buy fabrics for her rug-making business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her two businesses and the financial help that will be given her. It will surely help cover their daily living expense. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Taciana aims to grow her business. She prays for good health and to be able to save for their old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feeds for her pigs and some fabric for her rug-making, as well.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is grateful for the 15,000 PHP loan assistance that was extended to her. She has used the loan to buy additional stocks of lumber and grocery items she needed to expand her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan and this time in the amount of PHP 22,000. She will buy additional lumber and groceries needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Catherine hopes that her business will continue to become more successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber and grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Speu province, Chanthorn is 39 years old. She is a mother of two children; one is in school and one is in university.

Nowadays, she can earn income to support her family by raising pigs and growing rice. 

This is the third cycle loan for Chanthorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her loan to pay tuition for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in marketing. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in marketing.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Dukanguke Group

texts.en:
DUKANGUKE is a group led by Phelomene who is 39 years. The group name means “Wake up” in English and she has been a group leader for five years. She sells foodstuffs and she has been in business for 11 years. The members of the group sell different products and they have common goals to scale their business for a better future. 

With the loan, Phelomene would like to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Ansim

texts.en:
Ansim is 51 years old and married with one child. He resides in Ozamiz City with his family.

Ansim has owned and operated a transportation transport service  for years to earn a living. He repaid successfully his previous loan used for buying spare parts and tires. Recently, he took a new loan to cover the cost of repainting and  motor repair of the motorcycle used for the transportation business as well as for his personal use. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repainting and  motor repair for the motorcycle used for his transportation business

loans.name: Javlon

texts.en:
Javlon is 24 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Javlon lives with his parents, wife, children and brother in a house which is located in the North part of Tajikistan. 

He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 5 years. He has additional income from growing vegetables. He is the main provider for the family and his wife and brother help him to manage the business.

Javlon now wants to develop his farming business. He plans to grow onions to sell in a local market. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.en:
Kanykei is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Sociology. Here is her story:

"I am in need of financial assistance in order to pay my tuition fee at AUCA because I have a low-income family. We have a big family of eight: my parents, my grandmother, my three sisters, my brother, and me. My parents don’t have a permanent job, just under-working.  My grandmother is retired and gets a pension, which is the only stable income for our family. It is 98 dollars per month. My elder sister is a student at another university, so it became hard for my family to support two students at the same time. 

Meanwhile, my sister and I work as a housemaids in the summer. Of course, we can’t save much money in 3 months, but it helps us to buy some school stuff and clothes. I understand that AUCA is too expensive a university for me, but now I live and breathe with AUCA.

Last year I was fortunate in winning a donor’s full scholarship to study at the New Generation Academy of AUCA. We got familiar with the AUCA teaching system and learnt languages, math, computer skills, etc. During that year I have so adapted to the AUCA family that I can’t imagine myself out of it. I have a lot of friends from different countries who are also eager to learn something new every day.

This loan will allow me to study hard and focus just on my studies. Meanwhile, this scholarship will support me to do more community service and explore my potential in assisting the needs of my family. "

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Kapture is a typical village in the Nandihills area of Kenya where around 100 families live, suffering from poverty and malnutrition. Most of the people make their livelihood by working as laborers in the agricultural fields belonging to farmers in neighboring and more distant villages. 

Michael is a father of two who has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years. To afford a decent and comfortable life for his children, he has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from his farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, he has been engaging in other small personal businesses. 

The Nandihills area has a high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from his region, Michael finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and he stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” His biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. 

He lacks funds to increase his poultry farming, so he is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being from a marginalized community, he finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, he feels relieved knowing that his dream will be achieved, and he will be able to buy more poultry. 

With the loan, he will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to his neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary man, he intends to accumulate more profits and expand his poultry business to other markets. This will increase his income and improve his living conditions. The extra income he will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing his living conditions, and securing the future of his school-going children.

Help this aspiring man achieve his dreams!

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Savoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Savoeurng is 31 years old. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school while the other two are too young. 

To support her living, she grows rice on a one hectare area as her main source of income, and she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 41,700 KHR per day. 

This is the first time for Savoeurng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her rice farm to be better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham, a husband and father of nine children, is a mixed small-scale farmer based in the remote village of Kapbirsang, Nandi Hills. He has been practicing agricultural business for the past ten years and has never looked back. 

For a living, Abraham sells milk and food products from his farm at the local market. He enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of his products and he really feels satisfied. Although Abraham has been making profits through farming, he has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge he has encountered is a lack of funds to get his business off the ground. 

Abraham is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Nandi Hills and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Abraham does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint. 

With this loan, Abraham is confident that his income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in his life. He plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat on the local market and other major markets in Kenya. He also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on his farm. Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Abraham will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for his farm. Through this loan, he will assure his large family of a secure future and improved living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is a dealer of Avon products like lotion, talc powder, body spray and ladies apparel. She is a fifty-three-year-old married woman residing in Ormoc, Leyte. In addition to that, she raises and sell hogs. She has been engaged in this kind of business for four years already.

She is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy various stocks of Avon and Natasha products like spray, lotion, ladies accessories, and to purchase additional piglets. In a few months, Encarnacion can now deliver and sell a variety of stock to her customers, and in the same manner she could expand her hog raising business as well.

In the future, she is hoping that both her livelihoods will become productive and successful.

loans.use: to buy various stock of Avon and Natasha products like spray, lotion, ladies accessories, and to purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vende quesadillas y pupusas, elabora las quesadillas en un horno artesanal y luego sale a venderlas, con estas actividades puede generar ingresos con los que cumple con sus compromisos; es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales 4 son independientes y solo uno vive con ella.
Construirá una galera para ampliar el espacio de la pupuseria, ofrecerá mejor servicio a sus clientes al momento de consumir sus productos, se protegerán de las condiciones climáticas, espera tener nuevos ingresos con los que cancelara el pago de la deuda y cubrirá las necesidades familiares.
Las aspiraciones son seguir fortaleciendo su fuente de ingresos para tener un mejor futuro junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María sells quesadillas and pupusas.  She makes her quesadillas in an artisanal oven and then goes out to sell them.  With this job she can generate income in order to take care of her responsibilities.  She is the mother of five children, four of whom are grown up, and only one of whom lives with her.

She is going to build a hut to increase the space of her pupusa shop.  She will offer better service to her customers, protecting them from the weather while they are eating her products.  She hopes to have new earnings with which she can pay off debt and take care of her family’s needs.

Her aspirations include strengthening her source of income in order to have a better future, along with her family.

loans.use: to build a hut in order to increase the space of her pupusa shop and offer better service to her customers when they are eating her products

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 35 years old and he lives in Artashat city in the Ararat region. Edgar has a higher education with a specialty in law, and for several years he worked at the bank as a lawyer, but now he has his own business. 

He says that his private business is, of course, entirely different from his specialty and from the work that he did at the bank, but nevertheless it brings good income for his family. 

He buys a lot of different citrus fruits and sells them at the local wholesale market. He keeps all of the fruit (oranges, lemons, grapefruit, bananas and pineapple) at a rented garage and sells it over time. 

Edgar is married and he has two school-aged children. He asks for this loan because he wants to buy a lot of citrus fruits. It is the best time for him to store great quantities of fruit, because with the coming of the New Year holidays the demand for citrus fruit is great.

loans.use: to buy a lot of citrus fruits, because with the coming of the New Year holidays, the demand is great.

loans.name: Aem's Group

texts.en: A farmer from Kampong Cham province, Aem is 43 years old and a mother of six children. To support her family, she grows cassava on one hectare of land and works as a construction worker to earn extra income. This is Aem's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can get higher yields than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide for farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, age 34, runs his own Zoona mobile money-transfer business in the small town of Luanshya, Zambia. He is the oldest in a family of five and lives in a rented house with three of his siblings whom he looks after. Stephen runs a mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial services to people in his community.

Stephen is happy with his business; he says the mobile money transfer business has helped him to serve his community, learn new ways of interacting with people and support his siblings with their school fees.

With his first Kiva loan, Stephen was able to purchase a trading booth, which he uses to serve his customers. He was also able to increase his mobile money float, thereby serving even more customers. He saw his profits grow, and was able to save up some money to open one more Zoona mobile money outlet at a place called Baluba in his hometown of Luanshya. 

Stephen is now requesting a subsequent Kiva loan to help him serve his customers faster. He would like to get a loan so that he can increase the money that he uses to serve customers at his Baluba outlet. This will help him grow his capital base and serve customers more efficiently. Stephen thanks his Kiva lenders for the financial assistance that has changed his life for the better. Stephen uses the profits from his loans to support his siblings. He is hopeful that once he starts to earn more profits, he can move out of their family home and get his own place. He looks forward to expanding his business to improve the quality of life for his family and community.

loans.use: To ensure that he has enough money to fulfill customer transactions. This will help him grow his business

loans.name: Sara Evelyn

texts.es:
Sara, de 37 años de edad, es promotora de salud y su nivel de estudio es hasta bachillerato, luego decidió aprender a trabajar para ayudarle a su familia en los gastos de la casa, está casada y junto con su esposo tienen 3 hijos de 14, 9 y 3 años de edad, solo 2 están estudiando pero los 3 dependen de ella, su esposo trabaja como motorista en una unidad de trasporte, mientras que Sara trabaja como promotora de salud desde hace 15 años, trabajo que lo aprendió por la misma necesidad que tenían sus padres, para apoyarles más económicamente y para que tanto ella como sus padres tuvieran una mejor calidad de vida.

Para llegar a su trabajo Sara camina 1 kilómetro, trabaja en el horario de 8:00 am hasta el mediodía o hasta tarde (no tiene hora de salida), el préstamo que está solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de pintura, cerámica, pecamix y para pago de mano de obra ya que ha decidió arreglar su vivienda, Sara sueña con que sus hijos estudien, tener un carro para trasladarse y tener una granja de gallinas.
texts.en:
Sara, age 37, is a public health worker.  She finished high school and then decided to learn to work in order to help her family with the household expenses.  She is married and together with her husband has three children, ages 3, 9, and 14.  Only two of them are in school, but all three are her dependents.  Her husband works as a driver in a transportation unit, while Sara has worked as a public health worker for 15 years.  It is a job that she learned out of the same necessity her parents had—in order to better support them financially and so that she, as well as her parents, could have a better quality of life.

In order to get to work, Sara walks a kilometer.  She works from 8 a.m. until noon or later (she doesn’t have a specific quitting time).  The loan that she is asking for from Credicampo is to buy paint, ceramic tile, and instant mortar, and also to pay for labor costs because she has decided to fix her home.  Sara dreams of keeping her kids in school, having a car for commuting, and having a chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy paint, ceramic tile, and instant mortar, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Felipe Alberto

texts.es:
Con amplias ganas de superación surgió Felipe Alberto en el negocio.  Desde sus 22 años ha sentido un gran interés por generar ingresos que le ayuden a ser propietario de su propia empresa. Hoy en día con 37 años de edad trabaja con las mismas fuerzas y empeño para lograr sus sueños. Con el fin de  ofrecer más variedad de producto  en su pequeña pulpería es por eso que solicita el préstamo para suministrar  más mercancías  y surtir  el negocio, el cual tiene mayor demanda en esta etapa de fin de año.
A Felipe le encantaría extender su mercado y  darlo a conocer  en toda la ciudad y sus alrededores. Ha  logrado comprobar los buenos resultados de su consistencia a pesar de todas las dificultades e insiste en que abastecer las exigencias de todos sus clientes es su prioridad. También pretende que con el pequeño negocio pueda finalmente  mejorar las condiciones de su propio hogar y así realizar una de sus mayores sueños.
texts.en:
With a great desire for self-improvement, Felipe Alberto emerged into the world of business. Since he was 22 years old, he has been very interested in generating income, something that has helped him become the owner of his own business. Now Felipe is 37 and works just as hard and with the same amount of determination to fulfil his dreams.  With the aim of being able to offer a greater variety of products in his small local convenience store, he is asking for a loan to offer more merchandise and to stock his business, which is busier at this time of year. 

Felipe would love to expand his client base and make his business well known all over the city and surrounding areas. He has managed to prove his good level of consistency despite all the difficulties and he insists that satisfying all of his clients' demands is his priority. He also aims to use his little business to be able to finally improve the conditions of his own home and therefore make one of his greatest dreams a reality.

loans.use: to offer more merchandise and to stock the business.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Meet 25 year old Lawrence. He is the fourth born in a family of seven. He is a proud emerging entrepreneur running his own mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial services to people in his community. He operates his business in Mazabuka, Zambia.

Lawrence used his first Kiva loan to start running his Zoona mobile money transfer business. The loan helped him to purchase a trading booth, which he uses to serve his customers’ money sending needs. He also bought a mobile phone, which he uses to facilitate his transactions. Lawrence is now able to support his siblings. He sends half of his profits to help out with their needs; the other half is what he uses for his basic needs. This is not easy as he is not making much profit and he struggles to provide for everybody’s needs. 

Lawrence is now applying for a second Kiva loan, which he plans to use to finance his business by adding to his working capital float. This is the money that he uses to serve customers on a daily basis. Currently Lawrence is operating his business with a minimum capital of $950 USD. This is not enough to serve customers who need to transact larger amounts of money. This loan will help Lawrence to fulfill some of his customers’ transactions. This then helps to increase his commissions, which he depends on for his income. He is hopeful that this loan will help him grow his business, as he will be able to serve more customers. Lawrence currently works alone at his trading booth.  He hopes to employ youth from his community as his business grows.

Lawrence’s dream is to become a successful businessman and reach out to more rural areas where people do not have access to banking services.

loans.use: To provide essential transaction cash needed for him to grow his business

loans.name: God's Grace School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Kanan. He is the Head teacher of God’s Grace Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Lugazi in Mukono with 400 students. God’s Grace Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

God’s Grace Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Kanan ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Little Angels School

texts.en:

Little Angels Infants School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. Sarah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

texts.en:

Karen Schools has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The schools do not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Karen Schools will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term.This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Margret ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Right Way School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Twaha. He is the Head teacher of Right Way Nursery and primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Bulenga in Wakiso with 200 students. Right Way Nursery and primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The schools do not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Right Way Nursery and primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Twaha ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Malga Yoaba Group

texts.fr: Malga Yoaba est a son deuxième prêt avec kiva. Christine, responsable du groupe et tous les autres membres remercient tous les prêteurs pour leur soutien financier. Ce groupe a bien fait le remboursement de leur prêt, il fait d'ailleurs parti des bons clients de ACFIME. Christine est une veuve mais très battante. Avec le prêt passé, elle a pu faire son commerce de légumes et s'occuper chaque jour de sa famille. Selon son témoignage, les bénéfices lui ont permis d'acheter un sac de riz de 50 kg qui coûte 17 500 francs CFA. En plus de cela, elle s'est occupe de ses enfants sur tous les plans(santé, habillement,...). A la rentrée scolaire, elle a pu inscrire 2 enfants et les 3 autres ont été envoyé pour apprendre des métiers( couture, coiffure et la mécanique). Christine a encore besoin de ce prêt pour continuer son commerce de légumes. Les bénéfices après vente lui permettront de s'occuper de ses enfants et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Malga Yoaba is on its second loan with Kiva. Christine, as the representative of the group, together with the other members, thanks all of the lenders for their financial support.

This group successfully repaid their previous loan. Additionally, they are clients in good standing of ACFIME. 

Christine is a widow but a fighter. With her previous loan, she was able to sell vegetables and to provide for her family's daily needs. According to her, the funds allowed her to purchase one 50-kg bag of rice, which cost 17,500 francs CFA. In addition, she was able to provide for all of her children's needs (health, clothing, etc.)

At the beginning of the school year, Christine as able to enroll 2 children, and her other 3 children were sent to learn various trades (tailor, hairdressing, and mechanics.) 

Christine needs another loan in order to continue her vegetable business. The profits after her resale will allow her to provide for her children and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Victor  Hugo

texts.es: Victor de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de sandia, plátanos y maíz desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, Victor esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para el cultivo de plátanos y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Victor is 47 years old and lives in his own home along with his family. He has been growing watermelons, bananas, and corn for several years. Victor sells his products at the different markets.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies for cultivating bananas. As a result, he can generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies for cultivating bananas.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo was born in 1958. She is married and has 3 children. Marhabo is a highly educated person. She works in a local school and also she is busy with animal husbandry. She works hard and tries to provide better living conditions for her family. She sells cattle in a local market. 

Marhabo is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy coal to keep her house warm in the winter season. She awaits your mercy and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy coal to keep her house warm in the winter season.

loans.name: Oktovianus

texts.en:
Oktovianus is a 28-year-old single man. He still lives with his parents, Lazarus, 50, a farmer and Elizabeth, 48, a housewife. Oktovianus feels very responsible to help his parents in fulfilling their family's needs. He has been working as a taxi motorcycle driver since 2009 by using his own motorcycle. His income per day averages 40,000 – 50,000 IDR.
 
Oktovianus wants to start a business selling vegetables. He needs extra capital to start the business. He requested an individual loan from TLM for 3,000,000 IDR. The purpose of the loan is to purchase vegetables such as mustard vegetables, leaf vegetables, spinach, tomatoes, etc.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as mustard vegetables, leaf vegetables, spinach, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married and has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle, which he has been doing for six years. His business is located in a strategic location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

Charles requested a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to enable him farm. His business goal is to have a large scale business within five years.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as honest. 

Peter operates a bicycle repair business, and he has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy tools for repairing bicycles. His business goal is to expand within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing bicycles

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a Kiva borrower with 4 children. He describes himself as honest. 

Charles operates a farm where he grows coffee and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are large-scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable him to increase production. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable him to increase production

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida is widowed. She was born in 1990. Saida has a little child. She lives in her parents’ house. Her parents help her to provide her child with all necessary things but their income is small and so they live poorly. Saida is going to start her own business with animal husbandry. She hopes her business will go well as she lives in the countryside. She studied at the course, "To Get Ahead", a women's organization and got a certificate. Saida is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing new business

loans.name: Sarey's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Sarey is 41 years old and a mother of four children. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income. Also, she can earn more income as a motor taxi driver. 

This is Sarey's third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She leads a group of two members to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to rent a harvest machine. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: To rent a harvest machine.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Ty, 43, is the mother of two dependent children living in Battambang province.

For her living, she grows rice as a single source of income. She can earn income of about 30,000 KHR per day. For Ty, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan.

As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farmland

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Farming, also called agriculture or husbandry, is the cultivation of animals and plants for food and other products used to sustain life. Agriculture in Kenya continues to dominate Kenya’s economy, and is also the largest contributor to Kenya’s gross domestic product. Philip, 34, started farming approximately six years ago, and although he began farming as a hobby, it eventually became his career. His half-acre of land located in the Nandihills area of Kenya houses poultry and dairy cows. Philip passionately loves poultry farming. The Nandihills area is populated, and has a ready market for poultry products. However, Philip' biggest challenge is lack of funds, which is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy poultry. Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and you don’t need to be a large scale farmer to benefit from it. Through the loan, Philip will be able to sell eggs, meat, and poultry feathers to the already existing market.
