Nadia is a 44-year-old married mother of two children who started two years ago to prepare and sell “mouneh,” or preserved food, from her house to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business.

Nadia will use her portion of the group loan from the Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary raw materials such as olives, eggplants, fruits, and other products. Her loan will help her increase her production, satisfy her customers, and increase her income. Nadia is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Asmahan is the lady standing in the middle, and Nadia is the lady standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy olives, eggplants, and fruits to preserve

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be focused and determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are commuters. 

Gabriel will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy tuk tuk spare parts to sell. His business goal is to own at least five tuk tuks within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy tuk tuk (three-wheeled vehicle) spare parts to sell

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a married woman. She has seven children, and she describes herself to be honest and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Ezekiel Danjuma

texts.en: Ezekiel Danjuma is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ezekiel Danjuma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ezekiel Danjuma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ezekiel Danjuma is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba was born in 1973 and is married with two children. For the last 15 years, she has been buying and selling fruit in the local market. Mahbuba is a businesswoman who sells a variety of fruits and products such as apples, bananas, and pies. She is a hardworking and industrious woman and a very careful and responsible mother. 

Mahbuba is requesting a 4,000 TJS loan to buy fruit. She will use her loan to increase her working capital because there is great demand for fruit in the New Year season. Mahbuba awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 32 years old. He is married, with four children aged between two and eight years, all of whom go to school. 

Samuel has a shop and he has been in a business for 12 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business and to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Luz Enith

texts.es: Luz Enith, es una emprendedora mujer de 32 años, ella se desempeñó en el área de ventas en empresas por muchos años y a raíz de su experiencia comercial, decidió montar su propio negocio en el año 2002. Con ayuda de su cónyuge y unos ahorros invirtió en la compra de unas lavadoras para prestar en alquiler, con tanto éxito que hoy día tiene 20 lavadoras al servicio del público, aunque paralelo a esta actividad también se dedica a la comercialización de electrodomésticos por encargo.  Sus principales clientes son los vecinos y habitantes del barrio en el que reside en el municipio de Barranquilla, quienes cancelan los servicios de alquiler de lavadoras de contado.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en electrodomésticos y juguetería para la temporada de fin de año. Ella nos manifiesta que para la época del año que se avecina, se incrementa la demanda de estos artículos. Ella es madre de dos hijas, a quienes desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, por eso como meta familiar estableció tener su casa propia y brindar una educación de calidad a sus hijas.  El mayor desafío que tiene en su negocio es la gran competencia que existe en el mercado de los electrodomésticos, sin embargo ella considera que con su buen servicio ha logrado fidelizar a sus clientes y contrarrestar estas debilidades.
texts.en: Luz Enith, 32, has long worked in sales and decided, in 2002, to start her own business buying and selling products and services.  She and her husband bought washing machines and rented them for a profit.  She's grown the business over the years and now has 20 washing machines for rent.  She sells washing machines, as well.  She draws most of her customers from her neighborhood in Barranquilla and requires her customers to pay in cash.  Luz Enith is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that she will use to by washing machines and toys for resale over the coming holiday weeks. Demand for washing machines and toys will increase, she says, and she wants to be ready to meet it.  Luz Enith has two daughters and wants to provide them with everything she can.  She hopes to buy a house and ensure that her daughters get good educations.  The biggest challenge her business faces, she says, is competition from other similar businesses and she has to provide excellent customer service to keep her customers.

loans.use: to buy washing machines and toys for retail business.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud, 50, is a father of seven (in the above picture is one of the sons). He is a smallholder farmer residing in Kitale, an agricultural town in the North Rift region of Kenya. He is arguably among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. Tomatoes are Eliud’s flagship produce. He sells more than 10 kgs of tomatoes every day.

Back in 2000, Eliud practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. He was doing only half an acre of maize crop per season. The returns were so meager that he could barely fend for survival. Eliud kept doing maize farming for years without turning a profit until 2011, when he switched to tomato farming and there was light at the end of the tunnel for him. 

Today, Eliud is a full-fledged entrepreneur. He has been provided with technical guidance, training programs and exposure visits. He has already fully serviced other asset-based loans from Juhudi Kilimo! Through the loans, he has acquired high quality dairy cows, irrigation kits and poultry.

To capitalize more on returns from the booming tomato farming, Eliud is seeking a loan of KES 70,000 to build a greenhouse. Unlike his competition, Eliud conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high quality produce. By doing this, he has created a name for himself and a demand for his produce. 

Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of Eliud’s goal, which is to expand the greenhouse. In the future, he is also planning to introduce the zero grazing method, intensify his maize farming, and start value addition.

Eliud patiently waits for your kindness!

loans.use: To build a green house

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman, and she has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a hair dryer. Her business goal is to open another salon in the area within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger salon. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Yimi Rafael

texts.es:
Yimi vive con su pareja y tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 11 años, vive felizmente junto con su familia en zona rural del municipio de Sampues.

En la actualidad ya cumplió 2 años de estar trabajando con la cría de cerdos de engorde, actividad con la que ha intentado sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia para que nunca les falte nada. 

Ha tenido dificultades económicas que han afectado su negocio y que lo han obligado a detener sus actividades en ciertas ocasiones. 

Sueña con mejorar el lugar para la cría de sus animales y también con tener una planta de engorde de cerdos, por esto pasa la solicitud de un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra cerdos de engorde los cuales tienen muy buena aceptación por la buena crianza y mantenimiento de los mismos. 

Su calidad de vida  y la de su familia mejorara en la medida que aumentan las ventas de sus animales y alcance las metas establecidas para  un futuro no lejano.

Con el apoyo de este préstamo Yimi podrá continuar trabajando y podrá darle a su familia todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Yimi lives with his companion and they have two children, 8 and 11.  He lives happily with his family in a rural area of the town of Sampués.

Currently he has been working for two years raising pigs to fatten.  He has tried to get his family ahead with this job so they never lack anything.  He has had financial problems that have affected his business and occasionally forced him to stop working.

Yimi dreams of improving the place where he raises his animals and of having a plant for fattening pigs, which are well received because he raises and maintains them well.  That's why he's requesting a loan to invest in buying pigs to fatten.

Yimi will be able to keep on working and give his family all the best with the support of this loan.  His quality of life and his family's will improve with the increase in sales of his animals, and he'll reach his set goals in the near future.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for home ownership papers, which the government recently made mandatory

loans.name: Shaaibu

texts.en: Shaaibu is a maize farmer from Gabas village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shaaibu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shaaibu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Shaaibu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hadiza

texts.en: Hadiza is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hadiza joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Rufa, Basiru, and Micah. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hadiza would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hadiza can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hadiza spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Anas, Suleiman, and Shafiu.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yakubu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.en:
Abdumavlon is a hardworking man. He is married and has a daughter. He has a café where he serves the local people. He cooks a variety of Tajik national dishes. 

Abdumavlon always cares of his daughter. His daughter studies at the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. He must pay for education of his daughter, but he does not have enough money. Abdumavlon thanks Kiva and all lenders for their help and mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI; él socio sigue dedicándose a su negocio de artesanía como en la elaboración de chompas de alpaca, él socio vende su mercadería a todos sus cliente que le solicitan, él socio desea que su negocio cresca, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de lanas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank “Yahuar Maqui”. He continues to manage his business of making handicrafts, such as alpaca wool sweaters. He sells his merchandise to all of his customers who request them. The borrower wants to grow his business so that he can help his family get ahead.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy wool and other supplies. The borrower appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy wool and other supplies.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre muy responsable de 2 hijos, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace 5 años montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 

Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Carmen también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro económico estable. 

Con tu aporte Carmen Podrá progresar en su negocio!
texts.en:
Carmen has 2 children.  She has faced many obstacles in life, but has always found the strength to overcome them and move her family ahead.  She started a business selling eggs 5 years ago and keeps hens to supply it.  

Carmen wants to grow her business and knows that she can be successful with a little help from Corporación Interactuar and the people who support its mission.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy more hens and, in turn, increase her egg production.  The investment will help her to meet local demand for eggs and increase her sales.

Carmen hopes to go on building her business because it is her means of moving her family ahead and ensuring that she and her children have a more stable future.

Please support Carmen with your loans!

loans.use: to buy poultry for her poultry business.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
This is Emine and her husband, Haidar. They are retired and live in a house owned by one of their sons. Their incomes are their pensions: 139 USD and 144 USD and they receive some money from their three sons who have been living and working in Italy for a long time. Haidar is been scheduled for prostate surgery immediately. He has been in excruciating pain lately and says, “My matter is urgent; I can’t sleep and stand still at all. I have so much pains that I can’t put up any longer. I would very much appreciate lender’s financial help.” 

Emine is requesting a loan to pay for her husband’s surgery. They have been VisionFund clients for a long time and have an excellent credit history.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's surgery

loans.name: Concessa

texts.en:
Concessa is 42 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of 7 and 23 years. All of her children go to school. She has a shop and has been in business for 20 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, biscuits, and rice for sale in her shop. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, biscuits and rice for sale.

loans.name: Halime

texts.en:
This is Halime, standing up in the cold and muddy weather outside her home. She is 52 and a mother of a 22-year-old son who helps her in the agricultural activity. Halime wants to buy a dairy cow. 

According to loan analysis tools, Halime falls below the poverty level and this start-up loan that she is seeking, in the amount of ALL 100,000 (Albanian Lek), will help her stand above that. She will sell raw milk and baby calves to earn some extra cash for her family. 

To date, Halime has been doing only agriculture, planting and selling beans, potatoes, onions, and some medicinal plants.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris is a maize farmer from Sabon Gida village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idris would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idris can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Idris, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim Magaji

texts.en:
Ibrahim Magaji is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim Magaji joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Saratu, Mercy and Lovy.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim Magaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim Magaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ibrahim Magaji spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Reema

texts.en:
Reema is 27-year-old woman who is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, Reema’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw. His rickshaw is not working properly because of how long it has been in use. Reema’s husband feels that most of its parts are out of order and he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw, but due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost.

Reema is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Her loan will help him to continue his business. Reema is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Musa, Rahama and Laazarus.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hauwa spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, and hoping eventually to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

Shehu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Shehu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Zakari and Yusufa.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Yusha'U, Nehemiah, and Nancy.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell her corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel cuenta con 47 años de vida y en los últimos 3 se ha dedicado a ganarse la vida como jornalero y encargado de válvulas en un proyecto de agua cercano, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Él es un hombre responsable que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 3 años junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos 3 varones de 15, 10 y 2 años y una niña de 14 años de edad. Miguel desea que su familia tenga un poco más de comodidades en su vivienda, ya que sabe que esta no cuenta con  las condiciones necesarias para habitar, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillos y hierro para construir dos paredes en su vivienda, y así poder darle más comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 47 years old. For the past three years, he has been earning his living as a laborer and by monitoring the valves at a nearby water project. These activities allow him to sustain his household finances.

Miguel is a responsible man who has been living in his own home for the past three years along with his life companion and their four children: three sons (ages 15, 10, and 12) and a 14-year-old daughter. He wants his family to be a bit more comfortable at home. Miguel knows that they do not have the necessary conditions in which to live. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build two walls in his home. This will help his family be more comfortable and secure.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build two walls in his home.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
El señor Jhon desde muy joven se dedica a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando algunos lotes de ganado que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.

Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar podrá llegar muy lejos.
texts.en:
Jhon has worked from a very young age in rural activities such agriculture and animal raising. His father taught him so that he could get ahead in life.

Nowadays his main business is agriculture and ranching. His goal is to improve capital by purchasing some batches of cattle that will allow him to stock up and generate better income. This is why he is requesting the loan.

He is a responsible, loving father to his children. He lives on a farm with the children and his wife, who has been his greatest companion.

He dreams of being able to give his children a quality education so they may be able to stand up for themselves later in life and be independent.  

Jhon manages his business every day seeking to do very well, and he knows that with the support of Interactuar corporation, he will go far.

loans.use: to buy batches of cattle.

loans.name: Agripina's Group

texts.en:
Agripina is a 49-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Agripina has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming trainings.

Agripina described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Agripina’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en:
Usaini is a maize farmer from the village Mayau Rumi in the state of Kaduna. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Usaini, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Iliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yishau, Danladi, and Cyrus. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Iliya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, and his hope to eventually ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer from Juri village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Isiyaku, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joseah

texts.en:
Joseah is a farmer full of dreams and hopes in his life. He wants to get his family ahead by the sweat on his brow. He is a smallholder farmer residing in Litein, an agricultural town in the North Rift region of Kenya. Joseah is arguably among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. 

Agriculture is his family's occupation and also the primary source of income for his family. Joseah owns half an acre of land in the village and cultivates tea and maize. He has always been proud to call himself a farmer and, now, he is even more proud to call himself a dairy farmer. 

Joseah is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge he has of farming, he commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. Dairy farming is close to his heart and, every day, he wakes up to milk his cow and that makes him very proud. 

Although he makes profits through selling milk, Joseah lacks a proper dairy unit and he is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan, he will have an easier time milking his cow and also feeding it. 

A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Joseah believes that, through this loan, his living conditions will change because he is going to have an increase in milk production. He will save money that he used to spend on treating his cows because he lacked a good dairy unit.

Joseah's only objective is to progress and care for his family, which is what lifts his fighting and vigorous spirit.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother. She has been selling envelopes for photographs, dry cells for cameras, and stationery at both retail and wholesale for the last fifteen years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income. 

She has requested for a loan of UGX 1,800,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more dry cells, envelopes and binding tape for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to own a big shop. The weekly repayment program attracted her to join MCDT. She lives in her house with access to electricity, but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more dry cells, envelopes and binding tape to sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 22 años de edad y junto a su nieta de 6 años de edad. María se gana la vida por medio de la prestación de servicios domésticos y por medio de su negocio de confección de ropa. Ella desea reparar el techo de la cocina para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, etc. Espera poder contar con esta financiamiento y de esta forma dar  a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and lives in her own house with her 22-year-old daughter and her 6-year-old granddaughter. Maria makes her living by providing domestic services and by making clothing. She has decided to request this loan from FUSAI, which will be spent on galvanized metal, wood, etc., because she would like to repair her kitchen ceiling. She hopes to be able to use this loan to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal, wood, etc., to repair the kitchen ceiling

loans.name: Evilen Andrea

texts.es:
Evilen es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo brindándole una educación de buena calidad.

Evilen vive en unión libre con su pareja y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Evilen tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Evilen works hard and says that her hard work has provided her with the means to give her son a very good education.  She lives with her partner and has a business buying personal products from catalogs and reselling them to her customers.  She has overcome many obstacles to make the business a success.  

Evilen is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business.  The investment will help her to buy products that she needs to fill orders that she has already received.

Evilen wants to grow her business because it is her means of paying for her son's schooling and ensuring that her little family has a steady income.  She knows that she can be successful with Interactuar's help.

loans.use: to stock her personal products sales business.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is a 45-year-old married woman doing the business of cattle purchasing and sale with the help of her husband of many years. She looks after the cattle and her husband sells them in different markets. Their business provides them enough to meet their day to day family expenditures. Aziz is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more cattle including baby goats and calves to extend their business. She is hopeful that their business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle including baby goats and calves to extend business.

loans.name: Marlady

texts.es:
Marlady inicio la venta de variedades específicamente accesorios, hace meses atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga, buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y como mujer pujante y emprendedora busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por su hijo de 16 años. 

Debido al costo de vida tan alto, Marlady se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos, es por este motivo que necesita un apoyo económico que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de accesorios y lociones para añadirlos a su portafolio de productos de uso personal.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén con gran variedad de productos y sabe que está por buen camino de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Marlady started selling a variety of products, including accessories, some months ago. She learned this activity thanks to a friend. She sought this activity as an alternative of generating money.  As a vibrant and enterprising woman she is desperately seeking sustenance for her home and 16 year old son.

Due to the high cost of living, Marlady sees the need to generate more income.  It is for this reason that she needs economic assistance that will help improve the variety of products displayed and offered to her customers door to door.

She is asking for a loan to purchase accessories and lotions to add to her portfolio of products for personal use.

Her main dream is to become the owner of a store with a variety of products.  She knows that she is on track with the help of the Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy accessories and lotions to add to her product portfolio

loans.name: Marisol Eugenia

texts.es: Marisol de 35 años de edad es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar por medio de su negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que buscan sus productos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre, una persona de la tercera edad que ella apoya con las ganancias de su negocio en todos los gastos del hogar. Marisol desea invertir en su negocio, ya que sabe que si compra los productos directamente su margen de ganancia es mejor y puede vender una mayor cantidad de productos, por lo que ha tomado a decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas, lociones, desodorantes, maquillaje, mascara de pestañas, labiales, etc.
texts.en: Marisol is 35 years old and is an admirable woman who works hard to support her household through her catalog sales of beauty products.  She has been doing this for 8 years and has a good number of customers who seek her products.  She lives in a home of her own with her mother, an elderly lady who she cares for and uses the earnings from her business to pay the household expenses.  Marisol wants to invest in her business and she knows that she can get a better deal if she buys her products directly and she can sell more products.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy creams, lotions, deodorants, makeup, mascara, lipstick, etc.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a married woman doing a business selling milk for the past three years with the help of her husband. They sell it to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese, that they make from the milk to increase their profits. Their business is good enough for them to lead a decent life. 

Azra is a mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow to increase their revenue. They are hopeful to have an increase in their production capacity, which will ultimately help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow to increase their revenue.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas e su moto-taxi a través de las veredas del municipio de San Rafael posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es soltero y sostiene a su madre a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su moto-taxi ya que es su único medio de trabajo.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.

Apoya a Luis con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Luis is an organized, hard-working man who makes a living taxiing passengers around San Rafael in his moto-taxi.  He is friendly, courteous and enterprising.  Luis is single and supports his mother who, he says, has always tried to provide for him in the very best way possible.  

Luis is applying for a loan that he will use to repair and maintain his moto-taxi.  His taxi business is his only source of income and the loan will allow him to improve the condition of the vehicle and provide his passengers with a safe and comfortable service.

Please help Luis carry on his business with your loans!

loans.use: to repair and maintain his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer de 45 años de edad, soltera y vive sola. 

Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de mercancía por como ropa, calzado y accesorios; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el su sustento. 

Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 

Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de mercancía (ropa, perfumería, accesorios, lencería) con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son amigos y vecinos. 

Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 45 year old woman, single and who lives alone.

Currently, she earns a living by selling merchandise such as clothing, footwear and accessories.  This activity was initiated with the support of a family member.  With this business she has managed to earn income to support her livelihood.

She is a fighter and an entrepreneurial person, wanting to get ahead and continue with her business endeavors.

She is requesting a loan with Corporacion Interactuar, and she wants to invest it by purchasing merchandise supplies (clothing, perfumes, accessories, lingerie) to have the opportunity to increase sales by offering greater variety of products to meet different tastes and requirements to her customers who are mainly friends and neighbours.

Her greatest dream is to have a large supply of merchandise, and expand her portfolio with her good customers and increase sales, so that she can have a better livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise supplies (clothing, perfumes, accessories, lingerie)

loans.name: Sattan

texts.en: Sattan is a 39-year-old married woman who purchases and sells livestock with the help of her husband. Their business provides them with enough to meet their daily expenses. Sattan is a mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. Therefore she wants to earn much more. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more livestock such as baby goats, calves etc. to boost earnings. She is hopeful that their business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock such as baby goats, calves etc. to boost earnings

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 35-year-old married woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started her business of cloth selling. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children by helping to provide for them. Robina is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently, she needs a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase high-quality cloth for the winter season in different colors and styles. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality cloth for the winter season in different colors and styles

loans.name: Samaila Nigger

texts.en: Samaila Nigger is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila Nigger joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yusuf, Kabiru and Shehu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila Nigger would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila Nigger can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  Samaila Nigger spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices after harvest.

loans.name: Carmen  Maria

texts.es:
Carmen María es una joven estudiante que ha logrado absorber el ejemplo de pasión al conocimiento y al aprendizaje, inculcado por sus padres. A su corta edad de 25 años, cursa el quinto y último año de su carrera. Y aunque piensa mucho en convertirse pronto en una  profesional teme que sus ingresos actuales no serán suficientes para abastecer los gastos de su finalización de año. Solicita el préstamo para pagos de titulación, Impresiones de tesis, empastado del documento final y costos de la defensa.
Luego de utilizar este préstamo, Carmen  desea seguir siendo una joven emprendedora y capaz. Piensa descubrir más oportunidades de desarrollo personal en la educación y elevar su mirada a otras maestrías o especialidades de su carrera. Inmediatamente planea ejercer su título en el campo de su carrera y dedicarse a su familia quienes han sido su  apoyo  incondicional.
texts.en:
Carmen María, 25, is a young student who has absorbed an extraordinary passion for knowledge and learning from her parents.  She is starting the fifth and final year of her degree and is applying for a loan to cover costs she will incur over the year: university fees; the costs of copying her thesis; binding costs for her final paper; and costs related to defending her thesis.  

Carmen hopes to continue with her education in future years, with an eye to other specialties related to her master's degree.  For the immediate future, she plans to find work in her chosen profession and help provide for her family who, she says, have supported her unconditionally.

loans.use: to pay tuition and other education-related costs.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en: Sebastian, 65, is a father who makes a living doing mixed farming in Kanyekiini village located in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. He keeps dairy goats and poultry for commercial milk and eggs respectively. Besides mixed-farming, Sebastian is also very concerned about the health of the environment. He spends most of his time working on his tree seedling yard. He stated that the tree nursery is very demanding. He spends a lot of time working in the nursery because he lacks proper equipment. Sebastian is seeking a KES 10,000 loan to purchase farm implements. These tools will make the work on his farm move much faster and easier. Tending to his tree nursery involves a lot of digging, uprooting, planting and packaging. There are various tools in the market that are handy for a man in his line of work. The equipment does not come cheap, however. The increase in income from this investment will go to his family's welfare and his child's education.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Al Faras Group

texts.en:
Sobhiya is the featured borrower for Al Faras Group. She joined with her other group members to take out this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living standards at the same time.
Sobhiya is a 43-year-old married mother of six children and a Palestinian refugee. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, 10 years ago she started tailoring from her house to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.
Today, Sobhiya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying a new tailoring machine which will facilitate her work and provide her customers with better and quicker service.
Sobhiya is the first lady on the left of the phot,. Kamela is the second from the left, Ghazwa is on the right, and Zainab is the second from the right.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Abdulmunmuni

texts.en: Abdulmunmuni is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulmunmuni would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulmunmuni can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Abdulmunmuni is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices after harvest.
